loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto O. is 41 years old and manages a small rice farm. He has been growing rice for eight years. He has enough experience already and wishes to improve his harvest. He says that, by tilling the farm, he can earn 42,000 Philippines pesos (Php) from the harvest. Farming is what he relies on for his family's daily basic needs.

He would like to apply for a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc., a Kiva partner. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest. He likes the CEVI program because it doesn’t only provide loans, but education as well for all of them.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude M. is an elderly married woman who has no children of her own. She has sold clothes, such as jackets, shirts, and pullovers, to the local people for the last eight years. Her business is located at the Miritini estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attraction sites as well as its white beaches on the Indian ocean.

Getrude says that this business is profitable, but that her major challenge is that many people in the coastal region may not buy her items if the prices are high. People may not see some of her items as necessities, since the coastal region is usually very humid. 

Getrude works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) to add to her stock to expand her business and even open a boutique some day. She sees herself owning five stalls, well stocked with fashionable clothes. She describes herself as a very aggressive businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy jackets, pullovers, shirts, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold S., 36 years old, is a rice farmer. For fifteen years, he has been tilling the wet field so that he would be able to provide his family an adequate supply of food, clothing, and other basic needs. He has three children. His eldest child is 16 and the youngest is only 2. 

He wants his children to successfully finish their studies, which is why he ventures into this business. He joined CEVI because it helps him augment his financial capability so that he was able to buy fertilizer for his rice field. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Teresita is married and has 7 children. Her eldest is 29 years old and the youngest is 12. To make a living, Teresita raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Teresita also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She helps keep it free of weeds and pests.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase livestock feed and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosaleen

texts.en:
Rosaleen F. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old. Rosaleen is married and has two children aged 12 and 7. To make a living, Rosaleen raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosaleen also manages a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products.

Rosaleen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosaleen has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosaleen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe JIGUISSEME sont mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers  en générale, tel la vente de légumes  avec  MARIAM S., la  vente de pagnes, de  poisson fumé etc.
MARIAM S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  une quantité importante de légumes de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne essentiellement  dans les villages voisins, auprès des producteurs et effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA  qui  sera utilisé  dans les dépenses quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en: The six women of the JIGUISSEME group are married and are, on average, 33 years old with 3 children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).  They have had eight loans with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and all preceding loans have been repaid.  This group of women is active in the retail commerce of various items, such as the  vegetables sold by MARIAM S., pagnes (a colorful West African cloth), smoked fish etc.  MARIAM S. plans to buy a considerable quantity of different types of vegetables with her loan. She gets her stock primarily from producers in neighboring villages and sells them for retail prices, on credit or in cash, to a clientele composed of women and men.  She hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA which will be used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Melie

texts.en:
Melie D. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old. Melie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melie raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aside from farming, she also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She hopes for her business to grow.

Melie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Melie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase farm supplies and feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Каримова Зарина проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 22 года. Не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование высшее не оконченное. Она учится в педагогическом институте. Сейчас Зарина занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для закупа машинки, то есть хочет купить машинку для вышивки.
texts.en: Zarina K. lives in Dushanbe. 22 years old, single, living with parents. She is a college student. She studies at Teachers College. At present Zarina sews traditional national dresses. She works out of her home. She has been doing this for two years. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a sewing and embroidery machine.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Mwarua

texts.en:
Mwarua H. M. is a young married man. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores. They do not have any children yet. 

Mwarua makes such things as cupboards from timber and then he sells them to the local people. He also sells timber to other carpenters within the area. His business is located at a residential area in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attraction sites as well as its Indian ocean white beaches. 

Mwarua says that this business is profitable. His major challenge is that there are other people in the area with the same kind of business as his, and this ends up reducing prices due to competition. This, therefore, hinders profit maximization. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Mwarua is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) to add to his stock of timber in order to expand his business and meet the market demand. He hopes that in the future, he will open a big hardware store. He describes himself as a very aggressive businessman.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe A. is from the town of Banga. She is 64 years old and widowed. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Fe also runs an eatery where she cooks the food herself.
Fe joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Fe is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Benkadi  (2 femmes mariées, 1 veuve et 2 célibataires) avec une moyenne d’âge de 30  ans,  2 enfants,  vivent  dans des  familles polygames à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  Les prêts  précédents ont été bien remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  légumes  tels ABY O., des condiments alimentaires, de la restauration, d’habits  pour enfants et des produits de beauté.
ABY O. compte acheter avec son  prêt  50 paniers légumes  de différentes sortes, auprès des paysans producteurs, au niveau du grand marché et des villages voisins. Elles effectue sa vente, au marché, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour  épauler son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la familles et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Benkadi (two married, one widowed, and two unmarried) average 30 years of age and two children living in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have been repaid.  

This group of women does commerce in vegetables (as in the case of Ms.ABY O.), condiments, food catering, children's clothing, and beauty products.  

ABY O. plans on using her loan to buy 50 baskets of vegetables of various kinds from peasant producers at the grand market and from neighboring villages.  Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales at the retail level to a customer base composed essentially of consumers at the market.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be used for assisting her husband with day-to-day family expenses, and the other part will be invested in business.

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a widowed woman with two children, aged 24 and 36. One of her children graduated from school and the other attends university. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food and electricity.
For over 24 years, Evelyn has operated a food stall and also sold fresh water to neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality. During the dry summer season, the supply of food is low and demand rises. During the rainy winter season, the supply of food is high and demand decreases. She also faces the challenge of water rationing by the water supply companies. She hopes to improve her business and own a retail shop in the future.
Evelyn decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business. With this 40,000 KES loan, she wants to start a retail kiosk where she will be selling sugar, maize, wheat flour and washing soap.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of sugar and washing soap

loans.name: Jivimin

texts.en:
Jivimin S. is from the town of Banga. She is 44 years old and married. To make a living, Jivimin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jivimin has been engaged in farming for over 12 years. She also manages a sari-sari store now. She sells sugar, vinegar and other products.
Jivimin joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jivimin is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with one son who is still too young for school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the medical bill for her child.
For over three years, Hilda has been selling tea leaves to both her neighbors and restaurant operators, either for making tea at home or door to door. Her major challenge is transportation. The cost of transporting the tea leaves from home to her customers is high. She hopes to improve her business and open a retail shop to sell tea leaves.
Hilda decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to gain access to financial assistance to improve her business. With this 40,000 KES loan, she wants to buy plumbing materials and pay the plumbing fees for the water connection in her house.

loans.use: To buy plumbing materials and pay plumbing fees

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C., 59, is a member of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc.(ASHI) – a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines. She joined the institution in 2004 and has been active in all ASHI activities. Despite the difficulties of balancing her duties and responsibilities as both a mother and a member of ASHI, she is diligent in meeting all obligations.

Teresita's previous loans enabled her to start a variety store, the income from which helped support the schooling of her only child, who graduated from college and is now working in a call center. Her financial independence from her husband's income has bolstered her confidence, and her business goal is to begin a grocery goal in the future to generate more profit and provide employment among her neighbors or relatives.

Teresita is applying for a new loan of Php 45,000.00 pesos to increase her stock of grocery products. She will buy more sacks of rice and sugar, flour, canned goods, beverages, soaps, eggs, assorted kitchen ingredients, candies, snack foods, coffee, assorted brands of cigarettes, etc. She will start saving from the proceeds of this additional capital to prepare for the renovation of her store. She hopes and prays that KIVA lenders will support her in reaching her dreams and goals in life.

loans.use: Additional grocery products for her variety store

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is a single woman with two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family.

For the past year Dorris has been selling shoes as retail and from home to her neighbours and passersby, her major challenge being seasonality. The availability of stock from suppliers in the market fluctuates. She hopes to develop this small-scale business and be able to start a hairdressing business in the future.

Dorris decided to join Yehu in order to get a loan to improve her business and the family's living standard. With this Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase a bundle of shoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Хурсандова Мухаббат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 50 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Дочь, работает в колхозе. Сама Мухаббат занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает крупно - рогатый скот. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота для последующей перепродажи.
texts.en: Muhabbat K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is a 50-year old widow with four children. Her daughter works at a communal farm. Muhabbat raises  livestock. She fattens and resells cattle. She has extensive experience in this line of work. She is requesting a loan in order to buy cattle for eventual resale.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: C9600 Kabare Ii Group

texts.en:
Dorothe is 38 years old and is married with children. She has been a farmer since 1994 and is known in agriculture for growing Irish potatoes, vegetables and beans. This business is profitable in her area.

Dorothe is the leader of this group which consists of seven people and is called Kabare II in the local language. All the members of this group are farmers and the hours of their daily activities are from six in the morning to one in the afternoon.

Dorothe and her group are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses through purchasing seeds to grow Irish potatoes, vegetables and beans. With these seeds, Dorothe and her group will be able to produce more Irish potatoes and vegetable for sale.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farm

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is 39 years old and is married with four children. He is well-known in the business of selling Irish potatoes and has been in this business for a long time. He is very proud of his business. His business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Elie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to satisfy the demand of his customers by purchasing a large quantity of Irish potatoes for sale. With these additional sacks of Irish potatoes, he will hopefully earn more profits than previously. He really hopes that he will be able to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Thiaba Khoye

texts.fr: Madame Thiaba Khoye S. est une dame de 44 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 18 et 25 ans. Suite  aux conseils d’un parent elle a adopté l’activité de commerce par passion. Par conséquent elle exerce  la vente de produits cosmétiques depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis mars 2000. Elle a déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but de s’approvisionner en produits cosmétiques. Ces produits seront placés auprès de sa clientèle. Elle souhaite augmenter ses bénéfices, conquérir d’autres parts de marchés et améliorer sa situation  familiale sur le plan social.
texts.en:
Ms. Thiaba Khoye S. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the town of Yoff.  She is married and the mother of two children, who are 18 and 25 years old.  Following the advice of one her parents, she took on work in commerce and with a passion.  As a result, she has been excelling at selling cosmetics for over five years.  She has been a member of the Yoff branch since March 2000.  

She has already repaid three previous loans.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs with the goal of stocking up on cosmetics.  These goods will be delivered to her customers.  She would like to increase her profits, capture other markets, and improve her family's social situation.

loans.use: Increasing her funds

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianey

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianey is 38 years old and is married with six children who are between 2 and 13 years old.

Jean Marie Vianey is well-known in the business of selling hens and he has been in this business for about two years. His business hours are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Jean Marie Vianey needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase some additional hens for sale so as to increase his market and his income. With the additional profits, he will build a poultry enclosure in which to keep his hens.

If successful, Jean Marie Vianey really hopes that he will keep reinvesting with the goal of creating some other sources of income which, in turn, will allow his business to be stable.

loans.use: To purchase additional hens to sell

loans.name: Baatarzorig

texts.en:
Baatarzorig C. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Hentiy Province, Mongolia. His two daughters both attend local primary school. Baatarzorig and his wife own a raw materials business in their town where they buy raw materials locally and sell the materials both at the market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and in Nalaih city, in the remote district of Ulaanbaabar, for a profit.

He started his business in 2000 with working capital of 150,000 MNT and has built a stable operation. After years of successful operations he has managed to increase his working capital to a level exceeding 4,000,000 MNT today. Baatarzorig has gained much experience and knowledge over the years, and he hopes to use this experience and knowledge to keep his business growing.

His earnings have enabled him to renovate his house and purchase new furniture. In addition, he has used his earnings to build a new garage which is used for storage of his raw materials. With profits from his enterprise, he has also been able to greatly improve his family's standard of living. Baatazorig is a very helpful and hardworking man who is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials such as sheep and goat's skin, leather and wool, etc. in order to ultimately increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en: K. Nurali is happily married to his wife. Their marriage has been blessed with five lovely children. Nurali has decided that he wants to live the rest of his life in the place where he was born. He not only loves the peaceful environment, but it is also home to their major source of income - farming. He has been involved in farm activities since childhood. He is used to the heat of the sun. Nurali has worked as a farmer for the past six years. However, life has been difficult and progress slow. Because he lacks financial resources, Nurali would like to borrow US$3,000 so that he can buy seeds and fertilizer for his crop and small cattle. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th century BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007 IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer and small cattle

loans.name: Boldmaa

texts.en:
Boldmaa J. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter attends the local school and her youngest two children both attend the local kindergarten. Her husband helps her with the business. 

Boldmaa and her husband operate a meat retail business in the local market in their town. They started their business in 2009 after running a business trading dairy products in a rented stall at the local market. Her business has grown quickly over the year and her monthly sales revenue reached between 2,000,000 and 2,200,000 MNT. She says, 'I want to expand my business while my children are still at young age'. Boldmaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and blocks of ice to sell.

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Dariimaa G. is a 48-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Darhan, a city in Mongolia. She and her two children live together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her youngest daughter currently attends a local primary school. Her husband passed away six years ago. 

Dariimaa operates a vegetable trading business in a stall at the local market with the help of her son. She used to work as a technologist for the Floor Factory. She has been engaging in this trade for ten years and has gained significant experience. Her business earnings are the only source of her family's income. Dariimaa has been planning to expand her business in order to improve her family's quality of life. In the future she hopes to have her own field where she can plant and grow vegetables. She will use her future earnings to pay her daughter's tuition fees and to buy a new house for her son. She is a hardworking and very energetic person who dedicates her life to her children. She says, 'My dream is to raise my children to be well-educated people, so that they can live a decent life. My children will help to expand my business in the future.' She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of vegetables at wholesale price in order to sell them during the forthcoming winter.

loans.use: To purchase large amount of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a married woman with two girls and one boy aged 15,13, and 9 years respectively. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Rahel has operated her food-selling business (samosas and deep fried potatoes) in an open air market for over five years. Her main customers are passersby and the neighbouring community. She faces the major challenge of seasonality, as the price of potatoes fluctuates with the seasons. Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 requested, she wants to purchase a freezer to make juices and store samosas.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer to make juices and store samosas

loans.name: Niyonkuru Group

texts.fr:
Joséphine G. est une femme commerçante âgée de 53 ans qui habite la localité de Gatumba  dans la Province de Bujumbura Rural. Elle fait le commerce des produits alimentaires de boutique dans la cite de Gatumba, un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 23ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Son mari, Pascal Minani est un cultivateur. Elle arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 8enfants qui sont adultes âgés de plus de 20 ans. Aucun de ses enfants n’est plus à sa charge.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires de boutique à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle a préféré demander le crédit à Turame car elle a beaucoup de facilites a rembourser. Son rêve est de pouvoir arriver au stade ou elle a son propre capital sans pouvoir demander le crédit pour travailler. 

Elle  est une des membres du groupe  Communautaire« Niyonkuru»
texts.en:
Joséphine G. is a woman merchant, aged 53, who lives in the town of Gatumba, in the province of Bujumbura Rural.  She does commerce in grocery items in the Gatumba district.  It is a trade in which she has been excelling for 23 years, whereas she used to be a farmer.  She has attended primary school. Her husband, Pascal Minani, is a farmer. She is the mother of eight children who are adults over 20 years of age.  None of her children is in her care any longer.  

Joséphine has reached her fourth community loan cycle with Turame.  She is asking for a Kiva loan in order to increase her capital by buying large quantities of grocery items to resell to customers and thus to save more money.  She has preferred to ask Turname for the loan because it would be easy for her to repay. 

Her dream is to be able to reach the stage where she has her own capital, without asking for loans in order to work.  

She is a member of the community group "Niyonkuru".

loans.use: Increasing her capital by buying large amounts of grocery items to resell to customers and thus increasing her savings

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.en: Kurbon M. has always been dedicated to agriculture together with his wife. He is 48 years old, married and has six children. As his activity has always been focused on making the land produce, the loans he has requested have generally been spent on necessary supplies to obtain good production. At the same time, Kurbon is also engaged in cattle breeding. Kurbon needs a loan of 9,000 Somoni to go on purchasing farming supplies for his crops and small cattle for breeding. In the future, Kurbon expects to have his own working capital, which will allow him to cover the costs and buy more land in order to increase production and grow as a farmer. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer and small cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of biscuits, toothpaste, candle, milk, sugar, more crates of soft drinks and sacks of water

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.en: Habibulo M. is 47 years old and married with three children. For Habibulo, the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting the vegetables that he will sell because the price will depend on the quality of the crops. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market; that is the motivation to continue planting. This is the third loan that Habibulo has had with IMON International. He has been making his payments on time. And he is very grateful to those who support him because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. With the money requested, he will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Enshai

texts.en:
Enshai A. is a 51-year-old single mother who lives with her four children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. 

Enshai operates a dairy-production trading business in an indoor stall at the local market. She has been engaged in this business since 2000 and has had success in growing her business. She purchases milk at 800 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) per liter and sells back at 1,000 MNT. After many years of operation, she built a successful and stable operation. 

Her two sons work in the construction field during the summer months. In the future, she plans to have her own milk breeding cows as well as her own shop where she will sell her dairy products. 

She said, “My only wish is to be able to build a new house for my kids.” 

Enshai is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan both to purchase dairy products such as milk, mare's milk and yogurt for her retail business as well as to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more stationery supplies and books

loans.name: Hishgee

texts.en:
Hishgee S. is a 59-year-old who lives with her husband and one son in the Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her youngest son attends university in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. All of her other children currently live on their own, apart from their parents. 

Hishgee operates a raw material business in her town where she sells sheep and goat skins. Her husband, Dambii, operates a small shop next to his home. In addition, he also plants and grows a variety of vegetables in his yard to sell at a local market for profits. 

Hishgee started her own business by selling a variety of meat in 2005 and the last few years, she has been running her current business. She and her husband work hard to be able to provide a new house for their youngest son. 

Hishgee is a very hardworking old woman and is requesting a 2,100,000 Mongolian tugriks loan so that she can not only purchase sheep and goat skins at a wholesale price for resale, but also buy inventory for their small shop.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and goat skins

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel J. is a 58-year-old widow who lives in a house in Darhan-Uul city, Mongolia. Her two children, ages 26 and 22, are both are students and currently live and study in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. 

Narangerel operates a raw material trading business in her town, where she sells things like the intestines of livestock. She used to work as a specialist in Mah-Expo company between 1973 and 2002. She started her own business in 2000 with the help of her children and since then, she has built a successful and stable business operation. She processes livestock's intestines in her home. 

Her earnings are the only source of income in her family and they have enabled her to pay her daughters' tuition fees. 

Narangerel is a very modest and hardworking woman and says, “I wish to have my children (have) a good education and living accommodation as well as decent jobs." 

She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of cow intestines at a wholesale price for the upcoming busy season.

loans.use: To purchase large amount of intestines of cows

loans.name: Grand Kru Food Center Group

texts.en:
Ayo Y., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Grand Kru Food Center.  She is 46 years old married and was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. For 4 years, she has been operating a mini restaurant on Broad Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, pepper, salt, seasoning etc.

She describes herself as a friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, pepper, salt, seasoning etc

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en:
S. Abdukodir is a 36-year-old married man with four children. He is a very hardworking man. He owns land on which he grows potatoes and other vegetables. His wife sells their products. When she goes to sell their products, he remains behind to farm. What most aggravates him about this activity is when the opportunity to sell his crop arrives, sometimes he makes a lot of money and other times the market isn’t as kind to him. Abdukodir and his wife work hard for the education of their children. With the loan requested through Kiva, he will buy seeds and fertilizer for his field. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, pepper, salt, seasoning etc

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
S. Fotima is 47 years old. Together with her husband they have three children. Fotima sells DVD and CD products. She orders the delivery of the disks from Russia and tries to have all the new movies with popular actors and concerts with popular singers in stock. The business is successful in generating the main income for her family. Today Fotima requests 8,000 Somoni for the purchase of more DVDs and CDs for selling. Fotima thanks all who support her and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase more DVDs and CDs for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Tseepil

texts.en:
Tseepil C. is a 24-year-old single woman who lives with her two sisters in their own house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Tseepil had been working as a knitter in the Gobi Co.Ltd until 2009 when she started her own private business by selling a variety of clothes and wool products in a rented stall at the Hantalst trade center. Within a short period of operation, she has built a successful and stable business. Her middle sister works as a teacher in the Mongolian National University while her other sister helps her with the business. She is a very modest woman. She hopes to continue to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase a new sewing machine for her wool knitting production.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Purevtsengel

texts.en:
Purevtsengel H. lives with his wife and three children in their own house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His two sons are currently unemployed and stay at home with their mother. His daughter attends university.  He had been operating a consumer goods trading business since 1998 and had stopped his trading business due to his wife's health condition in 2009. 

He used to work as a driver for a local organization, therefore he had gained experience in this profession. Purevtsengel started his transportation business with help of his two sons in 2010 after purchasing a new truck.  He is a very modest man and says, “ All I want is to restart my previous business.” He needs more funds to complete construction of his store that costs 1,500,000 MNT and therefore he is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan both to purchase a trailer at 1,500,000 MNT for his big van and to use in the construction of his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for his big van and for construction materials for his shop

loans.name: Jumakhon

texts.en:
A. Jumakhon is 22 years old, married, and has a little child. For more than three years Jumakhon has raised young cattle and has sold them at the market in order to support his family. Since his business is going well, he wishes to expand it. Jumakhon has decided to ask for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy more young cattle for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions with this loan. This purchase will enable Jumakhon to increase his sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of his dear child for whose sake he is working hard. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, meat, fish, pepper, salt, seasoning etc

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, on the right, lives in the second largest city of Pakistan, Lahore, known for its history and culture. She is a working woman who operates a business sewing clothes to support her family. She sews for neighboring clients and charges between 100 and 150 PKRs on each dress. Her quality of work brings her customers returning. Her earnings allow her to pay for the utility expenses of her family. She is married to M. Y. who operates a canteen business in the school. He sells food items such as Kabas (made with potatoes) and French fries, and Samosas to students and makes a reasonable income every month. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s canteen business. With the loan her husband will diversify his business by introducing more items such as cold drinks and tea. Nasreen hopes that by doing this her husband will double his income and improve the financial condition of his family.

loans.use: To buy items for canteen business

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en:
A. Tohir is 46 years old. He is married and the father of three children. He buys and sells cattle from different markets and has been in the business for the last 10 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. With the loan from Kiva, Tohir plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. Tohir dreams to see his children go through higher education and be able to get good jobs — unlike himself. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Siddiqa's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqa, with hand raised, lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan known for its history and culture. She is a vigorous and artistic lady who runs a decorative embroidery business at home. She use different technical embroidery skills in making embroidered dresses. Due to her quality work and unique designs she gets regular orders every month which earns her a good profit. She started this work because her husband’s income alone was not enough to meet the needs of the family. 

Siddiqa has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy seasonal fruits to sell from his four-wheeled cart. He hopes to improve his sales and get a shop in the market.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Nizami

texts.ru:
Nizami A. 40 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, doch 18 let kotoraya v etom qodu postupila v universitet i sin 15 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole. Nizami yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli region.

Nizami uje eto vtoroy ssud. Pervuyu ssudu brala yeqo jena Sevindj Aliyeva. Oni ochen blagodarni za ssudu. Nizami uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy video apparat tak kak yeqo apparat isportilsya i on ne mojet rabotat.
texts.en:
Nizami A. is 40 years old. He is married and has two children: an 18-year-old daughter who this year will enter university and a 15-year-old son who is a student in school. Nizami is an internally-displace person (IDP); he moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region.

Nizami is already on his second loan. The first loan was taken by his wife Sevindj Aliyeva. They are very grateful for the loans. Nizami has been engaged in this business for 7 years. Now he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a new video camera because his camera is broken and therefore he cannot work.

loans.use: To purchase a new video camera

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in the historic city of Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan which is known for its history and culture. She is a businesswoman who supports her family financially by selling toys in the community and local markets. She has hired a person who assists her in selling the toys. She earns a good amount from her business and easily shares the financial burden with her husband. Her husband, M. M., is a motor mechanic who runs a motor workshop in the nearby market where he repairs cycles and motorbikes and generates income for the family. He has become expert in his work because he has 10 years of experience in it. Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s motor workshop business. With this loan, her husband will buy the latest repair tools and spare parts for cycles and motorbikes for his business. Sakina is hopeful that with this investment, her husband’s business will improve a lot and that his income will double in size.

Note: In the photo, Sakina is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy the latest repair tools and spare parts

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in the historic city of Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan which is known for its history and culture. She is a businesswoman who owns and operates an embroidery business at her home. She prepares embroidered dresses for orders she receives from different boutiques and clothing shops. She earns a good profit upon completion of each dress. Due to her excellent embroidery skills, she is very popular in her community and receives regular orders.

Her husband, M. A., has a plastic bean selling business. He buys plastic beans from the city of Multan and supplies them to factories that make plastic bags and utensils by melting the beans. He has been in this business for the past 10 years and has a good clientele base. Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, her husband will buy plastic beans in bulk, which will enable him to fulfill the larger orders on time. Safia is hopeful that with the help of this investment, her husband’s business will become better and his income will increase, resulting in a better financial position for the family. Note: In the photo, Safia is slightly raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans in bulk

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia resides in the city of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan which is known for its history and culture. She is a supportive and kindhearted woman. She operates a stuffed toy selling business which is very popular among children, who love to play with the stuffed toys. She receives orders from different gift shops and earns a good income by completing them on time.

Her husband, M. S., runs a tailoring business in the market where he sews both ladies' and men's clothes. He has been in this profession for the last six years and now has a good clientele base. He has hired a worker who assists him in completing the orders on time. Shazia and her husband both manage the family's financial expenses.

Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s tailoring business. With this loan, her husband will buy another sewing machine which will help him complete the orders on time and receive more orders. At present, with a single machine, S. has to refuse his customers' orders, which is not good for his business or his image. Shazia is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and that their financial condition will become far better.

Note: In the photo, Shazia is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Jackson Lelionga

texts.en:
Jackson Lelionga L. is 57 years old. He is married to Emily L. and he supports five members of his family. Jackson has been farming on his own piece of land for the last six years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members of a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend to prepare the land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. 

Jackson's dream is do large scale farming and be financially stable. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals

loans.use: to prepare his land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Mzimuni Group

texts.en:
Kulwe B. is in his late twenties and is married, with children who are twins. Since 2007, he has been running his own shop, selling rice, sugar, beans and cooking oil. The shop is open from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. and earns Kulwe a monthly profit of about 500,000 TZS, or $330. 

This will be Kulwe's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan, which he has successfully repaid, to increase the inventory of his shop. With this new loan, Kulwe aims to increase his inventory of the same products for his shop. His dream is to one day open a grocery store.

Kulwe will share this loan with his group, Mzimuni, which totals 17 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. Kulwe serves as the chairperson of the group. In the photo, Kulwe is standing in the center of the back row, in a gray shirt.

loans.use: To increase the shop inventory

loans.name: Husniyya

texts.ru:
Husniyya K. (na fotoqrafii yeyo sin) 48 let. Ona mat 2 detey , sin kotoriy rabotayet taxistom  i doch kotoroy 17 let ona uchitsya v shkole. Husniyya yavlyayetsya IDP personom, ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione.

Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya  mashini. Uje 7 let kak yeyo sin zanimayetsya etim biznessom vojdeniya taxi.
texts.en:
Husniyya K. (her son is in the photo) is 48 years old.  She is the mother of two children.  Her son works as a taxi driver, and her daughter, who is seventeen, goes to school.  Husniyya is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region.

She needs 2000 AZN for car repair.  Her son has been driving a taxi for seven years.

loans.use: Buying car parts

loans.name: Shahnaz Munir Masih's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in the city of Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan which is known for its history and culture. She is a housewife and prefers to spend her time at home carrying out her household responsibilities and taking care of her family. 

She lives with her husband and children in the area called Mughalpura. She owns a two-room brick house there. She is married to M. M. who has a business selling construction supplies. He has done this work for the past eight years and is well known for the quality of his supplies.
 
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and bricks in bulk quantity which will help him to fulfill larger orders on time and double his income. Shahnaz is hopeful that this investment will become profitable for her husband’s business and he will successfully upgrade his business on a larger scale.  

Note: In the photo, Shahnaz is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies in bulk for resale

loans.name: Shahnaz Syed Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in the city of Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan which is known for its history and culture. She is a housewife who is married to S. R. who is a welder by trade. He operates a welding shop in the nearby market from where he welds different iron items with his welding machine. Currently, he has a single welding machine which has started giving trouble affecting his work so he cannot meet his work deadlines.  He is the only breadwinner of his family and so he puts his best efforts into this work so that he earns a good profit and can meet his family's financial expenses. 
 
Shahnaz has therefore applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s welding business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy a new welding machine and can start doing his work and meet his customers' deadlines. He will not then face financial problems and can successfully continue his work without further difficulties.

Note: In the photo, Shahnaz is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine

loans.name: Jacob Saulo

texts.en:
Jacob Saulo is 22 years old and single. He has been in the business of selling eggs since 2007 in Kariobangi, just a few kilometers from Nairobi city centre. His clients are mostly shopkeepers, who buy his eggs wholesale, and residents within that area.

He has never borrowed from any other micro-finance institution (MFI) and was introduced to KADET LTD by another client. He is happily applying for his second loan of Kshs. 30,000 with KADET. With this loan, Jacob plans to boost his business by purchasing more eggs, as this will enable him to serve his customers well. In the urban setting, eggs are a protein food that is very affordable for the majority of people in the community, and for this reason he believes that it is a profitable business.

His main aim in the future is to grow his business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Shazia Ibrar's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a seamstress by profession. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to share the financial burden with her husband. Her quality of work ensures that her customers give her regular orders. She started this business four years ago and in this short period has earned recognition among other businesswomen of the community and has also managed her clientele base well. 
 
Shazia's husband's name is I. and he has an electrical goods shop in the market where he sells different electrical items such as irons, televisions and ovens to his customers. They live in Lahore which is the second largest city of Pakistan and is known for its culture and history.
 
Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy electrical items such as irons, televisions and ovens to sell in his shop. By having more electrical items in his shop, his business will definitely grow towards success which will help their family to improve its standard of living. 

Note: In the photo, Shazia is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy electrical items for resale

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine H. is a young entrepreneur selling women’s clothing and shoes. She lives happily with her 3 brothers and retired parents. While her two younger brothers are serving in the army, her older brother is helping her run the business. 

Marine rents a shop in the busy city market. This happy and enthusiastic young lady supports herself and her family with the income from the business. She is very eager to add fresh inventory to satisfy her longstanding customers. Marine is planning to make a purchase of new inventory, for which she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Jorge Emanuel

texts.es:
El señor Jorge de 18 años de edad, soltero, no tiene hijos, cuenta con una casa de repuestos   en su domicilio, conocido en la zona.
 Heredo el negocio de su padre actualmente el se encarga de la administración del mismo. 
Los artículos que más vende son, aceite para motores, filtros en general y repuestos para vehículos de la línea japonesa.
Solicito dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de baterías   en cantidad. 
El mismo al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Jorge is 18 years old, single, has no children, rents his room from a boarding house, and is known in the area.

He inherited the business from his father, and now he is responsible for managing it.

The things he sells the most are motor oil, filters of all types, and replacement parts for Japanese cars.

He is requesting this loan from Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya to buy batteries in bulk.

He is grateful for the help from Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: Purchase batteries

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine H. is married with 2 children, living with her father-in-law. Karine rents a trading booth at the busy city market from where she sells women’s clothing. Karine’s husband is employed, and contributes to the business’s success by investing his savings. To meet her clients’ needs Karine needs to travel to the neighboring country to purchase autumn clothing stock.

loans.use: purchase new clothing stock

loans.name: Haneefan Muhammad Aslam's Group

texts.en:
Haneefan lives in Arifwala, a small city of the Punjab. Arifwala is famous in Pakistan for its dairy industry. She has been living in a two-room brick house with her family for many years. She is 53 years old and married to M. A. who is a property dealer by profession. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Both her sons left their education due to financial constraints and started working to contribute to their family financially. Her elder son works in a factory and the younger one works as a laborer. Her daughters are continuing their education and are reading at 9th and 10th standards respectively. 

Haneefan supports her family by sewing and has regular orders from her neighboring clients. She also has a dairy business which she prefers. The reason for liking this business is because her parents are also in the same business and she used to take care of their cattle. Currently, she has a buffalo at her home which produces almost 8 kg of milk per day. She sells the milk to community members and uses this income to pay for the utilities expenses for her house. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her dairy business. With the loan amount, she will buy another buffalo and increase her dairy business's productivity. Haneefan is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. With her previous loans, she has shown that she is a responsible person, having paid her installments on time and never missing a meeting.
   
Note: In this photo, Haneefan is the lady who is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to increase her dairy business's profitability

loans.name: Qantati Group

texts.es:
“Qantati” que en Aymara, quiere decir amanecer, es el nombre que las señoras eligieron para su Asociación Comunal, es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, uno de los centros focales más alejados en Pro Mujer El Alto. Este es su ciclo número quince, de los once integrantes diez son mujeres y uno es varón. 

La presidenta es la señora Sabina, ella  trabaja desde hace diez años en Pro Mujer, su primer crédito fue de $150.-, actualmente ha solicitado un crédito por Bs 3500.- y piensa invertirlo en la compra de condimentos como:  ajo, orégano, sibarita, aji.  Realiza las ventas en la Ciudad de La Paz en el mercado de la zona de Villa Fátima, todos los días, a las 12 del medio día. Dos señoras le ayudan en el negocio.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: comerciante de artículos variso, venta de ajos, venta de abarrotes, venta de carne de cordero, venta de ropa y cosméticos, carpintería, venta de cosméticos y calzados, restaurante, venta de edredones y sábanas, venta de artefactos electrodomésticos, venta de tennis y juegos de Internet – juegos en red.
texts.en:
"Qantati," which in Aymara means "dawn," is the name that the women chose for their communal association. It is part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltacion, one of the most remote focus centers in Pro Mujer El Alto. This is the group's 15th loan. Of the 11 members, 10 are women and one is a man.

The president is Sabina. She has worked for 10 years with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman); her first loan was for $150 - now she has requested a loan for Bs 3,500 - and she is planning to invest it in the purchase of spices such as garlic, oregano, gourmet (spices), and chili pepper. She sells in the city of La Paz, in the market and zone of Villa Fatima, every day, at 12 noon. Two women help her with the business.

With respect to the business (represented) in the association, they are varied. Among them, we have: Selling of various items, selling garlic, selling groceries, selling lamb meat, selling clothes and cosmetics, carpentry, selling cosmetics and shoes, a restaurant, selling quilts and sheets, selling electrical appliances, selling tennis and internet games - online games.

loans.use: Purchase spices: garlic, oregano, chili pepper

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. has been involved in farming activity for about nine years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs. 60,000. She is a widow and does her farming business on her own piece of land in Cura village in Kikuyu, which is few kilometers from Nairobi City Centre. The place where Mary lives has a very suitable climate for farming activities both for dairy and crop farming. She sells her produce e.g. milk to small scale retailers and her neighbors.

Mary has never borrowed from any other micro-finance institution (MFI). She is applying for her second loan of Kshs. 25,000 after she repaid her first loan successfully. She intends to use this loan to buy another dairy cow for milk production.

In future, Mary hopes to supply more milk to people in the Cura community and also to the dairy companies.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Noor Muhammad Saeed's Group

texts.en:
Noor lives in a small city called Arifwala in Pakistan. She owns a three-room brick house in the area of Zia Nagar and has been living in it with her family for the past 11 years. She is 37 years old, married to M. S. and has three sons and two daughters. Unfortunately she hasn't been able to provide them with an education due to poor financial conditions. She is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients in order to earn an income for her family. She receives a good number of orders every month due to her quality work. 

Her husband runs a grocery shop in the market where he sells daily use items like cooking oil, rice, spices, etc. to his customers. He has been running this business for the past seven years. In this period of time, he has faced financial problems and competition from other grocery shops as well. But with his brave nature and timely financial support from Noor, he has successfully overcome those problems and his business is now earning a good profit.
 
Noor has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy groceries in bulk to diversify the stock in his grocery store which will help him to increase his household income and also to serve more clients. Noor is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. With her previous loans, she has proved to be a responsible person who has always paid her installments on time and has never missed a meeting.  

Note: In the photo, Noor is the lady who is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk to sell in her grocery shop

loans.name: Bertila De Jesus

texts.es: Bertila de Jesús C. tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos, y junto a ellos y su esposo reside en el Barrio Áreas Verdes en el municipio de La Unión, Olancho. Desde hace un tiempo en una parte de su casa de habitación Bertila tiene una venta de ropa de segunda mano para hombres, mujeres y niños. Ella es una persona trabajadora que día a día con las ventas que realiza lleva el sustento a su hogar, es muy conocida en el barrio por sus vecinos y sus clientes y además cuenta con muy buenas referencias. Bertila solicita el préstamo para comprar un fardo de ropa de cama, dos de niños y dos de ropa mixta. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella espera que al  surtir más su negocio, sus ventas sean mayores al igual que sus ganancias, aunque en ocasiones las ventas bajan por la mal situación económica. Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y que su condición de vida mejore. Es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y es muy puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en: Bertila de Jesús C. is 49 years old, married, has five children, and lives with them and her husband in the Areas Verdes neighborhood in the municipality of La Unión, Olancho. For some time, in a part of her home, Bertila has had a second-hand clothing store for men, women, and children. She is a hardworking person who, day by day, through sales, provides for her home. She is well-known by her neighbors and customers in the neighborhood, and she also has many good references. Bertila is requesting this loan to buy a bundle of pajamas, two bundles of children's clothes, and two bundles of mixed clothes. With the help of this loan, she hopes to stock her business more so her sales will be greater as well as her profits, although on occasion sales dip due to a bad situation in the economy. Her dream is to have a bigger business and for her quality of life to improve. This is her third loan with Kiva partner FAMA, and she is very punctual in her payments.

loans.use: Purchase bundles of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Safia Mahram Ali's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Arifwala which is a small city located in the Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her husband and family in a two-room brick house in the colony named Zia Nagar. She is an older woman aged over 50. It is difficult to work at this age but she is still very active. She not only has a clothes sewing business but she also operates a dairy business from her home. She keeps a buffalo at her home for her dairy business. 

Her husband is a property dealer by profession. She is the mother of a son and a daughter both of whom are illiterate. Her son works as a laborer and earns income on a daily basis. Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her dairy business. With the loan amount, she will buy another buffalo to increase her dairy business's milk productivity. 
 
Safia is very confident that her business will grow more with the additional buffalo and that her family's standard of living will improve. She is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. With her previous loans, she has proved to be a responsible person who has paid her installments on time and has never missed a meeting. 

Note: In the photo, Safia is the lady who is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Naseem Zafar Iqbal's Group

texts.en:
Naseem does embroidery to ease her family's financial burden. She lives in Arifwala which is a small city located in the Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her husband and family in a two-room brick house in the colony named Zia Nagar. Naseem is married to Z. I. who is a private entrepreneur and has a vegetable selling business. He buys vegetables from the vegetable market and sells them to different vegetable shops to make a good profit.
  
Naseem is the mother of three sons. Her elder son works as a laborer and the other two stay at home and don’t do anything. None of her sons could get an education due to financial constraints. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy seasonal vegetables in bulk to improve his selling. 

Naseem is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes in her husband’s business and that his dream of starting his own vegetable shop in the market will become true with the help of the profit earnt through the loan. She is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her second loan application. With her previous loan, she has proved herself to be a responsible person who has paid her installments on time and has never missed a meeting.  

Note: In the photo, Naseem is the lady who is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables for resale

loans.name: Stephen Elijah

texts.en:
Stephen O. is a 42-year-old gentleman who is married to Penina O.. Stephen is a greengrocer who only sells fruit in an area which is highly populated. He has been in this business for the past 12 years and he is able to make a profit of about Kshs 14,000 every month. His wife also contributes to his income as she is a farmer.

Stephen does not have a microfinance credit history and he only joined KADET after he was convinced by one of our credit officers. This will be his first loan which he plans to use to increase the stock of fruit in his business. He is sure that he will make a profit which he plans to use to venture into the wholesale supply of fruit to other retail fruit sellers.

His future dream is to run a big fruit selling stall and to open other branches.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruit in his greengrocer shop

loans.name: Senderos De Paz Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Senderos de Paz está integrado por cinco socias, las cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en la Aldea El Carbonal, Silca, Olancho. La coordinadora del grupo es la sra. Prisca Beatriz C.. Ella tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la Aldea El Carbonal en el municipio de Silca, Olancho. Prisca inició vendiendo unos cuantos productos de abarrotería y se dio cuenta de que las ganancias eran muy buenas así que decidió instalar una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación que atiende ella misma desde las 6:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, arroz, refrescos, manteca, carnes, pollo, embutidos, pan, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá más y mejor surtido su negocio y sus clientes podrán encontrar todo lo que necesitan para preparar sus alimentos.  La sra. Prisca actualmente no enfrenta ningún problema de salud pero en algunas temporadas las ventas bajan y sus ganancias también.  Su meta es que las ventas en su negocio se mantengan estables para poder llevar el sustento a su familia. Ella tiene dieciséis ciclos en FAMA y está muy agradecida con el apoyo que ha recibido.
texts.en:
The “Senderos de Paz” (Peaceful Pathways) is comprised of five members. The have different economic activities in the village of El Carbonal in Silca, Olancho.

Prisca Beatriz C. is the coordinator of the group.  She is 46 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives with her family in the El Carbonal village in the municipality of Silca, Olancho.  Prisca started selling some grocery products, and she realized that the earnings were very good.  That is how she decided to establish a small grocery store in her house.  She tends the store herself from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

She is requesting the loan to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks, shortening, meat, chicken, sausages, and bread, etc.  With help from the loan she will have a business that is better stocked.  Her customers will be able to find everything they need to prepare their food.

Prisca does not currently have any health problems.  There are periods of time when sales are low, but there are also times when her earnings are good.  Her goal is for the sales in her business to remain stable in order to be able to support her family.  She has been with FAMA for 16 cycles, and she is very grateful for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy general groceries

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
femme de 43 ans, célibataire mère  de 4 enfants  dont l'âge varie de 3 à 18ans .
Elle débute dans la vente des sandales en 1996 quand elle n'a pu aller au lycée pour poursuivre ses études.
Elle achète des sandales au marché au près des grossistes, et elle revend avec des prix hors concurences pour vite écouler son stock.
Par jour , elle a des ventes de 20000f minimum et50000f maximum.pendant les périodes de fêtes et à la rentrée des classe, ses recttes journalieres doublent.
avec ce prêt , elle veut acheter des chaussures de sports  pour enfants (garçons et filles), des sandales hommes , des sandales femmes et des tangsde toutes les couleurs(10douzaines).
elle veut vendre beaucoup pour faire plus de bénéfices et réaliser son rêve de dévenir fournisseur afin de soutenir la scolarité de ses enfant.
Elle est très entreprenante et ambitieuse.
texts.en:
Antoinette is a 43 years old single mother of four children, between 3 and 18 years of age. 
She has been selling sandals since 1996, when she had to drop school and could not get a high school education. 
She buys shoes at the wholesale market and sells them at very convenient prices, in order to sell the entire stock quickly. 
Every day she gains between 20000F and 50000f, according to the season; she sells twice as much during the holiday season and at school begin. 
With this loan, she wants to buy sport shoes for children (boys and girls), men and women sandals and about ten dozen of flip flops in all colors. 
She hopes to increase her profit and achieve her goal to became a wholesaler and be able to provide for her children education. 
She is very enterprising and ambitious.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of men, women and kids sandals.

loans.name: Charles Edwin

texts.en:
Charles Edwin K. is a 33-year-old gentleman who is in the business of offering internet, printing and typing services from his cyber café. He has been in this business for seven years. He is able to earn a good profit so he can provide for his family as he is married and has two children aged three and one and a half.  His business is a very busy place as he is the only one offering these services in the area of Gitaru and it is also alongside a busy highway.
