Charles joined KADET after he was introduced to an existing group by the chairman of the group. He has applied for his first loan which he will use to open up another cyber café in Kikuyu town.

Charles hopes to increase his stock and diversify by being able to ship computers as well as assembling them for his clients.

loans.use: To open another cyber café

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias M. is a 42-year-old married gentleman who is in the carpentry business. He has been in this business for the past 17 years and he is able to make a profit of about Kshs 15,000 every month. This, together with the addition of his wife’s income, is able to provide for his needs as well as those of his wife and their three children. 

Elias is an old client of KADET and he is now applying for his sixth loan which he will use to purchase raw materials for his carpentry business. This will include things like timber, nails, glue, etc. He hopes to use the anticipated profits from this loan to grow the business.

Elias has dreams of expanding his business further in future and being able to earn a steady income.

loans.use: To buy more materials e.g. nails, timber, glue, etc. for his carpentry business

loans.name: Rasoolan Akhter Ali's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan lives in the city of Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and is famous for its textile industry. She has been living in a two-room brick house with her husband and children in the area of Siddiq Akbar since her marriage. 

Rasoolan is 50 years old and is married to A. A. who is a private entrepreneur and has a vegetable selling business. He operates his shop in the market and has been doing this business for the past 16 years. In his long years of experience, he has faced several problems, sometimes the lack of financial resources and sometimes competition from other vegetable sellers. But he never loses courage and has fought against these circumstances and successfully overcame them. 
 
Rasoolan is a housewife who stays at home carrying out her household responsibilities and taking care of her family. She is the mother of three children, two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are involved in the business of vegetable selling with their father and her daughter helps her in managing the household chores. 

Rasoolan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy vegetables in bulk quantity for his vegetable selling business. Rasoolan is hopeful that this investment will be successful for her husband’s business and that he will be able to double his income.  She is a new borrower from Asasah and this is her first loan application.
 
Note: In the photo, Rasoolan is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk for resale

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann W. is 25 years old and a single lady. She has managed a general store for about two years at Zambezi, Nderi in Kikuyu. Most of her clients are residents in that area. She earns a profit of Kshs. 18,000 per month, and her other source of income is through farming.

She has no history with any other microfinance institution (MFI). She was introduced to KADET LTD by Francis Ndungu who is the chairman of an existing group of KADET. She is applying for her third loan of Kshs. 40,000 to add more stock to the general store and also she plans to diversify her business with the income generated.
 
Ann hopes to establish a wholesale cosmetic and general products shop in Zambezi so that she can cater for her educational needs as she aspires to going back to school.

loans.use: To buy more stock for the business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is a 52-year-old lady who is married with five children aged between 34 and 21. She is a greengrocer in the busy Githurai market and she says that her business is able to make her a profit of Kshs 15,000 per month. Her husband is a businessman who also contributes to the family’s total income.

Grace joined KADET after her friend introduced her. She is now applying for her fifth loan which she will use to add more stock of fruit which includes oranges, mangoes, bananas, passionfruit and others. 

Grace hopes to buy a big lorry in the near future which will make it easy for her to buy much more fruit from farmers and thus sell wholesale to others.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruit like oranges, mangoes, bananas and passionfruit

loans.name: Erupe Ellim

texts.en:
Erupe Ellim I. is a 25-year-old gentleman who is married to Susan Nekesa with three children aged 9, 6 and 2 years respectively. He has been running a hotel business for the past 12 years and is able to make a profit of about Kshs 18,000 every month.

Erupe was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs 10,000. He is planning to use the amount to buy video cassettes which his customers want so they have something to watch in the hotel and some more hotel utensils. He hopes to make a profit which he will use to boost his business.

Erupe has future plans of opening other branches so that he can improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy video cassettes and hotel utensils

loans.name: Shameem Iqbal Masih's Group

texts.en:
Shameem lives in the city of Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and famous for its textile industry. She is 42 years old, married to I. M.. Her husband has a business selling fruit. He puts the fruit on his four-wheeled cart every day and goes from street to street to sell them. He makes about 300-400 PKRs per day from his fruit selling business which is not sufficient to fulfill the needs of the family. 

Shameem is a housewife. She plays the role of a mother and a wife very well. She has given birth to two daughters and a son. Both her daughters work in people’s homes earning a small income. They do different kinds of household work like washing clothes and washing dishes. They work to contribute to their family financially. Her son is 17 years old and doesn’t currently work.
 
Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy some fresh seasonal fruits to re-sell. Shameem is hopeful that by investing the loan amount in her husband’s business, his income will grow through increasing sales. She is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her third loan application. With her previous loans, she has proved to be a responsible person who has paid her installments on time and has never missed a meeting. 
 
Note: In the photo, Shameem is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, es una mujer muy buena y alegre, vive con sus hijos en la selva central (localidad de Cahuide). Cuando era niña aprendió a cultivar plátanos, oficio que le ayudo mucho; ya que cuando tuvo su familia adquirió un pequeño terreno con el que pudo sembrar plátanos y también café; por ser plantas estables y duraderas; además le genera buenas rentas que le permitió educar y mantener su hogar. Dora viaja constantemente a la ciudad para poder vender sus productos en el mercado de su localidad, donde el café tiene mucha demanda y le genera mayores ganancias. Lo que más disfruta, es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo con sus hijos, ya que ellos tienen sus propios terrenos de cultivo y salen adelante juntos.  Más adelante podrá adquirir una computadora con la que podrá tener un negocio de tipeo, proyecto que ya podrá hacerse realidad. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y agradece a todas las personas que integran su banco comunal pues hicieron posible que salgue adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de plantas de plátanos en su variedad de “seda” e “isla” y también en abono para aplicar a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Dora is a happy, good person. She lives with her children in the central jungle of the town of Cahuide. As a child she learned to farm bananas, an activity that has helped her a lot. When she started her own family, Dora acquired a small piece of land to plant bananas and coffee. They are reliable and hardy crops that generate good profits; this has allowed her to educate and provide for her family.

Dora travels constantly to the city to sell her products in the local market, where coffee is in high demand and generates better income. What Dora enjoys most is to be able to spend most of her time with her children, who already have their own farms and work together to build better lives. Soon, Dora will be able to buy a computer to start a typing business.

This is her third loan with MFP and Dora is grateful to all the members of her community bank, who have made it possible for her to succeed. With this loan, Dora will purchase "seda" and "isla" variety baN. plants and fertilizer for her coffee plants.

loans.use: Purchase of banana plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena L. is from the town of Banga. She is 59 years old. To make a living, Nena owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nena has been engaged in farming for over 30 years.

Nena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Asia Khurram's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a resident of Siddiq Akbar town which is a housing colony located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and is well known for its textile industry. Her home is a small one of two rooms. She shifted there 10 years ago with her family. Asia is a 55-year-old housewife. It is difficult to work at such an old age which is why she stays at home and manages the household chores. She is the mother of three sons who work and help their father in his vegetable selling business. 

Asia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s vegetable selling business. With the loan amount, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell through his vegetable shop in the market. She is hopeful that with the loan investment her husband’s business will grow which will have a positive impact on his business and improve the family's standard of living. She is a new borrower from Asasah and this is her first loan application. She expects that it will be a good experience for her and her family as well. 

Note: In the photo, Asia is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Prodige Plus Group

texts.en:
Damien is the leader of the community bank named “Prodige Plus” which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity by receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses. Damien, aged 51 and married, has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. He operates a general store to the east of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his environment. 

Damien would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that currently earns him $30 per week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. Damien is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE DRC, having twice obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar, and milk and reselling them at a profit. Damien has four children whose are aged between 15 and 29, one of whom attends school.

loans.use: To increase stock of cans, rice, sugar and milk for re-sale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli L. is from the town of Banga. He is 43 years old, married and has 2 children aged 8 and 6. Noli owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Noli also helps his wife sell dried fish in their town. His wife wanted to have an extra source of income for the family, so they invested in selling dried fish.

Noli joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noli has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and dried fish. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and dried fish

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah A. is from the town of Banga. She is 34 years old. Leah is single and hopes to have her own family someday. To make a living, Leah owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Leah also sells mobile phone credit loads in her neighborhood. She said it helps in their daily needs.

Leah joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to buy feed and additional mobile load credits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional mobile load credits to sell.

loans.name: Semilla Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Panamericana se encuentra la zona oeste de la Ciudad de El Alto, acoge a más de cien asociaciones comunales,  “Semilla” es una de las más nuevas, pues está iniciando su segundo ciclo; de las ocho integrantes siete son mujeres y uno es varón. 

La presidenta es la señora Mercedes, ella  trabaja desde hace un ciclo en Pro Mujer, su primer crédito fue de Bs 2000.-, actualmente ha solicitado un crédito por Bs 4000.- y piensa invertirlo en la compra de abarrotes e insumos para la venta de pollo frito en su pensión, como: arroz, fideo, papas, postres.  Realiza las ventas en su domicilio, todos los días.  Le ayudan en el negocio su hija mayor y dos empleadas más.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta más de Pro Mujer, la señora comenta que las capacitaciones y también, el consultorio por que tiene una buena atención.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: negocios de servicio, comercio e inclusive producción.
texts.en:
The Centro Focal de Panamericana (Panamerican Focal Center), located in the eastern zone of the City of El Alto, brings together more than 100 communal associations.  “Semilla” (Seed) is one of the most recent ones. It's now initiating its 2nd cycle of loans.  Of its 8 members, 7 are women and 1 is a man.

The president is Mercedes, who has worked since the first loan cyle with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman).  Her first loan was for 2,000 bolivianos.  At present, she is soliciting a loan for 4,000 bolivianos.  Mercedes plans to invest it in groceries and supplies for selling fried chicken meals from her boarding house, including rice, beans, potatoes and deserts.  She sells meals from her home every day.  Her older daughter and 2 other employees help her in the business.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she pointed to the training sessions and also, the office, because it offers good service.

As for the types of businesses within the Semilla association, they are varied, but among them are service, commercial, and even production businesses.

loans.use: BUYING RICE, BEANS, POTATOES AND DESERTS IN ORDER TO SELL MEALS

loans.name: Kimya Plus Group

texts.en:
Vana B. is a chairwoman of a Community bank named “Kimya Plus”, which is composed of 10 microentrepreneurs jointly united to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Vana has been in business since 1980 with a beginning capital of $100. Today, she operates a restaurant. She is 61years old, a widow and has five children between the ages of 20 and 35. One of them goes to school. Her restaurant prospered thanks to Hope’s loans. With the profit of about $20 earned per day, she increased her working capital. Currently, Vana is happy to be part of one of MFI Hope’s groups.  She joined the group in 2007 and her business has been reinforced through the fourteen loans she received from MFI Hope DRC and repaid them properly. Her dream is to open a catering service. Her restaurant is located in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of the restaurant in order to reinforce the working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith M. is from the town of Banga. She is 40 years old. Judith is married and has 2 children, aged 14 and 10. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith also runs a sari-sari store that she was able to start from her income from the farm. She sells rice and other products. Judith hopes for her ventures to prosper.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Cristina De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
Cristina de 36 años, tiene un taller de costura y confección. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. 

Desde joven ella comenzó a trabajar cosiendo ropa poco a poco con esfuerzo y después de tener sus hijos ella busco alternativas mas eficaces para tener mas clientela. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 20h30pm todos los días. Tiene un pequeño taller de productos químicos en donde trabaja su esposo. 

Para seguir con el taller de costura ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos y así elaborar mas ropa. En el futuro quiere entregar ropa a empresas con una buena calidad y precios bajos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 36 years old, and she has a seamstress shop.  She lives along the Perimetral Highway, which is a periurban area that is surrounded by the Guayaquil salt marsh.

When she was young she started working by sewing clothes.  After having her children she slowly, and with effort, looked for more effective ways to have more customers.  She currently works from 7:30 a.m. until 8:30 p.m. everyday.  She has a small workshop with chemical products where her husband works.

In order to keep going with the seamstress shop, she wants to use the loan to buy fabric and thread.  That way she will make more clothes.  In the future she wants to deliver to businesses good quality clothes at a low price.

loans.use: Fabric

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly L. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Nelly is married and has 7 children. Her eldest child is 21 years old and the youngest is 6. To make a living, Nelly owns & operates a business raising crops, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nelly also grows pigs for fattening and sale. She hopes to acquire more pigs to raise.

Nelly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nelly has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies, feed and additional piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, feeds and additional piglets.

loans.name: Luz Rene

texts.en:
Luz Renie Ibanjie, has three children. She has been working as a farmer since she got married. She is working so hard is for her children. She wants them to finish their studies. By supporting their education, she can ensure that her children will have a brighter future.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. She believed that she will be able to augment their income by buying all the farming needs. The income she will be able to generate from her business will also help to buy the basic necessities for the family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D., 52, manages a small farm. She grows rice and she earns enough income from it to buy food and cover the basic needs for her family. She also grows pigs and she dreams that someday she will have a bigger piggery business. 

At the moment, she would like to apply a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it for buying farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: Farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Yadira Patricia

texts.es:
Yadira Y. envía nuevamente saludos a sus financiadores y dice que está muy contenta porque terminó de pagar su crédito y le quedó muy lindo su salón con los nuevos equipos y enseres que compró, le está yendo muy bien, porque está más ventilada y vistosa su sala de belleza. Ahora con su nuevo credikiva  comprará vitrinas para surtirlas con productos de belleza con dos fines: para utilizarlo en su trabajo diario  y para venderlos mientras asesora a sus clientes respecto al cuidado de su cabellos y como mantenerlo hermosos. 
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Yadira Y. siga a continuación este enlace: 
http://partners.kiva.org/lend/163587
texts.en:
Yadira Y. sends new greetings to her funders, and says that she is very pleased because she finished paying her loan and as a result she has a beautiful new salon with the new equipment and furnishings she bought.  The business is going very well because the salon is better ventilated and more colorful.  Now, with her new Kiva loan, she will buy glass display cases so that she can fill them with the best beauty products for two purposes: to use in her daily work and to sell to her customers, whom she advises regarding hair care and how to keep their hair beautiful.  

If you want to know more about Yadira's history, click on the link below:
http://partners.kiva.org/lend/163587

loans.use: to buy glass display cases and beauty products

loans.name: Judy Lee

texts.en:
Judy Lee P. owns a small rice farm. She has three children. She dreams of a good life for her family, which is why she wants to earn more in her business. The reason why she joined CEVI is that she likes the program so much because of the insurance and savings offered. 

She wants to apply for another loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. She is optimistic that someday, she will be able to acquire more land so that she can plant more rice and earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Bayardo Arsenio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Arsenio B. B., tiene la edad de 61 años vive en Lomas de Guadalupe, es casado y con su esposa tienen 8 hijos mayores de edad, casados y habitan en sus hogares particulares, solo el menor  de 19 años habita con sus padres, apoyando a las tareas del hogar y los trabajos de su familia, ellos se dedican a la elaboración y comercialización de pan y cereales, que durante 6 años ha sido el sustento diario de la familia, permitiéndoles recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades de la familia, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de zinc, bloques, cemento, hierro para mejorar el local donde tuestan los granos, esta inversión les aportará  mejores comodidades un amplio espacio de trabajo y con esto la posibilidad de incrementar la producción del material, puesto que han observado un aumento en la demanda, que a corto plazo les favorecerá con mejores condiciones económicas o recursos para incursionar en nuevos mercados, permitiéndoles solventar los estudios universitarios a su hijo menor y apoyarle en su desarrollo económico social de su vida.
texts.en: Mr. Bayardo Arsenio B. B. is 61 years old and lives in Lomas de Guadalupe. He is married and he and his wife have 8 grown children who are also married and live in their own homes. Only the youngest, who is 19 years old, lives with his family, helping with household chores and the family business. They work making and marketing bread and cereals. During the past 6 years, these have been the day-to-day means of support for the family, providing them with economic resources to meet the needs of the family. It is for this business that he is requesting a loan to buy zinc, bricks, cement, and iron to improve the location where they toast the grains. This investment will contribute to increasing their comforts with a large work space and with this, the possibility of increasing the material production, a place where they have observed a growing demand. Which, in a short time, will favor them with better economic conditions or resources to invest in new markets, permitting them to pay for university for their youngest son and help them in their socio-economic development.

loans.use: Remodeling of business location

loans.name: Gulzar's Group

texts.en:
Gulzar belongs to a mid-sized city called Vehari, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agricultural industry. She has been living in the area of 555/EB with her family in a two-room brick house for many years. 

She is a housewife, staying at home to take care of her children and family. In her spare time, she sews clothes to supplement the income of her family. She mainly works for her neighboring clients and due to her quality work, they prefer to give her orders above other businesswomen of the community.
 
Her husband's name is A. S. and he runs a grocery shop in the market. He offers different grocery items that are used daily, such as rice, cooking oil, spices and lentils, etc., to his clients through his shop. His shop is located in a busy place, so in order to meet the requirements of his customers, he has to keep groceries in bulk every time in his grocery shop; otherwise, the customers will go to other grocery shops and that will affect his sales. 
 
Therefore, Gulzar has applied for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, he will buy the groceries in bulk quantities, which enables him to fulfill the orders of his customers on a timely basis and makes his customers become regulars.
  
Gulzar is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and he will be able to successfully fulfill the requirements of his customers and increase the household income as well.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk quantities for the grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used belts

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Ricardo D. owns and manages a small rice farm. He has three sons and two daughters. His ambition is to send his children to school. He wants them to be very educated so that when they are older, they can find better employment and be able to support their children well.

He would like to ask for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers and for the rental of equipment that he will use for his farm. Ricardo has been a farmer for 20 years already. His knowledge in agriculture is truly helping him raise his children well.

loans.use: Farm supplies and equipment rental

loans.name: Willie

texts.en:
Willie N., 53, has decided to invest in his farm. He wants to improve the size of his harvest. Normally, he only gets enough for his family and now, what he likes to do is to maximize his farm so that he will be able to provide well for the needs of his family. 

At the moment, he would like to ask for a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He thinks that getting a loan will be helpful to support the growth of his business. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. He is hopeful that he will be able to increase his yield and profit.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria de 30 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución. Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de bisutería. 

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bisutería, vende la bisutería a sus amigos y vecinos para tener dinero y en ocasiones de dedica a trabajar como veterinaria para tener mas ingresos. Trabaja desde las muy temprano sola pero uno de los problemas que tiene en la zona donde vive es la delincuencia y casi no puede recorre las calles para vender. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, pinturas y bloques y así darle una mejor fachada a su casa y que sus clientes compren la bisutería. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener su propia oficina para ser veterinaria autorizada.
texts.en:
Gloria is 30 years old and lives in a periurban area called Duran, which is characterized by its disappearing ecosystem. She has a small business selling costume jewelry.

Gloria makes and sells costume jewelry to her friends and neighbors to have money. Sometimes, she also works as a veterinarian to have more income. She works alone starting very early in the morning but one of the problems in the area where she lives is delinquency, so she can hardly go out to the streets to sell.

With the loan, she wants to purchase construction materials such as cement, paint, and blocks so that she can give her house a better look and so that her customers will buy her jewelry. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and have her own office to be an official veterinarian.

loans.use: Cement, blocks

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A., together with her husband, has raised her four children with her farming business. She has been in this business for 35 years now.  

Her family is from Surallah, a town in South Cotabato in which farming is the common source of livelihood for most people.  

She applied for a loan from CEVI to finance her farming needs like fertilizer, seeds and other chemicals that will help produce a better yield for the harvest season. Any income that she will get from this business will be used to help her grandchildren by saving for their future. Alicia is 56 years old.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
At 66 years old,  Amparo is not showing signs of slowing down when it comes to giving her best to what she loved most - and that is farming. She is from Surralah.  

For 45 years, she and her husband have diligently tilled the land to provide for their family’s needs. Her children are all grown up and have families of their own, but she is still thinking of herself and her husband’s future needs. 

With this in mind, she applied for a loan to continue her business. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer and seeds to sustain their farming needs and groceries for their consumption. Any income derived from farming will be used as savings for old age and financial assistance to her grandchildren.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita E. is 62 years old and from the town of Surallah. She is married with five grown children. Farming has been the source of income for her family. She wanted to give herself and her spouse financial security now that they are old. For that very reason, she is working hard on her farming business and requests a loan to improve her yield. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. Her profit will be used to save for old age and for the family’s daily consumption.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack O. is 40 years old and married. He has four children aged between 3 and 12 years. His business is located at a busy market called Likoni in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

He has been selling such items as rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks and others for the last 10 years to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is lack of enough capital and also insecurity in the area. He works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more eggs to supply to people in the Likoni area as well as to finish constructing his house. He says he is happy to see his business pick up, especially after the post-election violence. He hopes that one day, he will diversify and become a big supplier of chicken to the area. He describes himself as smart, innovative and creative.

loans.use: To buy eggs and finish constructing a house

loans.name: Ramon  Antonio

texts.es:
Ramón García tiene 51 años y vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio dedicado a la fabricación de bolsos y calzado artesanal, tiene 3 hijos y 35 años de experiencia en el oficio con él que ha logrado generar ingresos para el y para sus hijos porque en la actualidad trabaja con dos de ellos.
Sus ventas repuntan en los meses desde Marzo a Septiembre, aunque en los otros meses no le va mal, porque tiene muchos clientes que prefieren sus productos, en este sector hay mucha competencia, pero se sostiene con buenos precios y es muy responsable en la entrega de sus pedidos. Trabaja desde las 8:00  AM hasta las 8:00 PM de lunes a sábados y esta persistencia logra resultados, por eso   recupera su inversión con utilidades, pero no responde rápidamente a sus clientes porque no tiene un capital adicional, con el que trabajar a la misma velocidad que requieren los clientes sus productos, este es la razón por la cual está solicitando su credickiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos para fabricar bolsos, calzados que ya tiene encargado en el centro de Barranquilla, a propósito de la temporada de fin de año.
Su sueño es convertir su pequeño taller, en una gran empresa con un punto de venta y exhibición para que el público escoja a la medida lo que quiere que Ramón le fabrique.
texts.en:
Ramón García, 51, lives in the "Ciudadela 20 de Julio" neighborhood.  He produces hand-made shoes and handbags.  He has 3 children and 35 years of experience in this occupation, with which he has managed to generate income for himself and his children.  He currently works with 2 of his children.  

His sales are highest in the months between March and September, although in the other months sales are not bad, because he has many customers who prefer his products. In this line of work there is a lot of competition, but he is able to maintain the business because his prices are good and he is very responsible with delivering his orders.  He works from 8am until 8pm Mondays through Saturdays, and this persistence gets results, as he is able to recoup his investment with a profit.  However, he cannot respond quickly to his customers because he lacks sufficient capital to keep up with the pace at which his customers are demanding his products.  For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, with which he will buy a greater quantity of raw materials and supplies to make purses and shoes that he already has orders for from stores in downtown Barranquilla for the upcoming season.  His dream is to convert his small workshop into a large business, with a place where he can exhibit and sell his products and where he can produce custom-made items for the public.

loans.use: to buy materials to make handbags and shoes that he already has orders for

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie has been operating a computer shop for three years now. Aside from that, he also tills a rice farm and his wife also helps him with a hog-raising business. They have a 2-year-old son. His family lives in Surallah, South Cotabato. 

Thinking ahead, he dreams to maximize his profit in these businesses. He applied for a loan in order to purchase farm inputs and increase the number of hogs that he is currently raising. He wants to buy additional piglets and stocks of pig feed. This way, if he can save enough profits, he can use it to reinvest in other business opportunities. Any income generated will be used for his son’s future education and investment in other business options.

loans.use: Farm supplies and additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Lidia es casada, tiene 5 hijos estudiantes, Lidia viaja a las ferias de donde compra cereales, quesos, animales menores, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos.
Lidia solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de trigo, cebada.
Los sueños de Lidia son construir otra casa pero de material noble y la buena educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Virgen María communal bank. She is married and has five children who are students. Lidia travels to the markets where she buys cereals, cheeses, young animals, and other products that she sells in the wholesale food market.

Lidia is requesting a 1000 PEN loan for the purchase of wheat and barley. Her dreams are to build another house with stronger material, and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase wheat and barley

loans.name: Zonia Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Graciela es soltera, vive con sus padres y un sobrino que esta a su responsabilidad, Graciela viaja a las ferias de donde compra cereales, quesos, animales menores, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos y de tienda en tienda, en algunas oportunidades procesa los cereales.
Graciela solicita un crédito de 1500 soles para la compra de trigo, quinua, maíz.
Graciela desea construir una casa en la ciudad de Lima donde desea que su hijo estudie.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Virgen María communal bank. She is single and lives with her parents and her nephew, for whom she is responsible. Graciela travels to the markets where she buys cereals, cheeses, young animals, and other products that she sells in the wholesale food market and from store to store. Sometimes she processes the cereals.

Graciela is requesting a 1500 PEN loan for the purchase of wheat, quinoa, and corn. She wants to build a house in Lima where she wants her son to study.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, quinoa, and corn.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.fr:
Femme célibataire âgée de 54ans mère de 5enfants dont l’âge varie de 15 à 58ans.
Depuis  30ans, elle vend de la layette au marché avec un capital de 10000frs

Son étalage et ses articles pour les enfants attirent les futures mamans et parents.
Par jour, elle vend  15000f minimum et 50000f maximum.
Le prêt va lui permettre de renouveler son stock de marchandises pour vendre plus en achetant : 10douzaine de couches, 10 ensembles tricots, 10ensembles « petits bateaux », 
5 douzaines de paires de chaussons, 20robes fillettes, 10bermudas, 5lots  de tee-shirts  et 
Chaussettes mixtes.

Elle voudrait un jour  avoir une boutique et devenir femme d’affaire dans ce domaine.
Avec les revenus  qu’elle va générée, elle va s’occupée de la scolarité des ses enfants et vivre dans des bonnes conditions.
Elle est prise comme exemple dans son quartier.
texts.en:
Philomene is a well known, 54 year old, mother of 5 children, with the youngest  at 15 years old. For 30 years she has sold children's cloths at the market. She maintains a working capital of 10,000 francs. Her shop display of children's articles attracts future mothers and parents. Every day she sells 15,000 to 50,000 francs worth of articles.

The loan will enable her to replenish her stock of merchandise to sell. She will buy 10 dozen diapers,10 knitted outfits and ten "petit bateaux" (little boat) outfits, 5 dozen pairs of shoes, 20 girls dresses, 10 "Bermuda" outits, 5 lots of Tee-Shirts and assorted pairs of slippers.

One day, she would like to own a boutique and be the leader in her business. With the revenue earned from this loan, she will be able to meet the children's school fees and live in better conditions. She is an example to her community.

loans.use: To buy baby bottles, childrens outfits, diapers, slippers and underware for resale

loans.name: Gotitas De Agua Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Collpani es uno de los más alejados de la regional,  acoge a más de cien asociaciones comunales,  “Gotitas de Agua” es una de las más antiguas, cuenta ya con 21 ciclos, programando ya su ciclo número 22, de ocho integrantes siete son mujeres y uno es varón. 

La señora Sonia es la presidenta, la señora  Elsa es la tesorera y la señora Carmen es la secretaria de actas, las tres conforman la mesa directiva. 
La señora Elsa, la tesorera, participa de los programas de Pro Mujer, desde hace 5 años, ella comenta que ingresó a Pro Mujer gracias a la invitación de unas amigas.  Su negocio es la venta de artefactos electrodomésticos, desde hace 8 años.  Nadie le enseñó este negocio, fue superándose poco a poco. Su primera solicitud fue de Bs 800.-ahora solicitó Bs. 2000.- en ambos casos, su objetivo era la compra de mercadería. Las ventas son realizadas en la zona de Villa Dolores de 9 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde.  El esposo es quien le ayuda en esta larga jornada de trabajo.

Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta más de Pro Mujer, la señora comenta que el crédito para el negocio y también, el consultorio es bueno.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: venta de artefactos, venta  de chompas, venta de carne de chancho, venta de adornos, venta de refrescos y dulces
texts.en:
The Collpani Community Center is located in one of the most remote areas in the region and hosts more than one hundred Communal Associations. One of the oldest is “Gotitas de Agua” (Water Droplets), which has completed 21 loan cycles in the program. The group is currently in loan cycle #22 with eight members, seven women and one man.

The Board of Directors for this group consists of Sra. Sonia (President), Sra. Elsa (Treasurer), and Sra. Carmen (Secretary). The treasurer, Sra. Elsa, has participated in the programs of Pro Mujer for five years. She says she joined the organization after being invited by some of her friends. Elsa has been in the business of selling electrical appliances for eight years. Nobody taught her how to operate such a business, so she had to learn little by little. Her first loan was in the amount of 800 BOB, but now she is requesting 2000 BOB. In both cases, her goal was to acquire more merchandise. She conducts her sales in the District of Villa Dolores between the hours of 9am and 6pm. Her husband assists her during the long work day.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, Elsa says she enjoys having loans for her business. In addition, she states the health clinic is excellent.

There are different businesses represented by this Communal Association. These include retail establishments that sell appliances, sweaters, pork, decorations, soft drinks, and candy.

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John G. N. M. is a young, married man. His wife is a business lady and they have one child, aged 13 years, whom they hope to give a quality education to the university level. 

His business is located on Moi Avenue in the Central Business District of Mombasa. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many, many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He has been selling mobile phones and phone accessories, including batteries, chargers, etc. He has been in this business for two years now and he says that this business is profitable. The major challenge he has is lack of enough capital. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more mobile-phone accessories to meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that his business will grow and enable him to import mobile phones in bulk from China. He describes himself as honest, trustworthy and committed to his business.

loans.use: Mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Mercedes es viuda, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 5 son estudiantes, Mercedes tiene un cafetín en un colegio en donde vende comida, golosinas, bebidas, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Mercedes solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Los sueños de Mercedes son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una buena casa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary). She is widowed and has eight children, five of whom are in school. Mercedes manages a school cafeteria where she sells food, candy, beverages, and fruit. This business enables her to help her children.

Mercedes is requesting a loan of 3000 PEN in order to buy candy and sodas. She dreams of seeing her children become professionals and having a nice house.

loans.use: Purchase candy & sodas

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Like most people in Surallah, 39-year-old Arlene is into the farming business. She is married with three children. Their education is her top priority. Aside from farming, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells products like soy sauce, detergent soap and many others. 

She applied for a loan to finance their school expenses and to buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She aims to increase profitability of her business. Her income will go to her family’s daily consumption, to her children’s education and to savings for the future.

loans.use: Farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos, Epifania viaja a las ferias de la región donde compra animales que luego lleva a la  Selva Ayacuchana, Epifania vende carne que reparte al por mayor en el mercado y tiendas y de la Selva compra Tocra (producto que es obtenido de la quema de un árbol, es un saborizante) que comercializa en la ciudad de Lima.
Epifania es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria y necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Epifania es mejorar su negocio y educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Epifania is in a common law marriage and has six children. She travels to the regional fairs where she buys animals to bring back to the jungle in Ayacucho. Epifania sells the meat in bulk at the market and in shops. While in the jungle, she buys “tocra” (a product obtained from charred tree bark and used as a flavoring) to sell in the city of Lima.

Epifania is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary) and needs a loan of 3000 PEN in order to buy cattle. She dreams of improving her business and providing an education for her children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase cattle for butchering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer for their coffee plantations

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, Maria tiene un pequeño cafetín en un local comercial, vende hamburguesas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria, Maria también vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria y solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de perfumes.
Maria sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is in a common law marriage and has three children. She has a small food stand in a commercial location where she sells hamburgers and drinks. Maria manages her business every day as a street vendor. She also sells cosmetics through catalogs and offers these products to her friends and relatives.

Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary) and requests a loan of 1500 PEN in order to buy perfumes. She dreams of improving her business and seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes

loans.name: Agripino

texts.es:
Agripino es socio del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Agripino es casado y tiene 6 hijos, Agripino se dedica a la compra de papa de los productores luego lo comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en lagunas oportunidades lo lleva a Lima.
Agripino necesita un préstamo de 2500 para la compra de papa.
Agripino sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agripino is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary). He is married and has six children. Agripino buys potatoes from the producers and later sells them at the supply market in the city of Ayacucho. On a few occasions, he will take his products to Lima to sell.

Agripino needs a loan of 2500 PEN in order to buy potatoes. He dreams of improving his business and providing a good education for his children.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Adan Renan

texts.es:
Adan es casado, tiene 2 hijos, Adan tiene un Bar Restaurante llamado Characato en donde vende bebidas y platos extras, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Adan hace algunos meses aperturo una botica en local alquilado.
Adan es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de medicinas.
Adan sueña con ampliar su negocio con una cadena de boticas.
texts.en:
Adan is married and has two children. He owns a bar and restaurant called “Characato” where he sells beverages and side dishes. Adan manages this business every day. In addition, Adan opened a pharmacy a few months ago in a rented location.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary) and requests a loan in the amount of 2000 PEN in order to buy medicines. Adan dreams of expanding his business and having a chain of drugstores.

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Carmen es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, Carmen se dedica a la venta de licores, caña en un local alquilado ubicado cerca de un terminal terrestre, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de caña.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary). She is widowed and has five children. Carmen sells liquor and rum from a rented location near the bus terminal. She manages her business every day with the help of her children.

Carmen needs a loan of 1500 PEN to buy rum.

loans.use: Purchase rum

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 55 years old. Myrna is married and has three children. Her eldest is 18 years old. To make a living, Myrna makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice cream to the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 18 years.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Myrna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mwania

texts.en:
Mwania K. is a married man. His wife is a business lady and they have two children, aged 10 years old and 3 years old, whom they hope to give a quality education to the university level. 

His business is located at the open-air market called Kongowea in Mombasa and is well-known by the name Mwania K. Spares. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many, many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He has been selling motorcycle and bicycle spare parts to the local people. He has been in this business for eight years now and he says that this business is profitable. The major challenges he has are lack of enough capital and the high prices for the spare parts. 

He is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more motorcycle spare parts to meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that his business will grow and he sees himself opening many more hardware stores, therefore becoming a director. He describes himself as honest, trustworthy and committed to his business.

loans.use: Stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta L., photographed with her grandchild, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 54 years old. Violeta is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Violeta also started making candles. She first sold her candles to friends and now to more people in her town. She also plans to invest in selling mobile phone load credits because it's what her neighbors usually look for.

Violeta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used additional merchandise to sell, raw materials for candle making and invest in e-loading. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: additional merchandise to sell, raw materials for candle making and invest in e-loading

loans.name: Santiago Antonio

texts.es:
Don Santiago de 45 años de edad, reside en El Transito Departamento de San Miguel y vive con su esposa y un hermano de él, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, negocio que inicio por la ayuda de su madre por el momento el negocio lo atienden los tres Santiago, su esposa y su hermano con un horario de seis de la mañana a seis de la tarde, don Santiago quiere invertir en el negocio para ampliar los productos que ofrece pero no cuenta con capital para realizarlo; Es por este motivo que él solicita un préstamo para la compra de Aceite, jabón, sal, arroz, azúcar, y otros que desea tener su inventario con suficiente cantidad para dar abasto a su demanda, este préstamo ayudara a fortalecer su negocio y a mejorar sus ingresos.
Los sueños de Don Santiago son crecer como comerciante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is 45 years old, resides in El Transito (The Transit), San Miguel Department, and lives with his wife and brother.  He sells products of primary necessity, such as rice, beans, and sugar.  Santiago began the business with his mother's help.

At the moment, the business is attended by the three of them – Santiago, his wife, and his brother – on a daily schedule, from 6:00am until 6:00pm.  Santiago wishes to invest in the business to expand the products offered, but he lacks the capital to do so.

This is why Santiago is requesting a loan, to buy cooking oil, soap, salt, rice, sugar, and other items he wishes to have in his inventory in sufficient quantity to supply the demand.  The loan will help him strengthen his business and improve his income.

Santiago's dreams are to grow as a merchant and to improve the condition of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: BUYING RICE, SUGAR, OIL, AND OTHER PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Timothe

texts.fr:
Homme de 49 ans marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie de 22ans à 20ans. Ayant un niveau d’étude universitaire, il s’est lancé dans le commerce des plastiques pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille en 2007 avec un capital de 100000frs.sa boutique est située sur une grande avenue à côté d’un petit marché, il à des clients réguliers et fait des revenus considérables allant de 20000frs à 50000frs par jours.

Avec ce prêt il va renforcer son commerce en achetant : des cantines, paniers en plastique, chaises, bassine et cuvette.

Son ambition est d’avoir plus de revenu afin d’ouvrir d’autres point de vente. Il aimera soutenir ses enfants et en améliorant leurs condition de vie.
Discret, et fait attention à tout le monde, il est  prit comme exemple par les jeunes gens de son quartier.
texts.en:
This 49-year-old man is married and has two children, ages 20 and 22. He attended university. 

In 2007, he started selling plastic ware with a capital of 100 000frs to support his family. He keeps a shop on a major street near a small market. He has regular customers, and earns substantial revenues averaging from 20 000 to 50 000frs per day.

With this loan, he plans to strengthen his business by buying bottles, baskets, chairs, bowls and basins.

His goal is to boost his income and open additional retail outlets. He wants to keep providing for his children by improving their living conditions. 

Discreet and attentive, he is a role model for the local youth.

loans.use: To buy bowls, baskets, tables, basins, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Fuerza De Vida Group

texts.es: Herlinda tiene 42 años y es conviviente, vive en la zona de Pariachi en Huaycan es la presidenta del grupo “Jesús Fuerza de Vida” que lleva 6 años trabajando con Edaprospo y es conformado por 7 vecinas las cuales son amigas y comparten la devoción a Cristo. Herlinda vende productos Omnilife  para ayudar a su pareja en el mantenimiento de su hogar, también ah logrado poner una bodega en su casa para así poder tener los recursos para mejorar y arreglar su casa. Herlinda desea ampliar su negocio y poner una librería pero para esto necesita que Edapropso le ayude con las habilitaciones que aportan de capital a su negocio.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 42 years old and living with her partner in the Pariachi zone in Huaycan.  She is the president of the “Jesus Fuerza de Vida” (Jesus Force of Life) Group, which has been working with Edaprospo for 6 years.  The group is composed of 7 neighbors who are friends and share their devotion to Christ.

Herlinda sells Omnilife products in order to aid her partner in maintaining her home.  She has also managed to create a general store in her house, in order to have the resources to repair and improve her home.

Herlinda wants to expand her business and install a book store but for this, she needs Edaprospo's help with the financing that will contribute to her business capital.

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS AND SUPPLIES TO SELL IN HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es:
Doña Rosa de 56 años posee una tienda donde ofrece productos para el hogar, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel y vive con su esposo quien le ayudo a iniciar el negocio, ella no tiene un horario fijo para atender a los clientes y por el momento desea invertir en artículos que le son demandados pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar la inversión.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como Maíz, Aceite, Arroz, Frijoles, jabón que son los que más buscan los clientes pues estos son consumidos en todos los hogares.
Con este préstamo crecerá su negocio, atenderá mejor a los clientes pues su inventario estará surtidos de muchos productos; Las proyecciones de Doña Rosa son aumentar sus ventas, recibir mejores ingresos que les permita solventar sus necesidades y mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old. She owns a store where she offers products for the home. She lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel Department. She lives with her husband, who helped her to start the business. She does not have a set schedule for serving customers. At this time, she wants to invest in the products that her customers want. However, she does not have the capital necessary to make the investments.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase corn, oil, rice, beans and soap, which are the products asked for and used most often by her clients.

With this loan, she will grow her business and serve her clients better, since her inventory will be better stocked. Rosa’s expectations for the future are to increase her sales, to receive a better income in order to take care of her necessities and to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar

loans.name: Amira  Luz

texts.es: Amira R., ha trabajado mucho con su cónyuge en un negocio que idearon cuando su cuñado les propuso venderle un punto de venta de productos para el hogar,  que ellos surtieron con los primeros financiamientos recibidos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la  que han logrado hacerle adecuaciones a su local, incrementar sus ventas y poder educar a sus hijos. Y es que Amira no solo tiene el negocio de mercancía en punto de venta bien ubicado, sino que además elabora empanadas, arepas y otras frituras y las familias de su vecindad se desayunen con sus productos; así mismo en su local puso un servicio de telecomunicaciones o SAI, que fue su primera inspiración empresarial, porque ella dice que una mujer no debe quedarse haciendo los oficios domésticos y con los brazos cruzados, esperando el ingreso de su marido. Amira es una gran trabajadora, se levanta a las 4: 00 AM para preparar la masa y a las 6 se dedica con su madre al oficio de la fritangueria, luego organiza  todo lo que su esposo y un empleado deben llevar a los clientes, porque tiene 2 carretillas donde transportan por todas las calles de Soledad, la mercancía que vende y tiene mas de 500 clientes y este mismo número de tarjetas donde anota los nombre y el valor que de cada uno de ellos recupera semanalmente y que está distribuido en módicas cuotas pero en plazos largos. Su sueño ahora es tener varios puntos de venta y un gran almacén, en la actualidad quiere prepararse para la temporada de fin de año, donde las mercancía que más se comercializas son los juguetes, los electrodomésticos menores y la ropa y eso es lo que justamente quiere hacer con su credikiva, surtirse de estos artículos, porque su gran desafío es la gran competencia del sector y por eso ella venderá lo que su clientela necesite.
texts.en:
Amira R. and her husband have worked hard at their business they started after her brother-in-law suggested they establish a retail outlet selling products from their home. They were able to stock their business using the first few loans they received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped them make adjustments to their store, increase their sales, and provide an education for their children. Amira’s retail business is situated in a good location, but this is not the only activity in which she is involved. She also prepares turnovers, “arepas” (flat cornbread stuffed with various fillings), and fried foods that many families consume for breakfast. In addition, she offers telecommunication services from her store provided through SAI, which was the original product she provided through her business.

Amira says she started her business because she did not want to perform household chores all day and then sit around with her arms crossed while waiting for her husband to bring home a paycheck. She is a hard worker who wakes up at 4am to prepare the cornmeal. By 6am, Amira and her mother begin selling fried foods. Later in the day, she organizes the merchandise that her husband and an employee have to deliver to their customers. They have two pushcarts that they use to transport goods through the streets of Soledad. Amira has more than 500 customers, so she has to prepare the same number of invoice cards that state the customer’s name, the amount that has to be collected each week, and the list of products that have been delivered over the long term. Her dream is to have several retail outlets and a large warehouse. She currently wants to prepare for the year-end season when she sells more merchandise such as toys, small appliances, and clothing. For this reason, she plans to use her Kiva loan to stock these items. Her greatest challenge is the high level of competition in the area, so she wants to sell what her customers need.

loans.use: Purchase toys, small appliances, and clothing

loans.name: Zurelly  Antonia

texts.es:
Zurelly es una joven casada y con dos hijos, que al conocerla su rostro inspira ternura y mucha confianza, y son  estos los valores que  justamente   hacen que cada día crezca la clientela de su microempresa llamada: “Corte y peinado cabecita alegres “,  donde su razón de ser  es la imagen  infantil.
Su negocio nació cuando su hermana y cuñado la visitaron en la ciudad de Bucaramanga, lugar donde Zurelly  trabajaba en una peluquería para niños, al ver todo lo que ella sabia  respecto al negocio de peluquería infantil, le propusieron iniciar ese mismo negocio en la ciudad de Barranquilla, teniendo en cuenta que seria una oportunidad innovadora, porque no existía una peluquería dirigida a  los niños, por eso esta idea se convirtió en un emprendimiento innovador.
Zurelly dice que ella le debe esta iniciativa a Dios y a su gran propósito con su familia en el tema de unidad laboral; ellos iniciaron las tres hermanas y en la medida en que se dieron a conocer fueron enseñando a otras personas para que trabajaran con ellos;  porque este es precisamente su gran desafío, el encontrar al personal idóneo que aprenda las técnicas  y principalmente  que tengan  la relación, paciencia y la delicadeza para sus clientes estrellas: los Niños.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues han invertido todo sus ahorros en sacar su sueño  adelante y sus esfuerzos de inversión  los ha dirigido a la publicidad para darse a conocer y esto no es una tarea fácil, por eso como en la actualidad necesita tener un capital de trabajo para diversificar su oferta sobre todo en los peinados que requieren muchos insumos, como lacas, flores, cintas y detalles que adornan las cabecitas de los niños.
Su sueño es tener un local  propio para su negocio y además vender accesorios para bebes e infantil en general; su  mayor satisfacción es saber que con la ayuda de Dios todo es posible, lo demás es nuestro aporte en  perseverancia, , dedicación, empeño y amor  para lograr   lo que nos  propongamos.
texts.en:
Zurelly is a young woman who is married and has two children.  Anyone who has met her knows the look on her face inspires both tenderness and confidence, qualities that have helped her grow the customer base of her business called “Happy Cuts and Styles for Little Heads”.  The reason for her business is to promote children’s self-image.  Zurelly started her business when her sister and brother-in-law visited her in the city of Burcaramanga, where she was working at a children’s salon.  Since Zurelly knew everything about this type of business, her family suggested that she start her own establishment in the city of Barranquilla.  This would be a unique opportunity since a children’s stylist did not exist in the area, so she decided to turn this idea into an innovative enterprise.

Zurelly says she gives credit to God and to her family for the chance to work together to make this idea a reality.  She and her three sisters started by teaching other employees how to work with them since finding qualified staff is a great challenge.  They must learn the techniques for establishing relationships, demonstrating patience, and being sensitive with their star clients, the children.  

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Zurelly and her family have invested all of their savings so that they could move forward with their dream.  Their efforts have been invested in advertising because trying to draw publicity is not an easy task.  At the moment, Zurelly needs operating capital to diversify the services she offers.  She needs different types of supplies such as coloring, flowers, ribbons, and adornments used for styling children’s hair.

Her dream is to have a separate area within her business where she can sell general accessories for babies and children.  Zurelly says her greatest satisfaction comes from knowing that with God’s help, anything is possible.  She continues to demonstrate perseverance, dedication, commitment, and love in order to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Purchase supplies used for styling children's hair

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 22 años, convive con Viky, de 21 años, producto de su amor nació Mario de 3 años, a quien crían y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (localidad de Metrado). Desde hace ya 3 años que se dedica a la siembra de café y plátanos, todas las mañanas sale a cuidar la hectárea de café que sembró en su terreno de cultivo y cuando den fruto los venderá en el mercado central de ciudad. Cada quince días recoge plátanos para poder venderlos en su localidad; también cría gallinas de chacra; que son muy solicitadas en la capital. A Jesús le disgusta mucho cuando llegan las malas hierbas a las plantaciones de plátanos ya que su control resulta un grave problema; por ello siembra mayor cantidad de café y esta juntando mayor capital para poder sembrar a gran escala y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y está agradecido con su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de trabajar y apoyarlo incondicionalmente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 2 costales de abono de cuatrocientos soles para sus cafetales, producto que cosechará en estos meses.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 22, lives with Viky, age 21. The product of their love, Mario, is 3 years old. They are raising and educating him in their own home, located in the Peruvian forest in the community of Metrado.

For 3 years, Jesús has been involved in planting coffee and bananas. Every morning, he leaves to care for the hectare of coffee he grows on his farmland, and when the fruit is ripe he sells it in the central market of the city. Every 15 days, he gathers bananas in order to sell them in his community. He also raises poultry, which is much sought after in the capital.

It upsets Jesús a lot when weeds come into his banana grove since their control causes serious problems. For this reason, he is planting a greater quantity of coffee. This requires greater capital in order to be able to plant on a large scale and give a better quality of life to his family.

This is Jesús’ second loan with MFP, and he is grateful to his communal bank for giving him the opportunity to work and for its wholehearted support. With the loan that he is applying for he will buy 2 sacks of fertilizer, costing 400 soles, for his coffee plants, a product that he will harvest in the next few months.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is the resident of Samnabad, which is a housing complex located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry.

She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to fulfill the basic needs of her family. Her good quality work means that her clients come to her for orders. She started doing this work four years ago and in this short period she has received good recognition among the other business ladies of her community. 

Her husband's name is M. A. who is a private entrepreneur and deals with a fruit selling business in the market. He operates a shop where he sells the seasonal fruits to the customers.

Parveen has given birth to 4 sons: 2 of them work in a private company on monthly wages while one is getting his education.

Parveen has applied for a loan for the betterment of her sewing business. With the loan amount she will buy an electric sewing machine because the manual machine makes her tired quickly during sewing, which is affecting her health.  With the electric sewing machine, she will do work for longer hours without any problem and can complete more dresses in advance.

She is a new loan applicant and she hopes it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. K. is a married man. The wife is a farmer and they have seven children whom they hope to givea  quality education to the university level. His business is located near Docks Station at the port of Mombasa. He is a newspaper vendor. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites not forgetting the Indian ocean's white beaches. 

He has been selling newspapers to the local people especially those employed and others in business. He has been in this business for fourteen years now and he says that this business is profitable. His major challenge is lack of enough capital. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of kes 25,000 to continue expanding his newspaper business. He hopes that one day he will be a big newspaper and magazines distributor. He describes himself as honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: Capital for newspaper distribution

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: A decade has now elapsed since 48-year-old  Charles B. embarked on his drug store or pharmacy business in Maanyi Trading Center in Mityana. This married father of five draws experience from his training as a professional health worker or clinical officer to effect transparency, accountability and professionalism in his business.  His drug pharmacy is replete with myriad human medicines that he says many patients ask for. A profit of 500,000 shillings a month accrues to his business. Charles describes himself as cooperative, open-minded and progressive, and with this loan he wants to purchase more drugs for his pharmacy. With resales, he says he will broaden his accrued profits.

loans.use: The purchase of more drugs for resale at his pharmacy

loans.name: Dexsy Griselda

texts.es:
Dexsy vende productos lácteos,  vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución. 

Empezó a vender lácteos para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares de su familia. Cuando su esposo se quedo sin trabajo ella hizo oficial sus ventas para poder tener mas clientela. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido incrementar el capital de trabajo. Trabaja desde muy temprano repartiendo los lácteos a sus clientes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lácteos como yogurt para las ventas de su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local para la su negocio de lácteos.
texts.en:
Dexsy sells dairy products. She lives in a periurban area called “Duran” that is known for having a deteriorating ecosystem.

Dexsy began selling dairy products so that she could help cover her family’s expenses. When her husband lost his job, she officially began making sales in order to attract more customers. With a little bit of effort and dedication, she was able to increase her operating capital. Dexsy begins her work very early so that she can deliver dairy products to her customers.

The loan will be used to buy dairy products, such as yogurt, so that her business can continue generating sales. In the future, Dexsy would like to have a store where she can run her dairy products business.

loans.use: Purchase dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Acquire a pruning machine

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza Q. es una mujer muy trabajadora, que siempre busca las mejores técnicas para mejorar el calzado que ella misma fabrica, con   estilos muy modernos y diseños que cada día salen D. su propia inspiración. Esperanza es madre D. 6 hijos que hoy están en las edades D. 21 a 38 años y que sueña con verlos siempre prósperos y exitosos.  Ella desD. hace 30 años se dedica a esta actividad, aprendida cuando trabajó en grandes fabricas y esta experiencia la llevó a conocer muy bien el mercado D. clientes y  a también el proceso productivo del calzado, incursionando con su producto en la ciudad D. Bogotá y hasta en Cali.
Su gran desafío es la innovación D. sus diseños, por eso permanece cada día como observadora D. los distintos escenarios donD. se exhiben, igualmente la competencia trae un calzado importado, que aunque pueD. no tener la mejor calidad, presenta un buen precio, pero Esperanza se preocupa por utilizar la estrategia D. mercadeo “uno a uno” haciendo que su producto sean a la medida D. sus consumidores. Con su credikiva comprará materia prima e insumos para la fabricación D. 92 pares D. zapatos en la línea  femenina, porque los tiene encargados y desD. ya necesita ponerse en marcha para responder a estos pedidos.
texts.en:
Esperanza Q. is a very hard-working woman who is always looking for the best techniques to improve the shoes she manufactures herself. She makes them in very modern styles and designs that come out of her own inspiration each day. Esperanza is the mother of 6 children, who today range from 21 to 38 years old. She dreams of seeing them always prosperous and successful. She has worked in this field for 30 years; she learned the profession when she worked in large factories, and through this experience, she got to know the market very well, including the customers as well as the manufacturing process for shoes. Her products have entered the market in Bogotá and even in Cali.

Her great challenge is innovating with her designs, and for this reason she spends time each day as an observer in the different places where her products are exhibited. The competition is selling imported shoes, which may not have the best quality but are offered at a good price. However, Esperanza concerns herself with following a "one to one" marketing strategy, so that her product is tailored to her customers. With her loan from Kiva, she will buy materials and supplies to make 92 pairs of women's shoes, because she has orders for them, and she needs to start working to fill these orders.

loans.use: Buying materials and supplies to manufacture 92 pairs of women's shoes, because she has orders for them

loans.name: Ayidédji Justine

texts.fr: C. Ayidédji Justine est née en 1955 à Akpro-Missérété, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Mère de cinq enfants, dont seulement un reste à sa charge, Justine est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses enfants à PK12 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Justine supporte seule les charges de la famille. Justine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Justine vend de l’igname, des bananes frites, etc. au parc MIVVO dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Justine mène cette activité depuis vingt neuf ans. Justine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché intenational du Bénin.
