Pour élargir son champ d’activité et répondre aux multiples demandes de sa clientèle, Justine sollicite pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Ayidédji Justine C. was born in 1955 in Akpro-Missérété, in the department of Ouémé.  The mother of five children, one of whom is still in her care, Justine is a widow who lives alone with her children in PK 12 in the Sèmè-Podji district.  Justine alone supports all the needs of her family.  Justine has never attended school.  To meet her needs, Justine sells yams, fried bananas, etc. at the MIVVO park in the Sèmè-Podji district.  Justine has run this business for 29 years.  She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  To widen the scope of her business and to meet the many needs of her customers, Justine is requesting the financial support of ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of yams, bananas and drums of peanut oil

loans.name: S. Elisabeth

texts.fr: H. S. Elisabeth est née le 22 Décembre 1979 à Savè, dans le département des Collines au Bénin. Mariée à KOUKOUI Brice, un frigoriste, Elisabeth est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Elisabeth vit avec sa famille depuis quatre ans environs au quartier Sodjèatinmè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elisabeth vient en aide à son mari dans les charges du ménage grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis sept ans, Elisabeth mène comme activité la vente de sachets en gros, des couches à jeter, des papiers de toilette et divers autres produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est aussi au marché de Dantokpa que Elisabeth s’approvisionne. C’est la première fois que Elisabeth sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un concours financier en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en: S. Elisabeth H. was born on December 22, 1979 in the Collines Department of Benin.  Married to Brice Koukoui, a refrigerator man, Elisabeth is the mother of two children, both in school.  Elisabeth has lived with her family in the Sodjèatinmè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about four years.  Elisabeth is able to help her husband meet the needs of the household thanks to the revenue generated by her business.  Elisabeth did not go to school.  For seven years, Elisabeth has run a business selling bags, disposable linens, toilet paper and various other products at wholesale in Danktopa, the international market of Benin.  Elisabeth also gets her supplies in Danktopa.  This is the first time that Elisabeth has requested financial aid from ALIDé, in the hopes of increasing her business level and growing her customer base and her sales.

loans.use: Purchase of trash bags, disposable linens and various other products.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Don Raúl de 56 años de edad, es un agropecuario (agricultura y ganadería) y posee una tienda en su casa donde ofrece productos necesarios para el hogar, está casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos uno de 26 y el otro de 24 años de edad residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel; La iniciativa del negocio fue de su esposa ya que ella siempre le ha ayudado a don Raúl para que juntos puedan hacer posible su trabajo, no tienen un horario de atención en su negocio, pero don Raúl quien también es agricultor quiere realizar la siembra de Maíz pero no cuenta con el dinero para comprar los materiales necesarios al igual que desea invertir en su tienda.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para cultivar maíz y otra parte para impulsar su negocio con mercadería, esta ayuda le será útil a don Raúl pues podrá realizar la siembra de maíz y aumentara los inventarios de su negocio.
Las proyecciones de él son ofrecer variedad de productos a los clientes, obtener buena cosecha de maíz para la alimentación de su familia y recibir mayores ingresos para solventar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Don Raúl is 56 years old and engages in farming and ranching. He also has a store in his home where he sells necessary household products. Raul is married and lives with his wife and two children (ages 26 and 24) in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. His wife took the initiative to start their business and always helps him as much as possible with the work. They do not adhere to a set schedule when managing their business, but Don Raúl in his job as a farmer wants to focus on growing corn. However, he does not have the money to buy the necessary supplies or to invest in his store.

Raúl is requesting a loan to buy compost and fertilizers for growing corn. Part of the loan will be used to stock his store with merchandise. The funds will help him accomplish both goals of harvesting corn and increasing the inventory at his business.

Raúl hopes to offer a variety of products to his customers, obtain a good harvest of corn to feed his family, and generate more income so that he can cover his expenses.

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers; acquire merchandise for his store

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Adélaïde

texts.fr: K. Adélaïde vit depuis une vingtaine d’année au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Adélaïde est mariée à HOUNMENOU Franck et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Adélaïde vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Adélaïde vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Pour y arriver, Adélaïde vend du maïs, de l’huile d’arachide et divers autres produits (conserves de tomate, pâtes alimentaires, lait, sardine, savons, papier de toilette, etc.) à son domicile. Adélaïde s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Adélaïde exerce cette activité depuis six ans et a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Adélaïde sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en: Adélaïde K. has lived for some twenty years in the Avotrou neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Adélaïde is married to Franck Hounmenou and is the mother of four children, all in school.  Adélaïde lives together with her children and husband.  Adélaïde helps her husband to ensure that the various needs of the family are met with the revenues from her business.  In order to do so, Adélaïde sells corn, peanut oil, and various other products (canned tomatoes, pasta, milk, sardines, soap, toilet paper, etc.) from her home.  Adélaïde gets her supplies in Danktopa, the international market of Benin.  Adélaïde has run this business for six years and has already received two loans which she paid back in full.  With the goal of strengthening her business and better responding to the needs of her growing number of customers, Adélaïde is requesting another loan.

loans.use: Purchais of corn and various products (canned goods, pasta, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis, de 21 años, es un joven muy bueno y ambicioso, él vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanos menores en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Metrado. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, trabaja en el trasporte público; como Metrado es muy lejos y no hay acceso de vehículos, por ello tiene mucha demanda el servio que presta y ante eso le genera buenos ingresos. Pero la actividad donde más se divierte es la agricultura, Denis tiene su propio terreno de cultivo donde siembra café y plátanos el cual los vende en la ciudad de Pichanaki en temporadas donde hay mayor demanda; gusta mucho de cortar las ramas y cosechar los plátanos. Por otro lado desea sembrar café pero para ello deberá juntar capital para comprar más terrenos de cultivos. Es el  tercer crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo brindado por su banco comunal, donde existe unión y coordinación entre sus miembros. Con el crédito que solicitas, comprará abono y remedios para sus cafetales de esa manera evitará que la plaga de insecto perjudiquen sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Denis, age 21, is a well-mannered and ambitious young man who lives with his parents and two younger siblings in his own house in the town of Metrado. Every morning he begins work in the early morning hours at his job in public transportation. Since Metrado is located far way, there is not access to vehicles. As a result there is great demand for the service Denis provides, which helps him generate a good income. In addition to this job, Denis also spends a great deal of time farming. He has his own land on which he grows coffee and bananas to sell in the city of Pichanaki during times of peak demand. Denis enjoys pruning branches and harvesting the bananas. On the other hand, he wants to grow coffee so that he can raise enough capital to buy more farmland.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is grateful for the support of his Communal Bank. Unity and coordination are exhibited among its members. With the loan he requested, Denis will buy compost and remedies for his coffee plants in order to avoid plagues of insects that can negatively impact their growth.

loans.use: Purchase compost & remedies for his coffee plants

loans.name: Yèmi Florence

texts.fr: B. Yèmi Florence est née le 24 Décembre 1971 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Mariée à TANDJI Dénis, Florence est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Florence vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins du ménage. Florence n’a pas été à l’école. Pour répondre à ses besoins, Florence mène comme activité, la vente de mèches et de différents produits cosmétiques et de beauté à Agblangandan. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Florence achète ses produits. Florence exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et a déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Florence désire agrandir son activité et mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Florence sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Yèmi Florence B. was born December 24, 1971 in Adjohoun, in the department of Ouémé. She is married to Dénis TANDJI and a mother to six children, all in school, three of which are in her care. 

Florence lives with her husband and children in Agblangandan, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Together, the couple provide for the family’s needs. 

Florence never attended school. To make a living, she sells hair extensions, cosmetics and beauty products in Agblangandan. She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Nigeria, a country next to Benin. 

Florence has been in this business for ten years or so, and has already obtained three loans, which were all properly repaid. She is seeking a fourth loan to expand her activities and better meet the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and various cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for his coffee plants & invest in his wife's pig business

loans.name: Herminda

texts.es: Herminda Padilla tiene 64 años y hace ya mas de 20, inició su negocio de mercancía en un centro comercial muy popular de Barranquilla; allí ganó toda la experiencia que tiene hoy en la venta de mercancías variada y desde su residencia, donde comercializa de todo un poco, a través de  catálogos cuyos productos promociona y vende, también compra directamente. Herminda usualmente vende  ropa en general, cosméticos, productos del hogar  y hasta medicinas naturales, así mismo diariamente vende refrescos como pony Malta,, gaseosas, jugos desde un enfriador que también   ubicado en su propia casa. Su sueño es ver crecer sus negocios, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  mercancía como ropa, juguetes, cosméticos y refrescos, aprovechando que en este fin de año se tornan algo escasos y aumentan su precio. De esta manera inicia su meta de ampliación de la actividad, que   le ayuda a sostenerse y la mantiene activa permanentemente, porque más adelante se propone ubicar un almacén, en un local de su propiedad  pero aun no cuenta con el capital de trabajo para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Herminda is 64 years old and some 20 years ago, she began her merchandising business in a very popular commercial center of Barranquilla.  Here she gained all the experience she has today in selling varied merchandise from her residence.  Herminda sells a little bit of everything by means of catalogs displaying products she promotes and sells.  She also does direct buying.

Herminda usually sells clothing in general, cosmetics, household products, and even natural medicines.  And every day she sells drinks, including Pony Malt, carbonated drinks, and juice from a refrigerator, also located in her own house.

Her dream is to expand her business.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan through the Fundacion (Foundation) Mario Santo Domingo.  Herminda will buy merchandise such as clothing, toys, cosmetics, and soft drinks, avoiding the end of the year when products become scarce and prices increase.

In this way, Herminda will initiate activity that can help her to sustain herself and remain permanently active.  In the future, she proposes to establish a general store in a location she owns, but she lacks the capital to achieve this at present.

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE SUCH AS CLOTHING, TOYS, COSMETICS, AND SOFT DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for her coffee crop & gasoline to sell

loans.name: Eberth Americo

texts.es: El señor Ebert Américo M. R. se dedica a la actividad de chofer de mototaxi , vive con su esposa y sus menores hijos en su domicilio ubicado en Santa Rosa de Lima Ica , su esposa se dedica ala venta de juguetes y adornos para niños tiene un puesto en el mercado Toledo de esta manera ayuda a solventar los gastos familiares conjuntamente con su esposo . El solicitante requiere el crédito para mantenimiento de su mototaxi y mejorar su calidad de vida, presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales por tal mótivo se propone otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en: Ebert Américo M. R. is a moto taxi driver. He lives with his wife and their young children at their home Santa Rosa de Lima Ica. His wife sells toys and decorations for children and has a stall in the Toledo market, which enables her to cover household expenses alongside her husband. The applicant would like a loan for the maintenance of his moto taxi and to improve his quality of life. He has good personal and professional references; for this reason, he is recommended as a loan recipient.

loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor Manuel elabora sandalias y calzado en general, pero debe esperar recoger el poco capital de la venta de su producto para reinvertir y no le es posible comprar en un mayor volumen y así reducir los costos de su producción y competir con mejores precios en un mercado muy competido. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita su credikiva a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que   llamó su atención   a través de un perifoneo donde conoció sus servicios y donde el y sus vecinos se acercaron al vehiculo que transportaba a sus asesores y allí se inscribió. Víctor tiene una experiencia de tres años en este negocio y su taller está ubicado en un segundo piso de su vivienda, aprendió a fabricar calzado en el Servicio Nacional de aprendizaje SENA y posteriormente ha ido agregándole su capacidad innovadora y su persistencia en el trabajo continuo, porque tiene un horario de 8:00 AM  a 6:00 PM. de lunes a sábados. Su mercado está conformados por vendedores que tienen sus negocios en el centro y se ubican en sitios estratégicos, así como también son sus clientes las amas de casa de la comunidad donde vive, pues ya es muy reconocido por su talento.
Con su credikiva comprará materias prima como cuero y sus derivados, así como insumos, como pegantes taches y otros adornos, que resaltan la belleza del  pie femenino y hacen de sus diseños los mas lindos del mercado de Barranquilla.
.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel makes sandals and other footwear, but he must wait to collect the little money he makes from selling his products in order to reinvest. This means he can´t buy in large quantities, which would decrease his production costs and enable him to compete with better prices in a highly competitive market. That´s the reason why he is requesting a loan to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.The organisation got his attention when he heard about its services from a loudspeaker installed in a vehicle; he and his neighbours approached it to talk to its advisors and signed up on the spot.

Victor has three years experience in the business. His workshop is on the second floor of his house. He learnt to make footwear at the SENA (National Learning Services). He has since brought his innovative abilities and hard and constant work to the business - he works from 8am to 6pm from Monday to Saturday.

His target market is mostly sellers with shops strategically located in the centre of town, as well as housewives in his community, where his talent is well known. With the loan he plans to buy raw materials such as leather and leather by-produts, as well as other items such as sticky studs and other adornments that highlight the beauty of feminine feet and make his designs the prettiest in the Barranquilla market.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as leather and leather by-products, as well as inputs such as sticky studs and other adornments that highlight the beauty of feminine feet.

loans.name: Bicentenario Dos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Bicentenario 2, por las festividades de este año y porque sus integrantes son muy patriotas. Está ubicado en Lázaro Cárdenas en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.

Magdalena F. García es integrante del grupo, tiene 64 años, no cuenta con estudios, es comerciante de artesanías de madera  y tiene  un hijo varón.  Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías de madera que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en más mercancía ya que las artesanías que venden son muy solicitadas por su comunidad. Sus clientes son vecinas y recomendadas de sus clientas.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta e ilusionada. Quiere este crédito para hacer crecer su negocio y sus ventas.   También espera que estas ganancias le permitan seguir solventándose y apoyar a su familia, ya que es una persona mayor y solo cuenta con su negocio para salir adelante y cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
The loan group is called Bicentennial 2, named because of this year's festivities (200th anniversary of Mexican independence) and because its members are very patriotic. It is located in Lazaro Cardenas in the State of Mexico. The group has 11 members.

Magdalena F. G. is a member of the group. She is 64 years old and didn't go to school. She has been selling wooden handicrafts for 3 years and has a son. She requests a loan to invest in more merchandise, because the handicrafts she sells are very sought after in her community. Her clients are her neighbours and the people her clients recommend her to. She is happy and excited about the loan, which she wants to develop her business and her sales. She also hopes that the profits will allow her to stay solvent and support her family, since she is quite old and only has her business to support herself and meet their needs.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Harleth Patricia

texts.es:
Se acerca la temporada de fin de año y Harleth S., una joven madre de un niño de 4 años, se prepara adornando su miscelánea y ofreciendo artículos empacados en papel de regalo, para hacer mas perceptible a su clientela la expresión del   espíritu navideño y de fin de año,  fechas en las cuales las familias manifiestan su unidad e intercambian regalos  que alegran esta bella época.  En  el barrio el Campito de la ciudad de Barranquilla y en toda Colombia, este es un momento de mucho repunte comercial, y en este sentido las más favorecidas   son las microempresas, que por estar ubicadas en   sectores cercanos al lugar donde habitan las familias, logran una rotación constante de su mercancía.
La idea de Harleth  de emprender esta miscelánea, fue impulsada por su madre, una confeccionista muy querida en el barrio el Campito, teniendo en cuenta que al no poder continuar sus estudios debía buscar la forma de generar ingresos para apoyar el crecimiento de su pequeño hijo, y eso es lo que  ocurre en la actualidad. 

Harleth está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque necesita una inyección de capital de trabajo para su negocio especialmente en esta época en que se incrementarán sus ventas, siempre y cuando tenga todo lo que sus clientes necesiten. Ella con su credikiva comprará   mercancía variada especialmente juguetería y otros artículos de temporada,  como regalos, ropa  y cosméticos  que engalanarán su negocio y a las familias que forman parte de su exclusiva clientela.
texts.en: The end of the year is approaching and Harleth S., a young mother of a four-year old son, prepares by decorating her small shop and offering gift wrapped items to show off to her clients her Holiday spirit.  This is a time when families show their unity and exchange gifts to brighten up this beautiful period.  In the Campito neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla and all over Colombia, this is a crucial commercial moment, being the most favorable for the smaller businesses since they are located in residential areas close to families.  As a result, they successfully have a constant turnover of merchandise.  Harleth's idea of starting this shop was encouraged by her mother, a beloved tailor in the Campito neighborhood.  Realizing that she wouldn't be able to continue her studies further, she had to find a way to earn money to support and raise her young son, which is what she is currently doing.  Harleth is applying for her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo because she needs an investment of work capital in her business, especially during this time when her sales will increase, if and only she has everything that her clients need.  With this credit, she will purchase a variety of merchandise, specifically toys and other seasonal items, such as gifts, clothes, and cosmetics that would embellish her business and the families that form part of her exclusive clientele.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise, specifically toys and other seasonal items.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with two daughters – 15-year-old Anya and 3-year-old Katya. He is a businessman from Berdyansk. Alexander sells hats, caps and belts at different locations in his home town. He offers his merchandise at affordable prices. Alexander has been in the trade for 15 years. Presently, he has 70,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas a month.

Alexander is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise and turnover capital as a result. He is hoping to re-invest his profit in further development of his business. Alexander is planning to open a new vending location in the near future.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Las Gualupitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Gualupitas. El nombre se debe a que en esta comunidad son muy devotos a la virgen de Guadalupe y Gualupitas es una palabra derivada de ello. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y está ubicado en Tehuacán, Puebla en México. 

Julia C. D. es integrante del grupo Las Gualupitas, ella tiene 48 años de edad; no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos dos varones y dos mujeres. Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, negocio que inicio hace ocho años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercancía, con la finalidad de hacer crecer su negocio invirtiendo también en la venta de comida, ya que está a la orilla de la carretera y es lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Sus clientes consideran que es una persona muy trabajadora, higiénica y de impecable reputación. La  Sra. Julia se siente agradecida por este préstamo ya que podrá realizar los planes que se había propuesto y que por un momento los vio difícil de alcanzar, pero con este crédito dice la señora solo están a la vuelta de la esquina. Ella espera seguir haciendo crecer su negocio y hacer remodelación de él.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Gualupitas.  The name originates from the fact that in this community they are very devoted to the Virgin of Guadalupe and Gualupitas is a word derived from it.  The group is composed of 11 members and is located in Tehuacan, Puebla in Mexico.

Julia C.D. is a member of this group.  She is 48 years old and didn't have the opportunity to study.  She is married and has a total of 4 children, two boys and two girls.  Julia sells groceries, a business that she started over eight years ago.  She is applying for a loan to purchase merchandise, with the final outcome of expanding her business and also investing in the sale of food, since she is located on the side of the road and has had customers request this service.  Her customers consider her to be a very hard-working woman, hygienic, and with an impeccable reputation.  Senora Julia is grateful for this loan since she will be able to fulfill her plans that had seemed so far and difficult to reach but now seem to be just around the corner.  She hopes to continue to grow her business and remodel it.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with grown children. She is a small entrepreneur from the Kherson region. Valentina sells women’s clothing in several small marketplaces in her region. She started her trade fifteen years ago when she was forced to find ways to feed her family in complicated times of post-soviet redevelopment. Currently, her turnover capital is about 49,000 UAH. Net profit amounts to approximately $887 a month. 

Valentina is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH to diversify the assortment of merchandise she offers for sale in the marketplaces. Valentina believes that offering a variety of clothing items will help her retain existing clients, find new ones and provide superior service in a competitive marketplace. Maintaining a good balance between price, quality and availability of products will promote further stable expansion of her trade and ensure better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to diversify assorted merchandise

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 30 años, es taxista y tiene un pequeño taller mecánico, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos.

El es taxista recorre todas las calles de Guayaquil con una tarifa muy baja. Para obtener mas dinero el trabaja en ocasiones con el papa en el taller mecánico que tiene. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde muy temprano como taxista y los fines de semana en el taller donde arregla la parte eléctrica. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y bloques para readecuar el taller mecánico. En un futuro quiere un local para tener su negocio mas establecido.
texts.en:
Luis is 30 years old, a taxi driver, and owns a small auto shop.  He lives in the urban outskirts of Paraiso de Guayaquil, an area characterized by its mountain roads.  

He is a taxi driver that circulates throughout the streets of Guayaquil with a very low fare.  In order to earn more money, he occasionally works with his father in his auto shop.  He works Monday to Friday from very early in the morning as a taxi driver and on the weekends, in the shop, where he fixes electric parts.  

With this loan, he wants to purchase cement and blocks in order to redo his auto shop.  In the future, he wants his own store front in order to have a more fixed business.

loans.use: Purchase cement and blocks.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married with a grown son and a daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Khoost in Western Ukraine. Ganna sells men’s and women’s footwear in one of the local marketplaces in her home town. She launched this venture seven years ago. Her experience and reasonable pricing policy have considerably impacted the growth of her trade. Presently, her net profit amounts to approximately $435 a month.  

Ganna is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase her assortment of merchandise and her turnover capital as a result. Ganna believes that good quality affordable merchandise will sell well among her middle class customers. Ganna can be characterized as an entrepreneur of integrity and responsibility. She is respected by both her loyal customers and fellow market vendors.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for her coffee crop

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever de 43 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, él tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas que es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta. El negocio lo inicio después de trabajar por varios años en un taller similar que tenía un amigo, él logro su propio taller y lo tiene en su casa de habitación, no tiene horario fijo para hacer su trabajo.
El solicita un préstamo para mejorar el techo que cubre su taller pues el que tiene ya no está en condiciones para soportar el invierno, Este préstamo ayudara a que compre los materiales necesarios como laminas para reconstruir el techo y mejorara la apariencia del taller dando una mejor atención y mayor comodidad a los clientes.
Sus proyecciones son ampliar su taller, atender más clientes y mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia abriendo la oportunidad a sus hijos para que estudien y puedan ser profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ever is 43 years old and resides in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 5 and 3. Ever has a workshop where he creates metal structures. This business is his only source of income. He started this business after he had worked several years at a similar shop owned by a friend. Ever was able to set up his own workshop in his home, but he does not currently work on a set schedule.

The loan he is requesting will be used to improve the roof that cover his workshop since it can no longer withstand the winter conditions. With the proceeds, Ever will be able to buy the necessary materials such as laminate to rebuild the roof and improve the appearance of his workshop. As a result, he will be able to provide better service and greater comfort for his customers.

His plans are to expand his workshop, attract more customers, improve the living conditions for his family, and create opportunities for his children to study so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair the roof of his workshop

loans.name: Danilo Santiago

texts.es: El señor Danilo Santiago tiene 35 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El señor se dedica a brindar los servicios de sastrería, cabe señalar el viaja a Managua a comprar la tela y otros productos necesarios. El señor ya tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, lo inicio cuando no encontraba trabajo y necesitaba ofrecerle a su familia lo necesario. Esta solicitando este préstamo con el objetivo de comprar tela, tijera, alfileres entre otras cosas.  El sueño es tener un taller más grande y empezar a realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: Danilo Santiago is 35 years old, married, and has three minor children under his care.  He works as a tailor, traveling to Managua to purchase fabric and other necessary items.  He has had this business for over five years and started it when he wasn't able to find work but needed to support his family.  He is seeking a loan in order to purchase fabric, scissors, and pins, among other things.  His dream is to have a bigger workshop and to begin to make improvements on his home.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Alegres Catarinas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Alegres catarinas porque son personas muy alegres y sonrientes. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por  9 integrantes.

 Josefina O. López es la presidenta  del grupo, tiene 29  años, estudió hasta el 6to año D. primaria, es comerciante  y tiene en total 4  hijos  (2 mujeres y 2  varones).  Ella se dedica a la venta D. bolsas D. mano  que inició hace año y medio. Solicita el préstamo para invertir las bolsas. Sus clientes son personas D. la misma comunidad que cuentan con un poquito D. mayor posibilidad económica, ya que algunas bolsas están un poco caras, dependiendo del material que sean, ella también las venD. en abonos. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para invertir en más bolsas pues entra una D. sus mejores temporadas.

 Esta foto fue tomada en la casa D. la Sra. Silvina, integrante del grupo Alegres Catarinas. Se ven los catálogos, las bolsas y algunos productos que venden la Sra. Silvina y la Sra. Josefina quienes cuentan con un amplio surtido en la foto.  Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se sienten ilusionadas.
texts.en:
This group is called the "Alegres Catarinas" (The Joyful Ladybugs) because they are a very happy and cheerful bunch.  The are located in the state of Mexico.  The group is maD. up of 9 members.  

Josefina O. López is the president of the group.  She is 29 years old and finished the 6th graD..  She is a merchant and has 4 children (2 girls and 2 boys).  A year and a half ago she started selling handbags for a living.   Her customers are people who live in the same community that have a little more economic freedom as some of the bags are a bit expensive depending on the matierial they are maD. from.  She also sells them on a payment plan.  At the time of this loan request she feels happy.  She is requesting the loan to buy more bags as she is entering one of her busiest seasons.  

The photo was taken in Señora Slivina's house, another member of "Alegres Catarinas".  They are pictured here with catalogs, bags and other products that Señora Silvina and Señora Josefina sell.  At the time of this photo they are well stocked and hopeful.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to stock her business

loans.name: Danny

texts.es: Danny tiene 21 años, es un hombre muy valiente y bueno vive con sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia ubicada en la selva del país (localidad de Cahuide). Todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para salir a cazar al monte cupte y samaño (animales salvajes oriundos del la selva del país) y por las tardes cuida sus cultivos de café que desde niño le enseñaron a cuidar y cultivar. Hace dos años que se compró un terreno propio en el que sembró café, solo falta un año más para que dé frutos, ya que tiene que cuidarlos durante tres años, tiempo suficiente para su maduración. Danny, desea sembrar café de calidad para poder exportar; y con la ayuda de una reconocida cooperativa de su ciudad podrá vender café, ya que su localidad es reconocida por la siembra de café natural. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y está seguro que con el apoyo de su banco comunal podrá salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono para café que tiene sembrando asimismo desea comprar semillas de plátanos.
texts.en:
Danny, age 21, is a brave and well-mannered man who lives with his parents and siblings in his own home in the town of Cahuide, located in the Peruvian jungle. Every morning he wakes up early to go hunting in the mountains of Cupte and Samaño (where wild animals native to the Peruvian jungle live). In the afternoons, he looks after his coffee crops that he learned to grow and care for as a young child. Two years ago, Danny bought his own land for growing coffee. It will be another year before his crops bear fruit because it takes three years for them to mature. Danny wants to grow quality coffee for export, and with the help of a well-known cooperative in the city, he will be able to sell his coffee. The area where he lives is known for growing natural coffee.

This is his second loan with MFP and he is confident that he will succeed with the support of his Communal Bank. With the loan he requested, Danny will invest in compost for his coffee crops. He also wants to buy banana seedlings.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for his coffee crop & acquire banana seedlings

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: Oscar Danilo tiene 28 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, todos menores de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de frutas ya tiene 11 años que dio inicio a este negocio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja a nuestro país, además que él sabe trabajar muy bien en el campo y los trabajos de ese rubro cada día se vuelven más escasos. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de cosechas de aguacate, naranjas y mandarinas. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una pulpería grande en su casa de habitación, y algún día dejarle algo bueno a sus hijos con lo cual puedan mantenerse.
texts.en: Oscar Danilo is 28 years old, married and has 2 children who are underage. Oscar has sold fruits for 11 years; he started his business due to a lack of work that affects his country. He works well in the countryside but jobs in that field are becoming scarce. He wants to use the loan to buy crops of avocadoes, oranges and mandarins. His dream has always been to have a large grocery store in his home and to someday leave his children something that will be able to support them.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Don Enrique D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en El Transito departamento D. San Miguel donD. vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos D. 26 y 22 años D. edad, él es agricultor y su padre le enseño este trabajo desD. pequeño ya que también se dedicó a L. agricultura y ganadería, Don Enrique no tiene horario fijo y su familia le ayuda a desarrollar el proceso D. L. siembra ya que este es el único ingreso que reciben.
Él solicita un préstamo para L. siembra D. Maíz ya que no cuenta con los fondos para L. compra D. los materiales para dar un buen tratamiento al cultivo, su inversión será en abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento D. plagas, lo que don Enrique busca es mejorar su cosecha dándole un mejor cuido, pero los riesgos siempre existen en este negocio ya que si aumentan las lluvias pueda que se le dañen sus cultivos.
El objetivo D. don Enrique es mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia y poder proveer para ellos L. alimentación y los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos mensuales.
texts.en:
Don Enrique is 47 years old and resides in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel with his wife and two children, ages 26 and 22. He is a farmer and learned the traD. from his father who taught him when he was a young boy. In addition, Enrique raises cattle. He does not work on a set schedule and his family helps with the planting since this is the only source of income they receive.

Don Enrique is requesting a loan for growing corn since he does not have the funds needed to buy supplies to maintain his crops. He plans to invest in compost, fertilizers, and treatments to prevent disease. Enrique wants to improve his crops by providing them with the best care, but there are always hazards in this business, such as an increase in rain that can damage his crops.

Don Enrique’s goal is to improve the living conditions for his family and proviD. them with food and the necessary income to cover the monthly expenses.

loans.use: Purchase compost, fertilizers, and treatments for his crop of corn

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es:
Doña Ana tiene 55 años D. edad, vive junto con su esposo y su madre, ya los hijos D. doña Ana formaron sus propios hogares, Ella se dedica  a la venta D. comida y pupusas y resiD. en el Departamento D. Usulután, posee este negocio desD. hace 15 años y los ingresos recibidos D. esta venta son los que desD. hace años solventan sus gastos, lo atienD. D. Domingo a Viernes y en ocasiones una D. sus hijas le ayuda.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería y así impulsar un poco más el negocio, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la atención y servicio a los clientes ya que contara con los productos necesarios para la preparación D. alimentos como Arroz, pollo, Azúcar, Verduras, Carne entre otros que le son necesarios para abastecer la demanda.
Su objetivo principal es cancelar las cuotas D. este préstamo, aumentar el número D. clientes y complacer sus necesidades; Mejorar las condiciones e ingresos D. la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 55 years old and lives with her husband and mother in the Department of Usulután. Her children have already established their own households. Ana sells food and pupusas from a business that she has managed for 15 years. The income she receives from her sales is used to cover her expenses. Ana manages her business Sunday through Friday and on occasion she receives help from one of her daughters.

The loan she is requesting will be used to invest in supplies so that she can acquire some more business. With the proceeds, Ana will be able to proviD. better service to her customers since she will have the necessary products for preparing her dishes such as rice, chicken, sugar, vegetables, meat, and other items. This will allow her to keep up with demand.

Her main goal is to complete each of her loan payments, increase her customer base and be able to meet their needs, improve her living conditions, and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: El señor Rafael Antonio B. A., tiene la edad de 37 años vive en un Barrio de la Capital, con su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad que dependen económicamente de sus padres, pero que ayudan a las tareas del hogar y el trabajo del campo, ya que la familia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 20 años, y durante este tiempo han luchado contra la sequia y las enfermedades en sus plantillos, fue gracias al apoyo de su padres quien le enseño esta actividad para ganarse el sustento de ella y su familia, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como insumos, fertilizantes y fungicidas que favorezcan a un mantenimiento mas optimo a la producción de su cosechas, incrementar sus ventas y a futuro optar con los recursos económicos para solventar el gasto de sus carreras profesionales y la de sus hijos y/o remodelar su viviendo puesto que con las lluvias del invierno se ha deteriorado y amenaza con la seguridad y salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio B. A. is 37 years old and lives in a neighborhood of the capital with his wife and two underage children who depend economically on their parents but help with housework and farm work. The family has dedicated itself to farming for over 20 years. During this time they have fought against drought and disease in their crops. It is thanks to the support of Rafael Antonio's parents who taught him how to farm that he can earn a living for his family.

He is requesting a loan for his business to purchase materials such as agricultural supplies, fertilizers, and fungicides that favor a more optimal maintenance and production of his crops, increase sales, and in the future to use these economic resources to settle the expense of his professional careers and those of his children and/or repair his home because the winter rains have damaged it, threatening the health and security of his family.

loans.use: Compra de materiles vegetativo para sus cosechas

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Don Pedro de 46 años, es un agricultor y vive junto a su esposa y su madre en el Departamento de Usulután. Él está dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 10 años y con su cosecha ayuda a solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar.
Él acostumbra a sembrar una manzana de tierra dividiendo la mitad de la cosecha en Maíz Y Frijol, trabaja en compañía de un primo; Don Pedro solicita un préstamo para realizar la siembra de este año ya que no cuenta con los materiales necesarios para realizar el trabajo, Esto ayudara a que él pueda seguir con sus cultivos y ayude a su familia para que no les falte alimentación, pero a la vez se arriesga ya que estos últimos meses existen muchas lluvias lo que podría ocasionar daños al cultivo.
La proyección de don Pedro es cancelar puntualmente este préstamo y seguir recibiendo esta ayuda, dar a su familia la alimentación necesaria y mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 46 year old farmer.  He lives with his wife and mother in the Usulután department.

He has been a farmer for ten years.  His harvest helps pay for some household necessities.  

He is accustomed to planting a block of land, which is divided in half for growing corn and beans.  He works with a cousin.

Pedro is requesting a loan for planting this year.  He does not have the materials he needs to do this work.  This will help him be able to continue with his crops, and it will help his family have enough food.  Nonetheless, it is a risk because there has been a lot of rain in the past months.  This could damage his crops.

Pedro plans to punctually pay off this loan, to keep receiving this help, to give his family the food they need, and to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Buy materials to plant corn and beans

loans.name: Maria Gricelda

texts.es:
María tiene 33 años y se dedica a la venta D. productos lácteos y destazo D. ganado, resiD. en San Antonio departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos,  tres D. ellos son niñas, D. las edades 17, 15, 8 y 3 años D. edad; Ellos son personas humildes y su único ingreso lo reciben a través D. la venta D. lácteos y carne D. res.
Su negocio aun es pequeño, ella con la ayuda D. su esposo destazan reces y venden su carne en la casa o en algunos casos salen a vender a los pueblos cercanos, el destazo lo realizan 2 veces por semana.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo pues quieren ampliar su negocio y comprar cerdos para el destazo y vender su carne;  también quieren comprar quesos, mantequilla y otros derivados D. la leche, todo esto para ofrecer a sus clientes y contar siempre con su preferencia.
Este préstamo será una gran ayuda para esta familia ya que diversificaran sus productos a la venta y aumentaran sus ingresos pues cubrirán con más demanda D. producto.
La Proyección D. María es comercializar por mayor, aumentar sus ventas y sus clientes, ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor vida con acceso a la educación para que estos se preparen y opten por una vida diferente con nuevas oportunidades D. desarrollo.
texts.en:
María is thirty three years old and works selling dairy products and meat. She lives in San Antonio, which is in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and their 4 children, 3 of whom are girls. They are 17, 15, 8, and 3 years old. They are humble people, and they get their only income from the sale of dairy products and beef.
Her business is small. With the help of her husband, she butchers cattle and sells the meat from her home or in nearby towns. They butcher twice a week. 
She is requesting a loan to grow her business and buy pigs to butcher so she can sell the meat. She also wants to buy cheese, butter, and other dairy products to sell to her clients and comply with their wishes. 
This loan will be a big help to this family as it will let them diversify the products that they sell and increase their income and meet the demands for these products. 
For the future, María wants to sell wholesale, increase her sales and clients, and offer her children a better life with access to education so that they will be prepared and choose a different life with new opportunities for development.

loans.use: To buy cheese, butter, and pigs to sell

loans.name: María Herculana

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años, se dedica a la elaboración D. Lazos vive en el Cantón Pedernal del Municipio D. Chilanga en Morazán junto a su esposo y un hijo, ella realiza este trabajo desD. hace 10 años y su familia le ayuda, el horario es D. lunes a viernes y los sábados entrega a sus clientes los pedidos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. Pita que es la materia prima para elaborar lazos, este préstamo le ayudara a solventar su situación actual ya que tiene mucha demanda pero no cuenta con el material necesario para satisfacerla, logrando no perder esos clientes y sirviéndoles siempre con buen producto.
El sueño D. María es crecer como comerciante D. lazos, aumentar sus clientes y su producción para dar a su familia una mejor vida y una mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and works making rope.  She lives in the Pedernal district in the town of Chilanga in Morazán with her husband and one child.  She has done this work for ten years and her family helps her.  They work from Monday to Friday and on Saturdays they deliver orders to their customers.  

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase pita, which is the raw material used to make rope.  This loan will help her solve her current problem: she has a lot of demand for rope, but doesn't have enough material to satisfy it.  With the loan, she will be able to not lose those customers and always proviD. them with a quality product.

María's dream is to grow as a rope merchant, increase her number of customers and her production so she can give her family a better life and more stability.

loans.use: Purchase of pita fiber to make rope

loans.name: Olin

texts.es: Olin, de 21 años, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, está casado con Yeny, de 19 años, producto de su gran amor nació Oliver de 3 meses de nacido; los tres viven en su casa alquilada ubicada en la selva peruana (Comunidad Nativa Centro Punpuriani).Todas las mañanas, desde las primeras horas del día se dirige a su terreno de cultivo, donde cuida su cultivo de plátanos y yuca; que hace dos años viene plantando con mucho esmero y cuidado. Muy pronto empezará la cosecha para luego ser vendidos a los comerciantes que vienen constantemente a la comunidad. lo que más le gusta de sembrar es poder ver como su esfuerzo tiene buenos resultados y pesar de tener poco tiempo en la agricultura a Olin le va muy bien, ya tiene 3 cuadras de terreno listos para ser sembrados, ahí sembrara café y muy pronto construirá una casa para su esposa e hijo. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está contento de integrarse a su banco comunal ya que le dio la oportunidad de poder crecer e invertir. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para las 3 cuadras de cultivo que esta sembrando.
texts.en: 21 year old Olin is a good and hardworking man. He is married to 19 year old Yeny, and the result of their great love, Oliver, was born 3 months ago. The three live in a rented house in the Peruvian jungle (Comunidad Nativa Centro Punpuriani). every morning, in the first hours of the day, he goes to work his land, where he grows bananas and yucca. He planted his land two years ago with great care and effort. They will soon start harvesting and then sell the produce to buyers who come to the community all the time. What he likes most about farming is to see that his efforts have good results, and even though he has been in farming for only a short time, Olin is doing very well. He already has 3 more blocks of land ready to be planted, where he will sow coffee and very soon he will build a house for his wife and son. This is his first loan from MFP and he is happy to be part of the community bank as it gives him the opportunity to grow and invest. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the three blocks of land that he is planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.name: Jose Jeovany

texts.es:
Jeovany, es empleado tiene 27 años de edad, reside en el Departamento de Usulután junto a su esposa, ellos aun no tienen hijos; Él trabaja en una empresa comercial desde hace 2 años con un horario de lunes a sábado de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde. Su vivienda no cuenta con las mejores condiciones por esa razón quiere repararla y mejorar así su vistosidad pero él no cuenta con los fondos necesario para realizar la modificación de la casa por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para solventar su condición actual, Esta ayuda le será muy útil pues al reparar su vivienda estará en un lugar más adecuado, amplio y seguro para vivir con su esposa.
Él posee buen record crediticio por lo que dice que su mayor proyección es realizar una buena inversión, pagar este préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jeovany is 27 years old and lives in the department of Usulután with his wife.  They don't yet have children.  He has worked at a trade company for two years from Monday to Saturday from 7:00am to 5:00pm.  

His home is not in the best condition, so he would like to repair it and improve its appearance.  He does not have enough money to make the repairs, so he is asking for a loan.  This help will be very useful to him because after the repairs, his house will be in a better location, bigger, and safer to live in with his wife.  

Jeovany has a good credit history, so his main goal is to make a good investment, pay back this loan, and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for home improvement

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
Sandra de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 6 años de edad, residen en Santiago de María en el Departamento de Usulután donde vive junto a una hermana, Sandra se dedica a la venta de tablilla(chocolate preparado con azúcar), pan francés y pan dulce, este es el único ingreso que solventa las necesidades del hogar, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años con un horario de lunes a domingo de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde y fue por iniciativa propia, el procedimiento para la preparación de tabilla es tostar cacao llevarlo al molino con suficiente azúcar y canela quedando listo para preparar el chocolate.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo pues desea comprar cacao en sacos y azúcar por quintales para obtenerlos a mejor precio, este préstamo ayudara a su economía pues al comprar por mayor permite que reciba más ganancia de la venta.
Las proyecciones de Sandra es pagar este préstamo, generar más ingresos de sus ventas y velar por el bienestar de su Hija para que esta pueda tener una mejor vida con mayores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Sandra is 28 years old and a single mother of a six year old girl.  They live in Santiago de María in the department of Usulután with her sister.  

Sandra works selling tabilla (hot chocolate prepared with sugar), French bread, and pastries.  This is the only income that pays for household necessities.  She has had this business for seven years and works from Monday to Sunday from 6:00am to 5:00pm on her own initiative.  

Tabilla is made by toasting cocoa beans and grinding them with sugar and cinnamon so they are ready to prepare the hot chocolate.

She is asking for this loan because she would like to buy cocoa beans and sugar in large sacks in order to get a better price.  This loan would help her budget because buying wholesale allows you to make more income on your sales.  

Sandra's future plans are to pay back this loan, generate more income from her sales, and pray for the well being of her daughter so that she can have a better life with more opportunities.

loans.use: Purchase of cocoa and sugar

loans.name: Luis Hernan

texts.es:
El Señor Luis Hernán C. F. de 29 años de edad, cuenta con un local de ventas de artículos eléctricos, cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñado, el joven Lorenzo F., que mediante su esfuerzo lograron montar dicho negocio. 
Empezó hace mas de 5 años El señor  Luis es casado,  tiene 2 hijos.

Solicito el  préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de mas mercaderías, el mismo al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Hernán C. F. is 29 years old and has a stall where he sells electric appliances and has the help of his brother-in-law, Lorenzo F.; through their hard work they were able to start this business.

He began the business 5 years ago. Mr. Luis is married and has 2 children.

Mr. Luis asked for the loan from Fundación Paraguaya (Kiva’s field partner) to which he is very thankful, he will use the loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy electric appliances like cables, light bulbs among other items.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Gloria tiene 44 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel donde vive con su esposo tuvieron un hijo pero este lastimosamente falleció, por lo que viven solos los dos, ella tiene un comedor que atiende desde la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y su ventaja con el negocio es que en la zona no tiene competencia pues es el único en el lugar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de alimentos para preparar platillos como pollo, carnes, verduras, jugos y otros que puede ofrecer a los clientes, dicho préstamo le ayudara a brindar diferentes menú y así satisfacer los gustos a quienes le consumen sus alimentos.
Su proyección es lograr un aumento en sus ventas, atraer nuevos clientes, darle mayor estabilidad al negocio y recibir ingresos que solventen las necesidades de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel with her husband.  They had a son, but unfortunately he died, so they live alone.  

She has a restaurant that she works at from the morning until 7:00pm.  The advantage is that it is the only business in the neighborhood, so she has no competition.

Gloria is asking for this loan to purchase food to prepare dishes like chicken, meats, vegetables, juices, and others that they can offer to their customers.  This loan would help them create different menus and satisfy the tastes of everyone who eats their food.  

She plans to increase their sales, attract new customers, give the business more stability, and receive an income that will meet the needs of herself and her husband.

loans.use: Purchase of meats and vegetables to prepare food

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Juan Antonio tiene 41 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. El señor se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de carga, este negocio lo inicio cuando tenía 18 años, fue por medio de su Papa ya que le enseño a ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde,  por lo que actualmente el tiene su propio negocio. Esta solicitando este préstamo con el objetivo de comprar repuestos para su camión, y comprar lo que le hace falta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Juan Antonio is 41 years old, married and has two children who are underage. He is a truck driver and began when he was 18 years old thanks to his father since he taught him to earn a living in an unassuming way which is why he has his own business. Mr. Juan is asking for the loan to buy spare parts for his truck and to buy what it needs. His dream is to expand his business to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Sany Yanett

texts.es:
Sany de 34 años, vende productos naturales y vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Comenzó hace tres años atrás a vender algunos productos naturales que le medicaron y como le dio muy buenos resultados el decidió comprar estos productos a base de noni, calcio y frutos y los vende a sus amigos y conocidos. Ahora ella visita varias empresas vendiendo los productos naturales. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas productos a base de noni, calcio y frutas. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Sany is 34 years old, sells natural products, and lives in a suburban area called Duran, which is characterized by its endangered environment. 

Three years ago, she began selling medicines made from natural products. Since they gave very good results, she decided to buy products made from noni [a plant], calcium, and fruits and sell them to her friends and acquaintances.  She currently visits different stores selling her natural products.

With this loan, she would like to buy more products made from noni, calcium, and fruits.  In the future, she would like to have her own store to sell her products.

loans.use: Purchase products made from noni, calcium, and fruits

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María P. es una mujer de 66 años, muy querida por sus vecinos, tiene el negocio de vender carnes frías y también desarrolla otra actividad comercial que es la de vender   ropa por encargo y refrescos como gaseosas pony malta, Boli  etc;  Luz María es casada y tiene un hijo de 44 años de edad y vive en carrizal, barrio de un gran tamaño  donde tiene su mayor numero de sus clientes. Ella nació en el departamento de Chocó hace 40 años  y llegó  a Barranquilla con su hijo a la casa de un hermano, desde ese mismo momento ideo la forma de obtener un ingreso adicional para apoyar su hogar; primero empezó con ropa y haciendo pasteles los fines de semana luego agregó refrescos y hoy vende carnes frías como salchichas, salchichones mortadela, chorizos que compra en una empresa importante y la distribuye entre su clientela a un crédito que cobra semanalmente.
Últimamente su negocio   ha crecido, sus pedidos han aumentado y necesita tener donde refrigerar los productos especialmente los refrescos, por eso necesita comprar un enfriador apropiado,  de igual manera está preparándose para las fiestas de fin de año y la ropa femenina e infantil  es muy solicitada por sus clientes, por eso ha acudido a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para hacer el sexto crédito y para ese propósito está aplicando a su credikiva  por valor de $1.500.000 COP.
  
Su sueño es mejorar su nivel de vida y las posibilidades de obtener cada día mas ingresos familiares con su negocio, su vida siempre ha estado rodeada de negocios es una persona de muchas ideas y siempre debe ponerlas en marcha, y mas aun si se trata de ideas emprendedoras que le generen ingresos.
texts.en:
Luz María P. is 66 years old and very loved by her neighbors. She has a business selling cold cuts and she also has another business selling clothing and soft drinks, like pony malta, Boli, etc. Luz María is married and she has a 44 year old son. She lives in Carrizal, a large neighborhood where she has the majority of her clients. She was born in the department of Chocó and she came to Barranquilla with her son to live at the house of a brother. From this moment, she decided to obtain an additional income in order to support the household. First, she started with clothing and making sweets during the weekends. Then she added the soft drinks. Now she sells cold cuts like sausages, salami, bologna, chorizo which she buys at an important business and distributes them among her clientele on credit and then charges them weekly. Recently her business has grown, her orders have increased and she needs to somewhere to refrigerate her products, especially the soft drinks. For this reason, she needs to buy an appropriate cooler. Also, she is preparing for end of the year parties and women’s and children’s clothing are very popular. She has come to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to do her sixth loan and she is requesting a kiva loan for $1.500.000 COP.

Her dream is to improve her quality of life and the possibility to obtain more income for the family with her businesses. Her life has always been surrounded by business. She is a a person with many ideas and she is always putting them in motion, and she still dealing with entrepreneurial ideas that will generate income.

loans.use: To buy a cooler, cold cuts, soft drinks and women's clothing

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 25 años, es una mujer alegre y responsable, es madre soltera de 2 hermosos hijos Jeyson de 8 y Jeniffer de 3 meses de nacida; ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (Comunidad Nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Hace ya 2 años que se dedica a la siembra de diferentes productos como plátano, yuca y maíz híbrido (llamado también polenta). Menciona que estos productos son interminables ya que lo cosecha y siembra de acuerdo a la temporada; por ejemplo: el maíz lo cosecha a los 6 meses; la yuca después de un mes del maíz y el plátano cada 15 días. Por otro lado, cuando sus cultivos están maduros; los vende a los compradores que llegan los fines de semana a la comunidad nativa. Lo que más le agrada a Lida es poder sembrar diferentes variedades de frutos, entre ellas el cítricos, por el cual posee plantaciones desde hace 8 años, por lo que se dedicará a obtener un buena cosecha, de esa manera se podrá generar mayores ganancias. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y agradece a su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de poder invertir con su apoyo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de maíz, café y árboles de mandarina.
texts.en:
Lida is 25 years old and a happy and responsible single mother of two beautiful children: Jeyson is 8 years old and Jennifer is 3 months old.  They live in their own house located in the Peruvian jungle in the Pumpuriani Native Community Center.  

She has worked for two years planting different products like banana, yucca, and hybrid corn (also called polenta).  These products are endless since she harvest and plants according to the season.  For example, corn is harvested at six months, the yucca is harvested a month after the corn, and the bananas are harvested every fifteen days.  When her crops are ripe, she sells them to buyers who come to the native community on the weekend.  

Lida likes to be able to plant different varieties of fruits, including citrus, for which she has owned plantations for eight years, so she is dedicated to having a good harvest, so she can earn more money.  

This is her second loan from MFP and she thanks her community bank for giving her the opportunity to invest with their support.  With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of corn seeds, coffee, and tangerine trees.

loans.use: Purchase corn seeds, coffee, and tangerine trees

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is part of the communal bank “21 of May – El Roble” and resides in the city of Lota.  For the past seven years She has been running a grocery store in the backyard of her house with its own curb entrance. She and her husband take turns tending the business, as they open the business seven days a week, even on holidays or during festivities. She plans to purchase more merchandise with this loan. She is the mother of two, all grown up but they still reside at home even though they are economically independent. 

Silvia and her husband plan to purchase a truck, with the objective of traveling to Concepción (near Lota city) to purchase merchandise from there, as it is cheaper.  They travel to this city every month. 

Silvia has worked with the Kiva partner, Fondo Esperanza, for the past four years and is grateful for the loans she’s received that have enabled her to maintain her business. 

In Mapudungun (the language of the indigenous Mapuche population), Lota means ¨Humble Village¨.  It is a coastal community located near the city of Concepción in the southern region of Bíobío.  Lota is known for its large coal deposits, which were very important in the history and development of Chile.  The Chilean writer, Baldomero Lillo, memorializes Lota and the difficult living conditions of its coal miners in his book "Subterra" (Underground).

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (non-perishable goods)

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer tiene 39 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de carpintería.  Sus ventas, en su mayoría son por encargos, y algunas de contado por lo que sus clientes llegan a solicitarles diferentes pedidos. El inicio en este negocio desde hace 15 años, cabe señalar que el busca la forma de generar ingresos para su familia, pues es una persona muy inteligente. El está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de comprar materias primas para elaboración de sillas, comedores, escritorio camas entre otras cosas. Su sueño es seguir manteniendo su negocio y trabajando para sobrevivir.
texts.en: Elmer is 39 years old, and works as a carpenter. His sales are mostly commissioned and some are paid for the furniture as it is as some customers ask for different orders. Elmer began this business 15 years ago; it’s noteworthy to mention that he always looks for a way to generate income for his family since he is a very intelligent person. He is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make chairs, dining rooms, desks, beds among other items. Elmer’s dream is to keep his business and to keep working hard to survive.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Doris P. es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por el sector de la Florida en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la riqueza cultural  que tiene su gente, su bello centro histórico, su gran variedad de lugares para visitar, cuenta con una gran variedad de gastronomía para disfrutar.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 8 años de edad  que   estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller de latonería (enderezar latas de vehículos). No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros pero  independientemente.

Doña Doris trabaja junto a su esposo en el taller de latonería el cual ya tiene 6 años de funcionamiento, es la encargada de comprar los materiales que hacen falta y también colabora con el trabajo en el taller, laboran de lunes a sábados sin tener un horario fijo de trabajo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 9 años beneficiándose de los créditos anteriores en el taller comprando materiales. Con su nuevo crédito va a comprar herramientas como una pulidora para vehículos.
 
Su meta es  construir su casa en un terreno que es de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Doris P. is a member of the Feria Libre village bank.  She lives in the Florida area of the city of Cuenca, a city known for the cultural richness of its people, its beautiful historical center, and its large variety of places to visit.  It also has a large variety of great restaurants to enjoy.

She is 28 years old and married with 2 children, who are 8 and 9 years old and study in a school in the city.  Her husband runs a body shop.  They don't have their own home but live in their in-laws' house independently.

Doris works with her husband in the body shop which they have been running for 6 years.  She is in charge of buying the materials they need and she also does the actual body work.  They work Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the village bank for 9 years and has used prior loans to buy materials for the shop.  With this new loan, she will buy tools like a vehicle polisher.

Her goal is to build a home on their own land.

loans.use: Purchase a car polisher

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El señor Javier Antonio C., es un hombre casado de 42 años habitante del humilde Barrio San Pedro, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, que en la actualidad cursan la escuela primaria, ellos son agricultores de granos básicos desde hace mas de 15 años, tiempo que han combatido contra las enfermedades de sus terrenos provocadas por las plagas, a futuro desea realizar un estudio al suelo de sus propiedades, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales vegetativos que le permitan erradicar los problemas de plagas y brindar un mantenimiento fitosanitario a sus cosechas, mejorar el suelo y ayudarlo a una producción de las cosechas mas abundante, que incremente sus ventas y favorezcan a su economía para la incursión de nuevos mercados laborales y/o la posibilidad de ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones económicas, ellos son una familia responsable de la cual este es el tercer ciclo con Afodenic y su progreso ha sido notorio a raíz de el apoyo brindado por esta institución y el esfuerzo físico del señor.
texts.en: Javier Antonio C. is a married 42 year old man who lives in the humble San Pedro neighborhood; they have 2 young children who are currently in elementary school.  They are farmers who have grown basic grains for the last 15 years; during this time, they have had to fight against the plant sicknesses that have affected their lands.  In the future, they would like to carry out a soil study on their properties, but for now, they are seeking a loan to buy vegetative materials that will eradicate the diseases, offer plant health maintenance for their crops, improve the soil and improve their harvest.  This will increase their sales and improve their income which they will either invest in new markets and/or offer their family better living conditions.  They are a very responsible family and this is their third loan with AFODENIC.  They have been able to progress significantly due to the support they have received from AFODENIC and from their own hard work.

loans.use: Plant Health Maintenance on his farmland

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena, de 21 años, es una mujer trabajadora y hábil; ella vive con su mamá y su hermano Frank de 16 años, en una casa alquila ubicada en la selva peruana (Comunidad Nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Como mujer soltera, Lorena piensa que lo más importante es pensar en su futuro y el de su familia, por ello desde hace 3 años, logró comprar un pequeño terreno donde siembra plátano, maíz y café; que después los vende a los compradores que visitan los fines de semana la comunidad nativa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, trabajar en la chacra y con la ayuda incondicional de su hermano Frank; “eso me incentiva a salir adelante”, menciona. Por ello Lorena está ahorrando para comprar más terrenos de cultivo y así sembrar mayor cantidad de café. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo de su grupo comunal, que le ayuda a invertir y con ello progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra plantas de plátanos, asimismo desea preparar nuevamente la tierra para la próxima siembra.
texts.en: Lorena is 21 years old and a very hardworking, able woman.  She lives with her mother and her 16 year old brother Frank in a rented home in the Peruvian jungle (in the Pumpuriani Native Community Center).  As a single woman, Lorena believes that the most important thing is to look to her future and that of her family.  Due to this, 3 years ago she bought a small piece of land where she grows bananas, corn and coffee which she sells to the buyers who visit the native community on the weekends.  Her favorite thing about her work is cultivating the plants and working hard on the land with the help of her brother Frank.  "This motivates me to move forward," she says.  Lorena is saving her money to buy more land to work and to grow more coffee.  This is her 3rd loan through MFP and she is grateful for the support of her community group which helps her to invest and progress.  With the loan she is seeking, she will invest in more banana plants and will prepare her land for the next planting.

loans.use: Buy banana plants

loans.name: Gema Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Gema Elizabeth tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La señora tiene en su casa una pulpería ella  vende leña, frijoles cocidos, frutas, golosinas, detergentes y granos básicos. Tiene 3 años de tener este negocio, el cual como una alternativa de fuente de ingreso, esto con el objetivo de brindar manutención a sus hijos. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de realizar compras variadas de sus productos, ya que quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Además, aduce la señora, cada día los precios de los productos están cada día más caros. Este se ha convertido en un desafió para ella, debido a que la situación económica del país cada día está más difícil. Ella sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio, tratando siempre de que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en: Mrs. Gema Elizabeth is 38 years old, is married and has 4 children, two are underage and in her care. She has a convenience store in her home where she sells firewood, cooked beans, fruits, candy, detergents and basic grains. Mrs. Gema has had this business for 3 years; she started it as a new way to earn income for her family. She wants this loan to buy different products since she wants to increase her earnings. Mrs. Gema adds that each day, her products are more expensive which has been a challenge for her since her country’s economic condition becomes more difficult each day. Mrs. Gema dreams of continuing with her business making sure that her children go to school and prepare themselves for the future.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Katherin Priscila

texts.es:
La Señora Katherin C. es socia del banco comunal  Feria Libre, vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca. Esta ciudad es reconocida por la riqueza cultural de su gente, su bello centro histórico, por la variedad de lugares para visitar, cuenta con una gran variedad de gastronomía para disfrutar.

Nuestra socia tiene 18 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un bebe de 3 meses de edad. Su esposo le ayuda en la crianza y trabaja como portero de una escuela. Vive en una casa que su hermano le ha prestado.
 
La Señora Katherin es negociante de ropa, actividad que la realiza hace un año, vende todo tipo de ropa y zapatos, labora los días miércoles, viernes, sábados y domingos y no tiene un horario fijo. A pesar de tener varias actividades también estudia enfermería en la universidad.

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más calzado y ropa para surtir su negocio.

Su meta es  construir su casa en un terreno de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Katherin C. is a member of the Feria Libra village bank who lives in the city of Cuenca.  The city is know for the cultural richness of its people, its beautiful historic center, the variety of places to visit and the large variety of great restaurants to enjoy.

Katherin is 18 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has a 3 month old baby.  Her husband helps her to raise their child and works as the doorman at a school.  They live in a home that her brother has lent them.

For the past year, Katherin has worked selling clothing; she sells all kinds of clothes and shoes.  She works Wednesdays, Fridays, Saturdays and  Sundays and does not have a fixed schedule.  Besides all these activities, she also studies nursing at the university.

This is the second loan she is receiving through the village bank and she will invest it in buying more shoes and clothes to supply her business.

Her goal is to build a house on her own property.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Iris Del Pilar

texts.es:
Iris de 31 años,  tiene una papelería en donde vende artículos para fiestas, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.
