Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas para el negocio de su esposo y para comprar productos para la preparación de sus platos.
texts.en:
The village of 24 de Mayo is located in the province of Manabi. There, the community bank San Jose meets every two weeks. It is a location known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard working population made up of mostly agriculturists and livestock farmers. 

This is Flor's third loan cycle with her community bank and she is comfortable with the formality of the organization. She is 46 years old and she has been married for 30 years. She has 4 children, of whom 3 are grown and the youngest is 17 and he is in his last year of high school. One of her daughters is in university. Her husband is a tailor.

She has a tailoring shop together with her husband in the downtown of the village of 24 de Mayo. She makes clothing, primarily for gentlemen, but she also makes uniforms for schools and institutions. She works from Monday to Friday from 8am to 5pm and on the weekends she sells prepared foods from her home. Her daughter helps her and together they wake at 5am to have everything ready for their customers.

This loan will be used to purchase fabrics for her husband's business and to purchase ingredients to use in the preparation of her foods.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and ingredients.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie T. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 52 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. She wants her business to prosper and she is working hard to achieve it.

Rosenie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 42 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. She has a dream of having all her children graduate from college and have bright futures. She believes that by God's grace she can reach that dream if she works hard for it.

Roselyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 38 years old. Luzminda is married and has 6 children. Her eldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 2 months. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luzminda has been engaged in farming for over 20 years.

Luzminda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Zoila Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Zoila Maribel S. Díaz de 27 años de edad vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el caserio de Aguada de Palos. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio. Su esposo realiza colectivo en su auto. La Sra. Zoila requiere el crédito para incrementar su negocio. Su sueño segun nos comenta es ampliar su negocio para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mrs. Zoila Maribel S. Díaz is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and son in the community of Aguada de Palos. She sells groceries from her home. Her husband has a transportation service with his car. Zoila needs the loan to grow her business. Her dream, she tells us, is to expand her business to be able to give her family a better quality of life. She is very grateful for any support that we can give her via this financing.   .

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the town of Aurora. She is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jocelyn also put up a sari-sari store where she sells soy sauce, soap and other kinds of products. Her income from the store helps in their daily needs. 

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia S. is from the town of Aurora. She is 36 years old. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Letecia works hard to provide for her family and pay for her obligations.

Letecia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the town of Aurora. She is 31 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 3 children. Her eldest child is only aged 7. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jocelyn says she works hard especially now that her children are starting to go to school. 

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily S. is from the town of Aurora. She is 31 years old. Emily is married and has 2 children aged 12 and 8. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emily hopes to sustain her family especially her children's education. 

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Emily is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Mujeres Unidas, pertenece al distrito D. Acoria en Huancavelica.
Lucy es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 14 y 15 años que están en la escuela, Lucy tiene una pequeña bodega la que ha ido implementando poco a poco, ahora hasta venD. gas. Su mayor dificultad son los problemas D. salud que ella tiene. Estar en su bancomunal le ha permitido ahorrar y así implementar y comprar al por mayor los productos que ofrece.
Lucy solicita un préstamo para la compra D. productos para su tienda, también comprará bebidas porque se acerca una fiesta patronal en la localidad y en estas fechas las ventas se incrementan. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio teniendo una tienda granD. y surtida.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres Unidas belongs to the district of Acoria in Huancavelica.
Lucy is married. She has 2 children who are 14 and 15 years old who are in school. Lucy has a little store which she has outfitted little by little. Right now, she sells natural gas. Her biggest problem is the health problems that she has. Being in her community bank has allowed her to save and thus outfit the business and buy the products she offers wholesale.  

Lucy is asking for a loan to purchase products for her store. She will also buy beverages because a patron saint festival is coming up in the community and at that time sales increase. Her dream is to grow her business and to have a large and diverse store.

loans.use: To purchase beverages

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina P. is from the town of Aurora. She is 49 years old. Darlina is married and has 11 children. Her eldest child is 31 years old while the youngest is only 3. To make a living, Darlina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Darlina also put up a sari-sari store to add to their income. She says that with a family as big as hers, it is difficult to send all the children to school but she works hard to be able to do it.

Darlina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darlina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Darlina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pelagio

texts.es:
Pelagio es socio del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Pelagio es casado y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, Pelagio tiene un carro con el cual se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, además tiene otra unidad que es conducida por un chofer.
Pelagio necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos y neumáticos.
Los sueños de Pelagio son comprar otro terreno para construir una casa y que su hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Pelagio is a member of the Villa Huatatas Community Bank.  He is married and has two children, one of which is still in school.  

Using his own vehicle, Pelagio works as a taxi driver. He also has another transport car, which is driven by a different driver. Pelagio is applying for a loan of 900 Nuevos Soles (~300 USD), which will be invested in the purchase of spare parts and tires.

Pelagio’s dreams are to buy another property to build a house, and that his children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and tires

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary D. is from the town of Aurora. She is 31 years old. Rosemary is married and has 4 children. Her eldest is 15 and the youngest is only 2 years old. To make a living, Rosemary owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosemary wishes for her family to have a better living condition.

Rosemary joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosemary is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Victoria es viuda, tiene 6 hijos y solo 1 estudia, Victoria compra cereales que procesa en su casa, productos que lleva a la ciudad D. cañete para ser comercializados.
Victoria solicita un crédito D. 1500 soles para la compra D. cereales.
Los sueños D. Victoria son tener capital propio y su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Villa Huatatas Community Bank.  She is a widow; she has six children, and only one of her children is in school.  

Victoria buys cereals, which she processes in her house and then takes to the city of Cañete to be sold.  She is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles for the purchase of cereals.

Her dreams are to have financial capital of her own, and that her son can finish his studies.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es soltera y tiene 1 hija de 3 años que están en el nido, Reyna vende leña en su casa, producto que adquiere de los productores que le traen a su casa. Además Reyna trabaja en una pastelería como vendedora.
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas y necesita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Reyna son comprar un terreno para construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reyna is a single mother of a three-year-old daughter who is still at home.  She sells firewood from her home, which she gets from producers who deliver it to her.  Reyna also works in a cake shop as a salesperson.

Reyna is a member of the Villa Huatatas Community Bank, and she is applying for a loan of 900 Nuevos Soles (~300 USD) for the purchase of firewood.

Her dreams are to buy property to build a house, and to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza R. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Analiza is married and has 4 children. Her eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 15. To make a living, Analiza owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Analiza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Paula Marina

texts.es:
Paula tiene 71 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a unos familiares en el distrito de Pacasmayo, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a la venta de carne de aves en un puesto ubicado en el mercadillo de la ciudad de Pacasmayo. Ella ofrece su mercadería diariamente y cuenta con una clientela fija debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad. Este negocio le permite sentirse activa y solventar sus gastos personales, así como colaborar con la economía de su familia.

Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más carne para ofrecerla en venta a sus clientes, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Paula es una mujer bastante dinámica y de buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le quieren y admiran mucho. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Paula is 71, widowed, and she lives together with family members in the Pacasmayo district, capital of the province of the same name, located in La Libertad region, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For the past fifteen years she has been selling poultry in a stand located in the market of the city of Pacasmayo.  She sells her poultry daily and  has regular customers because of the years she has been in the business.  This allows her to stay active and cover her personal expenses, and thus she can contribute to the finances of the family.

Paula would like to expand her business by buying more poultry to sell to her customers, and for this reason, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 sols.

Paula is a dynamic and good woman and people who know her admire and care for her very much.  In the past she has had loan from Edpyme Alternativa and she has exhibited punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

loans.use: To buy poultry to expand her sales in the market

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 56 years old. Romeo is married and has 3 children. His eldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 13 and still goes to school. To make a living, Romeo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Romeo works hard to financially support his family.

Romeo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 57 years old. Florentina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Florentina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pay for the laborers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pay for the laborers

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson Y., from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin Misamis Occidental, is 43 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Samson has been planting and harvesting mangoes for sale for over 25 years, and earns approximately 30000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Samson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 50000 PHP from GDMPC, he is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Samson's 18th loan from GDMPC, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and materials for mango production

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de platos de comida para lo cual posee un restaurante desde hace ocho años, ella atiende en este establecimiento a sus clientes que acuden a ese lugar porque prefieren su buen trato y la buena sazón que les suele brindar. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

Sabina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos, de modo que pueda preparar más platos de comida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Sabina ya ha tenido préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Sabina is a mother who lives with her famly in the district of Pacasmayo, capital of the province of the same name, located in the Libertad region, two hours from Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.
For the last eight years, she has prepared and sold food in her restaurant.  Her customers come to her restaurant because they prefer the good service and delicious food that she is in the habit of providing.  She uses the income from the restaurant to help her husband pay household expenses.
Sabina wishes to expand her business by purchasing more supplies so that she can prepare more food; therefore, she believes it is advisable to request a loan of 2000 nuevos soles ($725) from Edpyme Alternativa (local lending institution).
Sabina has borrowed money from Edpyme Alternativa before and has made her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase of food to increase sales in her restaurant

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon S., 51, and her husband, Mr. Sam-oeun Some, 55, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1978 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home; one is a tailor; another one weaves silk at home, and another attends school.

Mrs. Khon S. has been a silk weaver for 20 years, selling her finished products to a middleman who then resells them in Phnom Penh market. Her husband drives for a company in Phnom Penh. Khon is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mr. Theary V., and his wife, Mrs. Soklim Nao, live in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2003. Mr. Theary V. has been selling cows for over more than 20 years, buying them from his villagers and the nearby district for resale to a middleman who comes to buy them at his house.

Having already benefited from one Kiva loan, Theary hopes to continue expanding his business and better support his family. He is therefore applying for his second loan of $1,000 to purchase cows for resale.

Mr. Theary V. was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S., 52 years old, has spent her whole life cultivating rice for 8 hours every day. By doing this, she can generate a income to meet the financial needs of her family. To earn additional income, Kim S. always wakes up in the morning to make and sell porridge and sell to clients in the village. Kim S. has planted rice crops two months ago, but they are not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of the obstacle, Kim S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.name: Sa-Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa-em R. and her husband, Mr Kimchit Chay, have been married for more than 14 years. They have one son and one daughter, both in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sa-em has been a weaver since she was 18 years old, while her husband has been a mason since 2005. In addition to selling her own products, she wants to buy additional silk fabric from her fellow villagers and transport them to sell in other provinces. She is therefore requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase finished fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Mrs Hen U. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr Nai Sok, live along National Road No. One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1975 and have six children - two sons and four daughters. 

The couple has been growing rice for more than 30 years. Hen has asked for a Kiva loan once before. She wants to supplement a new business raising pigs. She is applying for her second loan of $1,000 to purchase piglets to raise, and she will use a part of the loan to continue her farming business.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs

loans.name: Sochet

texts.en:
Mr Sochet C. (pictured above) is 28 years old and his wife, Mrs Da Vorn, is 27 years old. They have been married since 2002 and have just one daughter who attends school. He also has an elderly mother who lives with him. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sochet is a security guard and drives a motor taxi in his free time. His wife is a garment factory worker. He wants to change his taxi business from a motor taxi to a Tuk Tuk (motorized rickshaw) because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $700 to purchase a Tuk Tuk.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs Vanna N. and her husband, Mr Tom Toch (pictured above) have been married since 1984 and have eight children - seven sons and one daughter. One of them is married and lives away from home, one is a garment factory worker, three help their parents in the business and the other three attend school. The family lives on National Road No. One, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vanna and her husband are rice and vegetable farmers. In addition to farming, Mr Tom Toch is a fisherman. The couple have applied for a Kiva loan twice before. Vanna is now requesting her third loan of $1,200 to continue her farming business by purchasing fertilizer, pesticides and fuel.

loans.use: To use for farming

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Kunthea Toun, have been married since 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and another one stays at home. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Saren's husband is a fisherman. Saren sells the fish that her husband catches. She also buys some fish from local villagers to resell at Korky market. In addition, the couple grows vegetable on their farmland in the village.

Saren has requested a Kiva loan in the past. She now is asking for her second loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm. She will also use a part of the loan to dig a well for her family's use.

loans.use: To use for farming and to dig a well

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 35-year-old married woman and mother. S. and her husband have always earned a living by growing crops on their own farmland next to their house. This couple have two young kids who are employed. As S.’s cow is getting old, she can't use the cow to plow her land. Because of that, S. would like to purchase a new cow but she has no enough money to buy one. Therefore, S. requests a loan to make that possible.

loans.use: To purchase a new cow.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mr. An H., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Savang Sang, 39, have been married since 1986 and have three children -- one son and two daughters. The family lives on National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

An and his wife are farmers and make a living by growing vegetables and flowers. An is applying for his first loan, for $700, to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm. He will also use a portion of this loan to add a kitchen to his house.

loans.use: To improve their farm and build a kitchen.

loans.name: Agosto Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Agosto Poty se conformó en fecha 16 de agosto del 2010, el comité  se encuentran en el 1º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollarán actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo y para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr. Domitila  quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito pudo aumentar su producción.
 Ella       nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que ella viuda. 
 Según la Sra. Domitila   mencionó que las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya son muy importantes ya que mediante ella pudieron encontrar un apoyo ya que las mujeres son muy poco ayudadas en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The Agosto Poty Women’s Committee was formed on August 16th, 2010.  The Committee is in its first cycle together, supported within the Fundación Paraguaya program.

In addition to the independent work of each member, the group will also develop collaborative fundraising activities; their goal is to build up financial capital within the group, and to be able to support their families through economically productive work.

One very moving story is that of Mrs. Domitila, who works in food sales. She tells us that through credit from the group, she was able to increase her production; as a widow, she has seen her family’s economic situation improve greatly through her business.
 
According to Domitilia, the activities that the group does with the Fundación Paraguaya are very important, as through the foundation they were able to find support, and it is very difficult for women to find help in our country

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food sales

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy P., 30, is single and lives with her parents, sisters and brothers in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthy has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. Unfortunately, the house where she and her family live was destroyed in a fire and everyone is now living in a shelter. She is applying for a loan, her first, for $800 to build new house for the family to live in.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly Y. is 41 years old, as is her husband, Mr. Khan Yet. They have been married since 1997 and have one daughter who is a construction worker.  The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Like her daughter, Ly is a construction worker and her husband is a mason. She is applying for her first loan, for $200, to repair the house where they live.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao K., 35, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Men, 39, have been married since 1991 and have three sons. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Sreymao makes a living selling food at her house, and husband helps her in this business. The couple also runs a rice farm. They hire the fellow villagers to grow their rice because they are so busy selling food.  

Sreymao is asking for her first loan, $1,000, to buy additional land on which to grow rice.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy L., 30, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Van, 31, have been married since 2003 and have a young daughter. The famiL. lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Navy and her husband make a living working in a garment factory. They also raise cows when they are not at work, and earn extra income by selling their cows when they are grown. 

Navy is requesting her first loan, for $500, to buy a new cow to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise and sell

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Virgen del Pilar se conformó en fecha 27 de diciembre del 2.008, con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 5º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una de la integrantes es Sra. Flavia R.  quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su administración; su nivel de vida e ingreso económico. 
Ella  nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente posee además del ingreso de su marido quien es chofer, con  el ingreso de su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otros.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Pilar Women’s Committee was formed on December 27, 2008, and with much effort they find themselves in their fifth cycle together, working within the support of the Fundación Paraguaya program.

In addition to the independent work of each member, the group also develops collaborative fundraising activities with the goal of collecting financial capital within the group.  At the same time, they help each other to reach their objectives – in particular, to work to support their families financially.

One of the group’s members is Mrs. Flavia R., who sells clothing for a living.  She tells us that through the group’s credit, she was able to significantly improve her operation and administration, as well as her income and quality of life.

She tells us that through this business, her family’s economic situation has improved substantially, as they have been able to add her income to that of her husband, who is a driver.

Flavia is applying for this loan to buy T-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothing items.

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, shirts, pants, blouses, and other clothing items for retail sale

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs Savoeun S. (pictured above at her loom) is 43 years old and her husband, Mr Sophal Hel, is 52 years old. They have been married for 25 years and have four children - two sons and two daughters. Both daughters weave silk at home, one of her sons is attending university and another one has full-time employment. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savoeun has been a weaver since she before she was married, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is a wooden-house constructor, alS. since before their marriage. Savoeun is requesting a loan of US$1,100 to pay school fees for her son and she will use part of the loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son and buy silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal D., is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreylin Khut, is 25 years old.  They have been married for five years and have a daughter.  Sophal's parents are also living with him. They live along National Road no. 5, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophal is a wood deliveryman. He buys wood and then delivers it to customers who have businesses that require wooden materials. He is invested in the business with his brother-in-law but he now wants to run his own business. 

Sophal is applying for his first loan of $600 in order to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry wood for resale. 

Mr. Sophal D. was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry wood.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mr. Kunthea N. and his wife, Mrs. Srey Khun, have been married since 1986 and have six children (five sons and one daughter). One of them has a full-time job and the others are in school. 

For more than ten years, Khunthea has been producing concrete posts (for building fences) and concrete pipes (for using in sewage systems). He has asked for a Kiva loan once already. This time, he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to help his children get to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive his children to school.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun C. (photo), and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Kek, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1978. 

Savun and her husband are rice farmers. The couple hopes to supplement their income by starting a new business farming fish.  Savun is asking for a loan of $500 to launch the business.

loans.use: To launch a fish-farming business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. She raises pigs and maintains a calamansi (citrus fruit) farm. She raises pigs for fattening and sale. She sells her calamansi to the market. Jocelyn works hard making sure the pigs she raises are healthy and that her calamansi trees bear much fruit. One of her goals is to sustain her children until college. She wants to see them have bright futures.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin L. (pictured here in her farm) is a widow with six children (one son and five daughters).  Five of them are married and live outside the family home and the other one assists her mother in the business.  She lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Rin L. has been farming for more than 30 years. She has asked for a Kiva loan once already and is now requesting her second loan of $600 to continue her farming business by purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farming business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long H. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Kry You, have been married since 1979.  They have nine children (four sons and five daughters). Three of them are married and live outside the family home; one is a garment factory worker; and the others are in school, two of whom are attending university.
 
The couple are farmers.  They grow cucumbers on their farmland in the village where they live.  Kry is also a fisherman. 

Long is applying for a loan of $1,000 to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor es soltero, vive en el barrio Conavi Norte de la ciudad de Pilar.
Posee casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familar, posee móvil de transporte propio, camioneta, moto.
El mismo es comerciante, también cuenta con una  empresa de servicios que realiza la actividad de ventas de servicios .
Solicita el crédito para compras de insumos para su negocio  como fideos, arroz, aceite, carbón, lacteo, enlatados y otros.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 10 años.
Agradece también a la Organización por los buenos servicios que le brinda la institución para su empresa comercial y de servicios.
texts.en:
Jorge is a single man who lives in the neighborhood of North Conavi in the city of Pilar.  He owns his own home, which has all of the comforts for the well-being of a family.  He also has his own means of transportation: a truck and motorcycle.

He is a merchant, and also owns a store that sells services.  He is asking for this loan to buy supplies for his business like pasta, rice, oil, coal, milk, canned goods and other products.  He has had this business for more than ten years.

He would like to thank the organization for its good services that support the institution for his commercial business and services.

loans.use: Purchase of pasta, rice, oil, coal, milk, canned goods and other foods

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mr. Sinat S. (pictured here) is 31 years old and his wife, Mrs. Savy Yoem, is 27 years old.  They have been married since 2004 and have a young daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mr. Sinat S. is a farmer.  He grows vegetables on his farmland in the village.  His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $700 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide and to make a shelter to protect his vegetables from the sun.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for his farming business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 56 years old. Gloria is married. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gloria also owns a sari-sari store. She sells vinegar, softdrinks and other kinds of products. 

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 62 years old. Margarita is married. She is engaged in farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice crops for many years now. At her age, she can still manage to perform farming activities. She says she still wants to help provide for her family.

Margarita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor es separado, tiene dos hijas una de 16 años y la otra de 19 años, vive en el barrio San Antonio  de esta ciudad , posee una  despensa donde comercializa producto de primera necesidad y otros artículos, tiene casa propia y en el mismo lugar tiene su negocio donde también vive sus padres que ayudan también en el negocio.
 Son una familia muy trabajadora y con ganas de superarse cada día y con miras en ampliar cada ves mas su actividad actual, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado como así también el queda comprometido en cumplir en tiempo y forma el compromiso adquirido con la empresa para así en un determinado tiempo poder contar nuevamente con el apoyo de la Institución para cualquier emprendimiento dentro de su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio  como yerba mate, harina, azucar, fideos, y otros.
texts.en:
Juan is separated and has two daughters who are 16 and 19 years old.  He lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio in the city of Pilar.  He owns a store where he sells staple products and other items.  He owns his own home, and his business is in the same neighborhood.  His parents also live there, and they help with the business.

They are a very hard-working family with hopes of improving themselves every day and increasing their business.  He is thankful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the good services they have provided, and he remains committed to paying back the loan on time so that he can continue counting on the support of the Foundation for other improvements to his business.

Juan is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise for his store, including yerba mate [type of tea], flour, sugar, pasta, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for his store

loans.name: Thôn Đoài 1 - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03) Group

texts.en:
T. Ngô Thị (20209020015) is a 31 year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a five-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đoài 1 - nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

T. is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling poultry products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,600,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous L. was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new L. of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The L. will be the third L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve or expand the borrower's business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Lê Thị H. (0) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 672,000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


2.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


3.  Ngô Thị H. (0) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND L. to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


4.  Lê Thị D. (0) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Ngô Thị  (20209020015) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đoài 1 - nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh D. chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t gia cầm trong cộng đồng địa pH..  T. thực hiện công việc kinh D. này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh D. của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị H. (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 672.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là vận hành công việc kinh D. chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Ngô Thị H. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là vận hành công việc kinh D. chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Lê Thị D. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các D. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S., 39 years old, owns a small shop located inside the market where she sells fish and chicken. She tries to generate a specific profit in order to ensure that her family has their basic living needs met. She is married to Samoeung, 36, who assists her in the fish business, and they have three children. 

San S. is managing her trade smoothly because she has natural skill in how to attract customers. However, she can make only a small profit as her business is reaching a low point due to insufficient financial capital. She will use the loan she requested to increase her working capital, which will sustain her business grown.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Erly

texts.en:
Farming is the main source of income of the family of Erly C.,  33 years old and a dependable wife and a mother of 6 children. She has been a member of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI) – a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines since 2006. Her husband is a farmer but they only rent the land that they cultivate in other word they are tenants. The couples dream is to own a land where they can plant rice and vegetables and even build a house of their own. She joined ASHI with the hope that they can fulfill this dream. Gradually, with the financial assistance from KIVA they are now earning towards the fulfillment of that dream. Though her 2 eldest children have finish only high school, the couple works doubly hard to support their 4 remaining children with their schooling. Her two eldest are now working. 

She is applying for another loan of Php 25,000.00 to finance the needed farm supplies for their growing rice plantation. Her husband will buy sacks of fertilizer and pesticides and pay for hire farming laborers to weed the farm. She is hoping that after 3 months their profit will increase. She is always praying for the success of the partnership of ASHI and KIVA in helping poor families.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay farming labor

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An N. is 47 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vanny Sang, is 45 years old (pictured here together). They have been married since 1986 and have six children, three sons and three daughters. All of the daughters are garment factory workers, one son is a fisherman and the other two attend school.  They are living along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. An N. was hired by her villagers to farm to earn fees for supporting her family. Then her husband got sick and stays at home. Now An hopes to launch her own farming business, but she does not have the necessary capital. 

She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to use as working capital.

loans.use: To start a farming business.

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
Huệ Lê Thị (20209020025) is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ is the group leader for a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đoài 1 - nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


Huệ is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Huệ owns a tailoring business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members.  Huệ has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 4.200.000 VND a month from it.


In 2008, Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND, which will be used to purchase a new sewing machine.  The loan will be her fourth loan from SEDA.  Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị S. (0) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


3.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


4.  Lê Thị T. (0) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huệ  Lê Thị (20209020025) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đoài 1 - nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may mặc trang phục đặc trưng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huệ  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ  kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Huệ  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huệ  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vải & vật liệu bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị S. (0) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M.  (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


4.  Lê Thị T. (0) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda B., photographed with her husband, is from the town of Panglao. She is 36 years old. Glenda is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Glenda owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating "habal-habal" (motorcycle) transport services. Glenda is working hard to sustain her children's education.

Glenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Glenda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and other motorcycle accessories

loans.name: It

texts.en:
Mrs. It C. (see photo) and her husband, Mr. Hout Khloeng, have been married since 1970 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home, one attends school and the other three children weave silk at home. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

It has been a silk weaver for more than twenty-five years. She asked for a Kiva loan previously to purchase silk materials. She hopes to continue her weaving business because she has children to assist their mother in the business.

It is requesting a second loan of 1,000 USD to purchase silk materials.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials to continue her and her children’s weaving business

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoy K. (see photo) and her husband, Mr. Sroing Sang, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1964 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. All of their sons are married and live outside the family home. One daughter weaves silk at home, and the other two are garment factory workers.

Chhoy and her husband are farmers. They grow bananas and cucumbers. The couple is old, but they are still strong enough to work. Chhoy is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy fabric for her son who is a tailor and purchase weaving materials for her daughter to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her son, a tailor, and weaving materials for her daughter to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Tình's Group

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị T. is a 36-year-old woman who is married and has four school-aged children. She lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Nguyễn is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA. The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đoài 1 - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nguyễn makes a living raising chickens for sale. She has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,100,000 VND a month.

In 2008 Nguyễn joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new group loan, her third from SEDA, of 7,392,000 VND. Her portion will be used to purchase chicken feed and other supplies. Nguyễn plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lê Thị H. is a 58-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business. 2. Nguyễn Thị X. is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

****************************************************

T. Nguyễn Thị là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cụm Đoài 1 - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.100.000 VND. Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị H. (0) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 2. Nguyễn Thị X. (0) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and other supplies

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta B. is from the town of Panglao. She is 45 years old. Vicenta, married and has 2 school-aged children. Vicenta is engaged in fishing. She has a fishing boat that her husband operates. She sells all his catch to the market. She also dries some fish.  Vicenta and her family depend on their fishing business.

Vicenta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat and purchase fishing hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to repair borrower's fishing boat and purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie V. is 42 years old and enter marriage at an early age. The eldest of her 4 children is 23 and the youngest is 3 years old. Her eldest daughter is now a teacher. Her eldest son is 21 years old and has finished Hotel and Restaurant Management studies. Her 15 year son is in high school. 

The couple was able to support the studies of their children because of the financial assistance from her business. She is a skilled manicurist and with the support of the business and put up a small shop. Aside from her shop, she is also doing home service for her busy customers. Her income is doing well but not sufficient enough because as of now they are still renting. It has been the couples dream to have their own house and lot for their children and they are working hard to meet this goal.

Elsie is applying for another loan of Php 29,000.00 pesos to improve her shop, buy new manicure and pedicure sets, nail polishers and hair dressing tools. She is gaining more customers and wants to serve them with convenience and a with a comfortable feeling. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will support her business plans so that she can generate more income for the fulfillment of their dream.

loans.use: To buy a manicure set, nail polish, hair dressing tools and make shop improvements

loans.name: Soknak

texts.en: Mrs. Soknak N. is a widow with two sons and a daughter. She lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Soknak N. is a silk weaver. She also buys silk products from weavers in her village and transports them to sell in another province far from her house. She is asking for a loan of $800 to continue her business by purchasing silk and cotton fabrics to sell and to replace an old untrustworthy motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase cotton and silk fabrics and to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Srta. Nancy Q.  vive en el barrio Crucesita tiene 24 años tiene vivienda propia donde cuenta con todas las comodidades, no tiene hijos cuenta con móvil propio (moto).
Es comerciante desde hace 4 años primero se desempeño como administradora pero hace más de un año adquirió un local propio donde se dedica e la venta de prendas de todo tipo de buena calidad y de marcas reconocidas, en la ciudad es reconocida por la gran clientela con que cuenta.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de prendas para esta temporada que se acerca; y agradece  la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado a través del crédito concedido.
texts.en:
Nancy Q. lives in the neighborhood of Crucesita.  She is 24 years old and has her own home, which has all of the amenities.  She does not have children, and she has her own cell phone.

She has had a store for four years.  At first, she was an administrator, but more than a year ago, she acquired her own store.  She sells all types of clothing from recognizable brands of good quality.  She is known in the city for her large number of customers.  

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of spring clothing.  She thanks the Paraguaya Foundation for the support they provide through the loans they give.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for the spring, including t-shirts, dresses and other items

loans.name: Phạm

texts.en: C. Phạm Thị (20209020006) is a 60 year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 1 adult child. To making a living, C. raises chickens for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2,300,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. C. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. C. Phạm Thị (20209020006) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 1 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, C. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 18 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.300.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. C. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. C. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.
