With this as her only source of livelihood, she has painstakingly managed to make ends meet despite seasonal income fluctuations and poor road systems to access bigger markets. With a hard work ethic and ready market, the 49-year-old married and happy-go-lucky mother of 5 children has kept her business on a path of consolidated growth. She earns 360,000 UGX monthly. Her business has gained ground over the years, benefiting her family. Her business plan for the future is to sell more bananas to an increasingly expanding market. She will use this loan to purchase manure for her plantation for better production.

loans.use: purchasing manure for the plantation

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.fr:
Monsieur Théoneste B. est un jeune de 30 ans, naquit dans le district de Ngororero de l’ancienne préfecture de Gisenyi en province de l’Ouest. Il est célibataire, il vit avec ses parents et il a un diplôme de niveau A0 en Développement rural.
Il une mini papeterie et secrétariat publique. Son IMF est Amasezerano Community Banking sa, Il prend un prêt aujourd’hui pour acheter une photocopieuse pour l’utiliser dans secrétariat car il l’a implanté tout près de l’Université Libre de Kigali, Campus de Gisenyi ou habite cet homme pour satisfaire des besoins des étudiants de ce campus. C’est son deuxième prêt, il veut à la longue prendre un prêt pour l’habitat, il pourra aussi se marier et avoir des enfants par les épargnes continuelles.
texts.en: Mr. Théoneste B. is 30 years old.  He was born in the Ngororero district of the former prefecture of Gisenyi in the Western Province.  He is unmarried, lives with his parents, and has an A0 degree in Rural Development.  He has a small stationary shop and offers public secretarial services.  His microfinance institution is Amasezerano Community Banking.  Today he is taking a loan in order to purchase a photocopier to use in his shop, as he has established his business very near the University Libre de Kigali's Gisenyi campus such that he can satisfy the needs of the university students.  This is his second loan.  In the long term, he would like to take out a loan for a house and also to be able to marry and have children with his continued savings.

loans.use: Buy photocopier

loans.name: Kyandago Development B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
N. Loy of Kyandago Development group is a 37-year-old determined, hardworking and happily married mother of 5 children. Like any other responsible parent, she studied how best she could satisfy her family requirements. She started a poultry farming business, where she looks after chickens for egg production and broilers for consumption. She manages this alongside her other farm sales.

In her home area of Kyandago, Kihihi, she has a variety of chickens, which makes her business more attractive. With this project, she has been able to capture a good share of the market from shopkeepers and hotel owners who purchase her eggs. She earns 90,000 UGX weekly and is well able to look after her family. Her main intention for taking up this loan is to help in the purchase of chicken feeds and feeding troughs and to stock more chicken. This will improve her market supply and her sales revenue.

loans.use: to restock chicken and to buy chicken feed and feeding troughs

loans.name: Mbuya Women's Group-Kampala

texts.en: She is a buoyant 40-year-old who ventured into business 14 years ago.  It is with the influence of close friends that she began her rental and water selling businesses in Kinawataka-Kampala.  At her age, N. Jane of Mbuya Women's Group is surprisingly single but she has four children from her previous marriage. Being single has, in many ways, played into her hands in that she has gotten enough time to build her business experience. In this course of time, she has given her business the quality time and devotion it needs. Since the inception of her business, she has managed to steadily sustain her finances. On a monthly basis, her financial gains amount to 300,000 shillings. She credits her suave business skills as one factor that has kept her above her competition. Notwithstanding her successes, she envisages an even brighter future for herself if she can get a loan to sustainably expand her business. Jane also operates a kiosk business. This aids in her profit consolidation. With this loan, she wants to build more rentals.

loans.use: To pay for construction costs for new rental structures

loans.name: Lavodi Plus Group

texts.en:
Franck O. is the president of the Community Bank “Lavodi Plus”, which is composed of 18 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 


Franck runs a telephone booth to the west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2007. His beginning capital was US$ 60. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Franck is now well-known and liked in this area. He is a trustworthy client who has received six times MFI HOPE DRC loans and has fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. 

Franck makes US$ 240 profit each week. He intends with the next loan to purchase more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. He is 32 years old, married, and a father of two children aged 4 and 7 of whom one goes to school. His ambition is to open a general store in his area.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid cards to meet customer demand

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cruz Del Sur Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Santiago II es un centro focal mediano que acoge a cerca cien asociaciones comunales.  “Cruz del Sur”, es una de ellas, está en su quinto ciclo, de nueve integrantes ocho son mujeres y uno es varón. 

La señora Paulina es la presidenta, la señora Filomena es la secretaria de actas y la señora Bertha es la tesorera de la asociación.  El negocio en el que participa la señora secretaria de actas, es la venta de repuestos de auto, desde hace 3 años.  Ella comenta que fue su esposo quien le enseñó el negocio de vender repuestos de autos.

Su primera solicitud fue de $us 100.-, ahora solicitó Bs. 2000.- en ambos casos, su objetivo era la compra de mercadería. Las ventas son realizadas en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio, los jueves y domingo, durante el día.  Le ayuda en el trabajo su esposo.

Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta más de Pro Mujer, la señora comenta que la capacitación.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: transporte, comerciante de libros, venta de comida, venta  de ropa usada, venta de accesorio de autos, llantería y repartidor de leche.
texts.en:
The Santiago II central office is a medium sized office that includes nearly 100 communal associations.  One of those is "Cruz del Sur" (Southern Cross).  It's in its fifth cycle and is made up of nine members; eight women and one gentleman.  Paulina is the president, Filomena is the secretary, and Bertha is the group's treasurer.

The business that Filomena has had for three years is the selling of repair parts for automobiles.  Her first loan was for $100.  She is now requesting 2,000 BS.  In both cases the loan was for the purchase of inventory.  She makes her sales during the day on Thursdays, and Sundays, at the fair in the "16 de Julio" zone.  Her husband helps her.  When asked what she likes best about "Pro Mujes," she tells us that she likes the training.

Other businesses run by the group's members include transportation, book sales, food sales, second hand clothing sales, automobile accessories, tires, and milk delivery.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos de automovil

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, de 44 años, vive con Rosinda de 34 años, con quien tiene 6 hermosos hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos en su casa propia. Todos los día desde muy temprano sale a trabajar de peón en la construcción del servicio eléctrico de su comunidad, regresando muy cansado a casa; esperando ansiosamente la llegada de los domingos; ya que es el único día que se dedica al cuidado de sus terreno donde siembra arveja con el apoyo de su familia, “mis hijos me ayudan a cultivar y mi esposa trae el almuerzo” menciona. Al día Hugo vende 4 bolsas de arveja en el mercado central de su ciudad,  por ello esta pensando en estos meses sembrar 100 kilos más y con ello tener mayor capital para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y como presidente de su banco comunal le gusta dirigir a sus socios y poder ayudarlos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y abono para la arveja que cultivará.
texts.en: Hugo, 44 years old, lives with Rosinda, 34, with whom he has 6 beautiful children, but he only lives with 4 of them in their own home. Every day he leaves for work very early as a worker building the electrical grid for his community, coming back home very tired. He waits anxiously for Sundays since this is the only day he devotes to taking care of his land where he plants peas with his family's help. "My children help me plant and my wife brings lunch," he mentions. Hugo sells 4 pea bags every day in the central market of his town, and this is why he is thinking of planting 100 more kilos to have more capital and improve the quality of life for his family. This is the seventh credit with MFP, and as president of his communal bank he likes to manage the partners and help them. With the loan he is requesting he will purchase seeds and manure for the peas that he will plant.

loans.use: Comprar semillas de arveja y abono.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of intrants for making local soap

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora una mujer entusiasta de 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Llanco. Sus días las pasa cuidando a sus hijos y trabajando en su terreno donde siembra papa y verduras que después los vende en el mercado de su ciudad; como mujer Nora administra muy bien su dinero y cada vez tiene mayor capital, su meta es sembrar mayor cantidad de verduras para poder ofrecerlas en la capital, pero sabe que necesita invertir en mayor cantidad de hectáreas de cultivo por eso en estos meses esta sembrará una parcela más de papa, afirma que con la ayuda de su banco comunal y de su esposo lo logrará. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y agradece la ayuda que le ofrece su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas, abono y remedio para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Nora, an enthusiastic 41 year old, lives with her husband and 4 children in their own home, located in the town of Llanco. Her days are spent taking care of her children and working in her plot of land where she plants potatoes and vegetables that will later be sold in the market of her town. As a woman, Nora manages her money very well and has more and more capital. Her goal is to plant a greater amount of vegetables to be able to offer in the capital, but she knows that she will need to invest in more farm land. This is why for the next few months she will plant another parcel of potato; she is sure that with the help from her communal bank and her husband she will make it. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the help she receives from the communal bank. With the loan she is requesting she will buy seeds, manure and fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel Santamaría es una confeccionista que inició su negocio impulsada por el ejemplo que le dio su madre como su maestra inicial y  su misma naturaleza que gradualmente la impulsaba a trabajar como confeccionista ; fue  así  como sin haber terminado el bachillerato, se dedicó a realizar cursos técnicos hasta llegar a estudiar en el SENA ( Servició nacional de Aprendizaje),  donde perfeccionó su arte aprendiendo diseño y patronaje como su base principal y luego se direccionó hacia la línea de confección femenina, cuando empezó a trabajar en la zona franca de Barranquilla y posteriormente emprendió su negocio de vender sus propios diseños, compartiendo el taller con su madre. Sus principales clientes son propietarios de almacenes a quienes les confecciona ropa para damas, vestidos y conjuntos infantiles, con los más delicados bordados que, según ella,  solo su madre sabe hacer. Su infraestructura consta de 4 maquinarias y en las temporadas altas trabaja su hermana y empleadas a quienes les paga por producción.
Maribel es una persona organizada y muy responsable que logró formalizar su negocio, mediante la asesoria de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en convenio con la Cámara de Comercio de Barranquilla y está siempre abierta al aprendizaje,  por eso participa en los proceso de capacitación administrativa de esta misma organización, a través de la cual ha recibido seis financiamientos que le han permitido aumentar sus utilidades y generar empleo en su propia familia, también ha logrado mejorar su calidad de  vida y establecer su historial crediticio. Con su credickiva comprará tela e insumos, especial para producir vestidos femeninos para damas e infantil bien elegantes,  pues se avecinan las fiestas de fin de año y debe prepararse para este acontecimiento comercial.
Maribel sueña con trasladarse de barrio, pues como queda cerca al mar los terrenos se tornan muy húmedos y cuando llueven torrenciales aguaceros, se imposibilita el paso.
Su mayor desafío es la humedad del sector, que hace que constantemente deba realizar mantenimiento preventivo a su maquinaria, por eso para cumplir su sueño, de cambiar de vivienda, trabaja persistentemente   .
texts.en:
Maribel S. is a seamstress that started her business with the example provided by her mother as her initial teacher and her same nature, which gradually led her to becoming a seamstress; this is why without finishing high school she started taking technical courses until she was able to work at SENA (National Learning Service), where she perfected her art and learned about design and patterns as her main base. Afterwards she moved into women's garments, when she started to work in the town of Barranquilla and afterwards started her business of selling her own designs, sharing the workshop with her mother. Her main customers are the owners of department stores to whom she makes clothing for women, dresses and children's clothing, with the most delicate knittings that according to her only her mother knows how to do. Their shop consists of 4 machines and in the high season her sister and other employees work for her and she pays for their work. 

Maribel is a very organized and responsible person that managed to build her business with the guidance of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in conjunction with the Barranquilla chamber of commerce. She is always open to learning, and this is why she participates in the management training of this same organization, through which she has received six loans that have allowed her to increase her profits and generate jobs for her own family. She also managed to improve her quality of life and establish a credit history. With this credit she will buy cloth and raw material necessary to make elegant, feminine dresses for women and girls; as the holiday season is approaching she must prepare for this commercial event. Maribel dreams of moving, because she is close to the ocean and the land gets really muddy; whenever there is torrential rain there is no way to use the roads. Her biggest challenge is the humidity of the area, which forces her to give constant preventive maintenance to her machinery. To fulfill her dream of moving, she works persistently.

loans.use: buy cloth and raw material necessary to make elegant, feminine dresses for women and girls

loans.name: Sara Petrona

texts.es: La señora Sara tiene 35 años, tiene tres hijos menores de edad, su actividad es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Inicio este negocio hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio pues ella ha logrado con mucho sacrificio salir adelante, pues su actividad económica es muy difícil de mantener. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima y ofrecer una gran variedad de productos. Ella sueña con establecer otro negocio en donde sus hijos más adelante puedan hacerse administrarlo como lo ha hecho ella.
texts.en: Ms. Sara is 35 years old, she has three young children, and her main activity is a retail store located in her home. She started this business 4 years ago, and she is always looking for a way to increase her revenue. It hasn't been easy to maintain this business and she has managed to succeed with a lot of sacrifice, since her economic activity is hard to maintain. This loan is to buy raw material to offer a greater variety of products. She dreams with establishing another business where her children can later take care of and manage as she has done.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is part of the communal bank “21 de Mayo – El Roble” and resides in the city of Lota. Pedro has a stand located in the main streets of Lota, where he sells delightful sweets and children's crossword puzzle and word search books. Pedro's business sits in a commercial district area and is quite far from his home. Pedro's stand has no roof, so Pedro uses an umbrella to protect it from the sun and cover for the rain. Pedro has worked this stand for the past 15 years, but has worked in this type of business for the past 25 years.

Pedro started selling items in the street fairs and little by little he started working towards establishing the stand he holds today from Monday to Saturday. For many years, Pedro’s wife has also run a stand, but of fruits and vegetables, in the street market.

With this loan Pedro will purchase merchandise, a new and larger umbrella and will send his stand-booth to get repaired. Pedro is a father of three; the two oldest sons are professionals and no longer reside with him. Pedro’s youngest son just graduated from high school and is 18 years old; he still resides with Pedro and is looking for work to continue his studies. Pedro’s goal is to support his son through his studies as he did with his older sons, thanks to his business and wife. 

The entrepreneurial training offered by Kiva Partner Fondo Esperanza has been very helpful to Pedro, as he has improved his money management skills. Pedro is also grateful for his loan officer and the companionship of his other fellow group members. 

In Mapudungun (the language of the indigenous Mapuche population), Lota means "Humble Village".  It is a coastal community located near to the city of Concepción in the southern region of Bíobío. Lote is known for its large coal deposits, which were very important in the history and development of Chile. Chilean writer Baldomero Lillo memorializes Lota and the difficult living conditions of its coal miners in his book Subterra (Underground).

loans.use: To buy merchandise and items to fix Kiosk Stand.

loans.name: Seny

texts.fr: Madame Seny  M. Habite dans le village de Yoff. Elle a 46 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère  de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 16 et22 ans. Suite aux conseils de ses amies elle a pu choisir l’activité de commerce qui lui plait beaucoup. Ainsi depuis 2004 elle pratique la vente de tissus et de produits cosmétiques. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2007. Elle a déjà  remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle emprunte 200 000 frs  pour préparer  un voyage en Mauritanie dans le but d’acheter des produits qu’elle envisage  commercialiser. Elle souhaite développer son commerce  et disposer d’un grand magasin de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en: Mrs. Seny  M. lives in the village of Yoff.  She is 46 years old.  She is divorced and is the mother of 4 children aged between 16 and 22.  On advice from her friends, she started a business that she enjoys very much.  Since 2004, she has been selling fabrics and cosmetics.  She has been a member of the Yoff village bank since June 2007.  She has already reimbursed two previous loans.  She is requesting a loan for 200,000 francs to travel to Mauritania in order to buy products to sell.  She wants to build her business and have a large cosmetics store.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, tiene 29 años, es una mujer luchadora y ambiciosa, vive en su casa propia junto a  su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el pueblo de Llanco. Cada mañana se levanta temprano para poder vender la arveja que siembra en el mercado central de su ciudad. Hace ya 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, pues así podrá vender mucho más. En su localidad no existen muchos agricultores que venden al menudeo, es por ello que Susana está juntando capital para comprar su propio terreno y sembrar mayor variedad de verduras. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas, abono y fertilizantes para la arveja que cultivará.
texts.en: Susana is 29 years old, a fighter and very ambitious woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and 3 children in the town of Llanco. Every morning she wakes up early to be able to sell her crops of peas in the central market of her town. For 10 years she has devoted herself to agriculture and what she likes most about her job is to reap what she sows, since she will be able to sell much more. In her community there are not a lot of farmers that sell retail, and this is why Susana is putting together the capital to buy her own land and to sell a larger variety of vegetables. This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to belong to the communal bank. With the loan she is requesting she will purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers for the peas she will plant.

loans.use: purchase pea seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Flor Edilma

texts.es:
Flor Edilma V. tiene 32 años y vive en el barrio Plaza de las Américas, de la capital de Colombia: Bogotá; allí tiene un taller de fabricación de bolsos y correas y también comercializa  prendas de vestir, que combina hermosamente con su trabajo manual de bisuteria. Su experiencia data de hace 10 años, cuando inició su actividad artesanal como parte de un deleite personal que hoy ha agregado innovaciones y es su principal fuente de ingreso y también su empleo.
Su credikiva es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y con el planea hacer mejoras a su local y comprar materia prima para fabricar  bolsos y comprar prendas de vestir que armonicen la imagen de la mujer especialmente. Con este financiamiento adicionará un capital de trabajo nuevo a su negocio, que gradualmente se está ampliando y no tiene una forma oportuna de responder a sus nuevos clientes, por lo insuficiente que es. 
Flor Edilma sueña con tener sus procesos mas industrializados para combinarlos con el valor agregado que imprimen sus manos al trabajo artesanal que realiza, pues  le da un toque de elegancia y buen vestir a la mujer que le gustan los estilos formales e informales. Su principal desafío ocurre cuando las ventas bajan que son en los meses de Enero a Marzo, pero como para todo Flor tiene la solución,  traslada sus ventas a  poblaciones y municipios cercanos, donde encuentra  clientes para sus productos. Su mayor expectativa familiar al lado de su esposo, es que sus tres pequeños hijos en las edades de 12 a 15 años, estudien y puedan darle la oportunidad de tener éxitos mediante la carrera profesional que ellos mismos escojan.
texts.en:
Flor Edilma V., age 32, lives in the Plaza de las Américas, neighborhood in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia.  That is where she has a shop making bags and straps.  She also sells clothing.  This goes beautifully with her jewelry making.  She has ten years of experience.  She started her handicraft activity for personal enjoyment.  She has now added innovations, and it is her primary source of income and employment.

Her Kiva loan is her first loan with the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to use the loan to make improvements to her place.  She will also buy raw material for making bags, and she will especially buy garments that go well with a woman’s appearance.

With this loan she will have additional working capital for her business, which is gradually expanding.  She does not have an timely way of responding to her new customers because of her insufficient working capital.

Flor Edilma dreams of having a more industrialized process to combine with the valuable work she does by hand.  This gives an elegant touch as well as good garments to women who like formal and informal styles.

Her main challenge occurs when sales are down, which happens in the months from January to March.  But, as with everything, Flor has a solution.  She takes her sales to nearby towns and municipalities where she comes across customers for her products.  

Her greatest family expectations, along with her husband, is for their three children, ages 12-15, go to school.  They want to give them the opportunity to be successful with a professional career that they themselves choose.

loans.use: Make improvements to her place, and buy raw material for making bags, and she will especially buy garments that go well with a woman’s appearance

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos es un joven emprendedor de 26 años, como buen hijo cuida de sus padres en una casa alquila en el pueblo de Llanco. Cuenta que desde hace 8 años, trabaja sembrando gladiolos, papa, choclo y arveja; en un pequeño terreno que alquilaron sus padres desde que él era niño, pero ahora Marcos los ayuda con mayor dedicación y esfuerzo, pues ya es joven y tiene mayores ambiciones y expectativas, menciona que desea construir su casa propia y abrir una tienda de fertilizantes en sus ciudad. Le gusta mucho estar en el campo y sembrar, “es cómodo”, asegura. Por ello en estos meses sembrará papa, ya que es la temporada donde tiene mayor demanda. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, agradece mucho el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la comprará de semillas, abono y mano de obra para la papa que cultivara.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 26, is a young entrepreneur.  As a good son, he takes care of his parents in a rented house in the town of Llanco.  For eight years he has been growing gladiolas, potatoes, corn, and peas on a small piece of land that his parents have rented sine he was a boy.

However, Marcos now helps them with more dedication and effort.  He does this because he is young and has greater ambitions and expectations.  He says that he wishes to build his own house and open a fertilizer store in his city.

He really likes to be in the field and plant.  “It is comfortable”, he says.  In these months he will plant potatoes because it is the season when they are in great demand.

This is his third loan with MFP.  He is very grateful for the support of his communal bank.  He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay for the labor for his crop of potatoes.

loans.use: To buy seeds for potatoes and fertilizer

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Madame Adama S. est âgée  de 26 ans. Elle habite A Yoff. Elle est mariée sans enfant. Entre 1997 et 2000 elle a fait une formation en couture. Pour pouvoir satisfaire ses besoins elle a choisi par la suite l’activité de commerce et s’est orienté vers les produits cosmétiques. C’est surtout l’aspect lucratif de l’activité qui l’intéresse  le plus. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis septembre 2005. Elle a déjà  remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs en vue de renforcer son fond de roulement. Le montant du prêt servira a l’achat de produits cosmétiques, d’habits et de chaussures pour femmes destines a la vente. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer sa situation sociale.
texts.en: Mrs. Adama S. is 26 years old.  She lives in Yoff.  She is married, but has no children.  Between 1997 and 2000, she trained as a seamstress.  In order to meet her needs, she then started a business selling cosmetics.  She finds this business very profitable.  She has been a member of the Yoff village bank since 2005.  She has already repaid 3 previous loans.  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 frands to increase her working capital.  The loan will serve to buy cosmetics, suits and shoes for women.  Increasing her income will improve her social standing.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Santiago Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastián tiene 34 años, su actividad económica es la venta de artículos de ferretería hace mas de 16 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio por su Mama pues él había observado que ella anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio. Así fue como él decide hacerse cargo del negocio, pues le gusta mucho interactuar con sus clientes por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona muy capaz y responsable. Este financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de clavos, martillos entre otras cosas que son necesarias y que sus clientes llegan a comprar a menudo. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día.
texts.en:
Sebastián, age 34, sells hardware.  He has been in the business for over 16 years.  He watched his mother when she was previously in the business.

That is how he decided to take charge of the business.  He really likes interacting with his customers.  He has shown himself to be a very capable and responsible person.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy nails and hammers, among other things needed by his customers who frequently shop at his business.  He dreams of improving his income every day.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 32 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el pueblo de Llanco. Trabaja sembrando arveja, papa y flores, en un terreno alquilado; ya son 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura y está muy contento con su trabajo, ya que viaja constantemente a la capital para vender las verduras que siembra durante el año; en estos meses sembrará flores y papa ya que es la temporada donde tiene mayor demanda, “se invierte poco y se gana mucho”, afirma. Jorge esta juntando dinero para poder comprar su propio terreno y tener mayores ganancias, de esa manera podrá adquirir una pequeña casa para su familia. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y está feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal donde puede compartir experiencias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Jorge is 32 years old, and he lives with his wife and three children in a rented house in the town of Llanco. He grows peas, potatoes, and flowers on a piece of rented land. He has been working in agriculture for five years, and he likes his job because he gets to travel constantly to the capital to sell the produce that he grows throughout the year. In the coming months he will plant flowers and potato because this is the season that they are in demand. "If you invest a little you make a lot," he says. Jorge is saving money to purchase his own land and thus earn more profit. With more profits he could buy a small house for his family. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he is happy to belong to a community bank because he con share his experiences. He will use the loan money to buy seeds and fertilizer for his next planting.

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sofia Jiatz

texts.es:
Sofia Jiatz M. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de tela variada como blusas típicas de tela, cortinas, playeras, blusas en diferentes tallas y colores.  Vende en el mercado de San Pedro  Sacatepéquez,   Desde hace varios años, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo la cual también confecciona ropa variada.  Tiene dos hijos ya mayores pero aun solteros que están con ella en casa.  Ella ve que  ya se aproxima la buena fecha para las ventas y obtener buenas ganancias que son en los últimos meses del año, pero la inversión debe hacerse con tiempo, para ella poder tener en su negocio lo que el cliente pide.  Su meta es seguir creciendo y llegar a tener un puesto más grande en el mercado para seguir luchando por la vida y tener lo necesario.
texts.en: Sofia Jiatz M. works selling clothing of a variety of fabrics. She makes blouses, curtains, and shirts in different sizes and colors. She sells her clothing in the market of San Peddro Sacatepéquez. For several years now her husband has worked alongside her sewing a variety of clothing. She has two adult sons, who are still single and live at home. She recognized that the high volume sales time, which is in the final months of the year, is the time when the most sales and profits can be made. However, the investment has to be made well in advance so that she can have the products that her clients want. Her goal is to continue growing her business, move to a larger market stall, and to continue fighting for her family's necessities.

loans.use: Mercaderias ropa

loans.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es: Harold Enrique S. es un  buen hombre de 50 años casado y con dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 16 años, que vive en la Ciudadela Metropolitana, proyecto de vivienda gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Cuenta Harold que una vez desesperado por no tener trabajo  y con la obligación familiar decidió emprender un negocio que le permitiera generar ingresos. Así fue como nació “Fresca Leche, queso y algo más” donde mediante un rutero distribuye productos lácteos como leche, queso, yogurt gelatina, queso  y ahora está incursionando con la mantequilla como su nuevo producto. El inició con tres cajas de cada producto, luego adicionó 5 y ahora maneja 27 a 30 cajas diarias, Se enteró de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante un compañero cuya esposa es clienta asidua de esta organización y hoy lleva 2 financiamientos. Con su credikiva comprará cajas de leche, yogurt y un nuevo producto que quiere impulsar: la mantequilla con ello espera continuar incrementando sus ventas y tener un capital adicional que rote rápidamente. Su sueño es continuar ensanchándose para que sus hijos tengan un futuro promisorio con su negocio multiplicado y próspero y con mucha salud.
texts.en:
Harold Enrique S., age 50, is a good man.  He is married, and he has two children, ages 13 and 16.  He lives in the Ciudadela Metropolitana, which is a housing project managed by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Harold says that at one time he was desperate because he did not have work, and he had family obligations.  He decided to undertake a business that would allow him to generate income.  That is how “Fresca Leche, Queso, y Algo Más” (Fresh Milk, Cheese, And More) was born.  

He sells and distributes dairy products like milk, cheese, yogurt, and gelatin.  He is now producing butter as his new product.  He started with three crates of each product.  Then he added five more.  Now he manages 27 to 30 crates a day.

He found out about the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through a friend whose wife is a regular client of this organization.  He now has two loans.

With his loan from Kiva he will buy crates of milk, yogurt, and a new product that he wants to promote, butter.  With butter he hopes to continue increasing his sales.  He also hopes to have additional capital to quickly turn over.  

His dream is to continue expanding so that his children will have a promising future with a growing and prosperous business and good health.

loans.use: To buy crates of milk, yogurt, and a new product that he wants to promote, butter

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano de 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Llanco. Desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, le gustaba ver como crecían y maduraban. Su experiencia de 20 años en la agricultura le ayudó a conseguir muchas cosas como su casa en la que hoy vive muy feliz; actualmente se dedica a la siembra de papa y arveja en un terreno que alquila en el pueblo de Jachapata, donde pasa la mayor parte del día ya que tiene que cuidar su cosecha de las plaga de insectos que en este tiempo están asolando su siembra. Viviano se propuso una meta para este año, juntar capital para poder comprar su propio terreno en Llanco y estar más tiempo con su familia. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y esta muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará remedios para la plaga de insectos, asimismo desea comprar abono para que su cosecha sea la mejor.
texts.en:
Viviano is 38 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their 2 daughters.  They live in the town of Llanco.  At a very young age his parents taught him to farm the land and he liked to see how things grew and matured.  His 20 years of experience in agriculture have helped him to obtain many things, like his house that he very happily lives in today.  Currently, he is growing potatoes and peas on a plot of land that he rents in the town of Jachapata.  This is where he spends most of his day since he has to care for his crops in order to protect them from the insects that threaten to destroy them.  

Viviano's goal for this year is to raise enough capital to be able to buy his own land in Llanco so that he can be closer to his family.  This is his seventh loan with MFP and he is very happy to belong to his communal bank.  With the two thousand soles (Peruvian currency) that he is requesting, he will buy remedies to combat the insects and also fertilizer so that he will have a better harvest.

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer and remedies to combat insects

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar N.  est un homme de 37 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il évolue depuis plus de 22 ans dans le métier de chauffeur. Mais parallèlement  il exerce le petit commerce  et vend des fruits. Il a choisi cette activité  par passion. Il espère   satisfaire ses besoins à travers cette activité de commerce. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis avril 2008. Il sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 frs pour aller s’approvisionner en   mangues et en pastèques  a sangalkam  une des communautés  rurales de Dakar. Son souhait est d’accroitre ses revenus et améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille...Il envisage aussi de renforcer son épargne  et acquérir  un taxi.
texts.en: Mr. Matar N. is a 37 year old man who lives in the village of Yoff.  He is single and has no children.  He has spent the last 22 years working as a driver.  He also has a small business selling fruits.  He has chosen this business because he is passionate about it.  He hopes to meet his needs with this business.  Mr. N. has been a member of the Yoff village bank since April 2008. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 francs to buy mangoes and watermelons in Sangalkam, one of the rural communities of Dakar.  He hopes to increase his income and improve the social situation of his family.  He is also hoping to save enough money to buy a taxi.

loans.use: augmentation fond de roulement

loans.name: Solecitos De Nopalillo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Solecitos de Nopalillo” ya que en la región, el principal cultivo es nopal y tuna y, solecitos, porque en el amanecer se refleja el nacimiento de un nuevo día y la esperanza de una nueva cosecha. 
La foto fué tomada en la casa de la Sra. Patricia López V., integrante  del grupo el cual está ubicado en Hidalgo y vemos hacia atrás parte de la comunidad. Patricia se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo desde hace dos años, tiene 42 años de edad, estudio la primaria y es casada con tres hijos.
Solicita su préstamo para la compra de zapato, y se siente alegre al momento de solicitar su préstamo pues así podrá tener una gama más amplia de modelos y adquirir nuevos catálogos, espera algún día tener su propio local y ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
Las otras integrantes son:
Nicolasa Hernández C.	Venta de chalupas
Lina Castelán H.	Venta de artesanías
Carmelita A. A.	Venta de  Fuller
Ofelia León V.	        Venta de bisutería
Ángela López V.	        Venta de calzado
Patricia López V. 	Venta de calzado
Yesenia M. L.	        Venta de chalupas
Amada V. C.	        Venta de tamales
A. C. G.	Venta de Stamhome
Miriam López M.  	Venta de calzado
Erika A. H. 	Venta de calzado
Silvia H. V. 	Venta de dulces
texts.en:
This group is called “Solecitos de Nopalillo” (Little Cactus Suns) because the main crop in the region is cactus and prickly pears and “solecitos” because every dawn means new hope for a good harvest.

The photo was taken at Mrs. Patricia López V’s house, a group member, located in Hidalgo; we can see part of the community in the rear of the photo.  Patricia has sold catalogue shoes for the past two years.  She is 42 years old, finished elementary school, is married and has three children.

She is asking for funds to buy shoes.  At the moment of requesting the loan she is happy because she will be able to acquire a wide variety of styles and new catalogues.  She hopes someday to have her own store and offer a better standard of living for her family.

The other group members are:

Nicolasa Hernández C.		Chalupa (typical snack in central México) sales
Lina Castelán H.		Crafts Sales
Carmelita A. A.		Fuller brand cosmetics sales
Ofelia León V.			Costume Jewelry sales
Ángela López V.	        		Shoe sales
Patricia López V. 		Shoe sales
Yesenia M. L.	        		Chalupa (typical snack in central Mexico) sales
Amada V. C.	        		Tamales sales
A. C. G.		Stanhome brand catalogue sales
Miriam López M.  		Shoe sales
Erika A. H. 		Shoe sales
Silvia H. V. 		Candy sales

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Kriscia Maria

texts.es:
Kriscia de 26 años reside en el departamento de Usulután, con su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante de accesorios de computadoras y ella tiene un comedor y pupuseria, estas son las fuentes de ingreso con las que cuentan para el sostenimiento del hogar.
El negocio de Kriscia inicia con ayuda de su esposo y de su madre quien también posee un comedor, el local del negocio es alquilado y cuenta con una empleada trabajando en un horario de siete de la mañana a seis de la noche, Ella quiere invertir en mercadería que le es necesaria para la preparación de sus alimentos,  pero no cuenta con los fondos para hacer posible esta inversión.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como carnes, condimentos, maíz, bebidas que son parte de los platillos que a diario degustan sus clientes. Todo esto con la intención de brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y contar con su preferencia, aumentando posiblemente su número y mejorando sus ingresos; pero como todo negocio este también lleva sus riesgos y es el que los alimentos suban su precio viéndose en la necesidad de aumentar el valor por cada platillo.
Entre las aspiraciones de Kriscia están realizar una buena inversión con el préstamo, que dicha inversión le permita crecer en clientes, demanda y en ingresos o ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Kriscia, 26, lives in Usulután department with her husband and two children who are 8 and 6 years of age.  Her husband sells computer accessories and she has an eatery and pupusa (typical Salvadoran snack) stand.  These are the sources of income they can count on to support their family.

Kriscia’s business started with help from her husband and her mother who also has an eatery.  The space for her business is rented and she has an employee that works from 7am until 6pm.  She wants to invest in merchandise that’s necessary to prepare the food but she lacks funds to do so.

She is asking for a loan to buy such items as: meats, spices, corn and beverages that are part of the dishes her customers enjoy daily.  All of this with the goal in mind to provide good customer service in order to keep them preferring her above others, possibly increasing their number and improving her income.  Like every business, this one has its risks too.  For instance, food prices can rise and she might need to increase the price of each dish.

Among Kriscia’s aspirations is to invest her loan well, that it will allow her to increase her customer base, demand and income or profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food preparation supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Llanco. Hace ya 8 años que alquila un pequeño terreno en el pueblo de Shiusha, donde siembra papa y arveja; sin embargo su mayor deseo es comprar su propio terreno para poder tener mayor capital e invertir en la compra de más semillas; por ello en los últimos años esta ahorrando para alcanzar su objetivo, por lo que esta por alcanzar su objetivo. Norma está sembrando mayor cantidad de arveja y espera que en esta oportunidad pueda obtener mayor ganancia, ya que en estos meses hay mucha demanda. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta feliz de trabajar en un banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y abono para la cosecha de arveja que esta cultivando.
texts.en:
Norma is 30 years old and lives with her husband and four children is her own house located in the town of Llanco. She has been renting a small piece of land in the town of Shiusha for eight years where she grows potatoes and peas. However, her greatest wish is to buy her own land to be able to have more capital and invest in the purchase of more seeds. She has been saving over the past few years to be able to achieve her goal and she is almost there. Norma is planting a greater quantity of peas and hopes that she can obtain a higher income because there is a lot of demand in these months.

This is Norma’s first loan with MFP and she is happy to work in a communal bank. With the loan requested, she will purchase seeds and manure for the peas that she is growing.

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds and manure.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan, de 20 años, es un ejemplar hijo, que lucha ante las adversidades sin miedo, ya que ayuda a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. Su fuerza y vitalidad le permite dedicarse a varias actividades; en las mañanas trabaja como peón en una fabrica de su localidad y por las tardes se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes, pero la actividad que más le agrada a Jonathan es la agricultura, donde siembra arveja y papa en el terreno de sus padres, hace ya 5 años. Las ganancias obtenidas en la venta de las arvejas le permitieron abastecer su tienda con mas productos, ahora Jonathan esta juntando capital para poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes en el pueblo de Huasahuasi. En estos meses sembrará papa y con las ganancias que obtenga, completará el capital que le falta. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido por todo el apoyo que le brinda su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas y abono para la papa que cultivará.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 20 years old and is an exemplary son who fights fearlessly through adversity since he helps his parents with the household expenses. His effort and vitality allow him to work in several areas – he works at a factory in the area in the morning and works at his grocery store in the afternoon.

However, the work that Jonathan likes most is farming and he has been growing peas and potatoes on his parents’ land for the past five years. His earnings from pea sales allow him to stock his store with more items and he is now saving money to be able to open a grocery store in the town of Huasahuasi. In the months to come, he will grow potatoes and with the money earned, he will have enough to do so.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is very appreciative of all of the support provided by his communal bank. With the loan requested, he will purchase seeds and manure for the potatoes that he will grow.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Leyder Maria

texts.es:
Leyder Fernández Ramírez tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus dos hijos, con los que sueña ver en un futuro exitoso y como grandes profesionales, por eso se esfuerza diariamente en su negocio de vender mercancía variada, para poder lograrlo, pues es una mujer jefe de su hogar con una gran responsabilidad.

Leyder inició su actividad comercial vendiendo mercancías, como ropa y calzado entre sus vecinos y amigos, gradualmente fue creciendo y encontró la forma de ganarse la vida como empleada de una empresa, relaciones que le han facilitado ensancharlo, porque ha logrado en este medio conseguir un mayor numero de clientes. 

Durante los tres años que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y acceder al servicio de asesoria empresarial, que le ha servido para mirar su negocio como una empresa. Con su credikiva que es el segundo financiamiento recibido de esta organización, comprará calzado, vestidos para damas y para niños, aprovechando que se acercan las navidades y con ellos sus clientes que son empleados, reciben  las primas y bonificaciones, por eso desde ya le han encargado que los vista elegantemente como siempre lo hace.
texts.en:
Leyder Fernández Ramírez is 31 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her two children, who she dreams of one day seeing as great professionals with successful futures.  In order to achieve this, she strives daily in her business of selling various merchandise.  She is a woman with great responsibilities as the head of her household.

Leyder started her business with selling clothing and shoes among her neighbors and friends.  Gradually, her business was growing and she found a way to earn a living as an employee of a company.  Her relationships there have allowed her to expand her business because she has earned many new customers there.

During the three years she has worked with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she has succeeded in increasing her working capital.  She has also participated in the business advisory services, which have helped her to look at her business as a company.  She will use this loan, the second she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy shoes, as well as dresses for women and children. She will take advantage of the fact that Christmas is approaching, which means that her clients, who are workers, will be receiving bonuses and allowances.  They have charged her with making sure that they look elegant, which she has always done.

loans.use: to buy shoes, women's dresses, and children's dresses

loans.name: Fatima Lizeth

texts.es: Fatima Lizeth tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ella busca la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar, siempre sale a todos los días ella utiliza una chaqueta para protegerse del sol, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes viven en zonas muy lejanas. A pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa como es el abono de las cuotas de los productos que le ofrecen. Este financiamiento es para la compra de lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, polvos, tratamientos y cremas. Sueña con agrandar su negocio, para proporcionarles a sus 3 hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Fatima Lizeth is 33 years old and has been selling cosmetics for more than three years in order to generate income for her household. Every day she heads out with a jacket to protect herself from the sun since most of her customers live in areas that are far away. One of the difficulties she faces is being paid in installments for the products she offers.

This loan will be used to buy lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, treatments, and crèmes. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can provide for the needs of her three children.

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, treatments, and crèmes

loans.name: Las Leonas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las leonas. El nombre del grupo se debe a que la persona que formo el grupo lleva el apellido León. Está ubicado en Puebla, México.  El grupo está conformado por 8  integrantes.
María P. L. T.   Es la tesorera del grupo. Tiene 45 años, estudió hasta el bachillerato, es casada tiene en total 3 hijos  (dos varones y una mujer).  Ella se dedica a atender una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que inició hace veinte años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercancía, con la finalidad de poder surtir más su negocio para que sus clientes encuentren los productos  que buscan. Sus clientes consideran que es una persona amable y de muy bonito carácter para atenderlas. La  Sra. María P. L. T. se siente respaldada, por que con este préstamo podrá tener productos mas variados ya que la comunidad se encuentra en zona rural y a los habitantes se les complica conseguir de manera inmediata sus víveres. Ella espera que a través de su negocio pueda seguir solventando los gastos de su familia.
 Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Adriana M. T.		Venta de blancos (colchas, sabanas, cortinas)
Carolina M. C. 		Venta de ropa
Gabriela M. C.		Venta de calzado
Velma O. A. V.		Venta de calzado
Romualda B. A. V.	Tortillas
Fabiola M. S. C.	Venta de blancos
Estela D. A. V.		Venta de comida
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Leonas” because the person who started it has the last name of León. The group meets in Puebla, Mexico, and consists of eight members. María P.L.T. is the group treasurer. She is 45 years old, studied through high school, and is married with three children (two sons and a daughter). María manages a grocery store, a business she started twenty years ago. She is requesting a loan to acquire merchandise in order to stock her business with more of the products that her customers want to buy. They consider María to be a friendly person who displays the nicest personality when attending to them. Sra. María feels she has been supported because this loan will help her provide a wider variety of products to her rural community, thereby giving the residents immediate access to necessities. Through her business, she hopes to continue providing for her family’s expenses.

The other group members are as follows: Adriana M.T. sells linens (bedspreads, sheets, and curtains) Carolina M.C. sells clothing Gabriela M.C. sells shoes Velma O.A.V. sells shoes Romualda B.A.V. sells tortillas Fabiola M.S.C. sells linens Estela D.A.V. sells food

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Evelyn Antonia

texts.es:
Evelyn es empleada, tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y actualmente no tienen hijos, él es empleado y residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel; Ella trabaja desde hace 3 años en una empresa de envió y recepción de encomiendas a varios países, desempeñando el cargo de cajera con un horario de 8:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde.
Evelyn está solicitando un préstamo para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, pues cuenta con varios problemas en sus paredes, ella desea invertir y mejorar las condiciones de su casa para estar más tranquila y con menos riesgo.
Sus proyecciones son mantener su trabajo por mucho tiempo, ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos para ir solventando las deudas y mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 24 years old and employed.  She lives with her husband and they currently do not have any children.  He is also employed and they reside in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel.  Evelyn has worked three years as a cashier for a company that ships and receives packages from other countries.  Her work schedule is between the hours of 8am and 4pm.  

She is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to her home since there are several problems with the walls of her house.  Evelyn wants to invest in and improve the conditions of her house so that life will be more peaceful and with less risk.  Her plans include staying at her job for a long time, helping her husband with the income so that they can pay their debts, and making improvements to her home.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Olo

texts.es: Olo, de 48 años, está casado con Rosa de 31 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos Jetson de 18 y Sheyla de 16 años, viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Pomachaca. Su vida se centra en invertir y progresar, como esposos, amigos y socios, Olo y Rosa trabajan juntos para poder progresar; “mi esposa tiene una librería en casa y las ganancias lo invertimos en comida y gastos de nuestros hijos”, menciona. Olo tiene una ferretería y un taller donde fabrica estructuras metálicas; de la misma manera tiene un terreno de 6 hectáreas donde siembra papa, con la ayuda de su familia, los fines de semana. Sin embargo, Olo, desea seguir invirtiendo, ya que su plan es poner una empresa de servicios generales, para poder trabajar con las principales empresas privadas y estatales del país; ya dio su primer paso y abasteció repuestos para los carros del Seguro Social del País. Lo que más le gusta a él, es invertir y prosperar y agradece a Dios por ello. Es el octavo crédito con MFP y se está contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, por que le divierte y ayuda a progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una moledora para la empresa que desea poner.
texts.en:
Olo is 48 years old and married to Rosa, who is 31.  They have 2 children, Jetson who is 18 and Sheyla, 16.  They live in their own home in Pomachaca.  His life is centered on investing and progressing as spouses, friends and partners.  Olo and Rosa work together in order to succeed.  “My wife has a bookstore in our house, and we invest the income into food and child-related expenses,” he states.

Olo has a hardware store and a workshop where he fabricates metal structures.  Concurrently, he has 6 hectares of land where he plants potatoes on weekends with his family’s help.  Regardless, Olo would like to still continue investing in his endeavors, as his plan is to start an enterprise providing general services.  He would like to work with the country’s major private and government companies.  He has already taken the first step, and supplied replacement car parts for the country’s Social Health Agency.  

What he enjoys the most is investing and prospering, and he gives thanks to God for this.  This is his eighth credit with MFP, and he is glad to belong to a cooperative bank because it is enjoyable and helps him get ahead.  He will use the loan he is requesting to purchase a grinder for the business he would like to start.

loans.use: To purchase a grinder for the business he would like to start.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn C. is a single woman who lives in Gingaw, Central Tabao Zone 4, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Analyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Analyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store, so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Analyn C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Juana es casada, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, Juana tiene una tienda en su pueblo de Atacocha, Distrito de Santiago de Pischa, en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, carnes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, Juana además compra tara, cochinilla y cereales.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de gaseosas, cervezas y golosinas.
Los sueños de Juana son construir su casa de material noble en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. She is married and has eight children, of whom five are in school. Juana has a store located in the town of Atacocha in the District of Santiago de Pischa where she sells vegetables, groceries, and meat. She manages her business with the help of her husband. In addition, Juana sells tara (a plant used in making dye), cochineal (an insect that produces red dye), and grain.

Juana needs a loan of 2000 PEN in order to buy sodas, beer, and candy. She dreams of building a house of solid materials in the city of Ayacucho and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase sodas, beer, and candy

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario O. is a 54 year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  general store, frozen foods, and e-load. She lives in Sitio. Estaca, Brgy. Lantad, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her various businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Rosario is now borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she can buy more stock to sell in her general store. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosario aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años, Gladis tiene cabinas de Internet en la casa de su mama, tiene 10 cabinas, también tiene un locutorio, vende golosinas y realiza recargas telefónicas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy y solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para la compra de maquinas y el mantenimiento.
Los sueños de Gladis son construir su casa y asegurar el futuro de su hijo
texts.en:
Gladis is in a common law marriage and has a two year old child. She has ten Internet booths that she manages at her mother’s house. Gladis also operates a call center where she sells candy and mobile phone recharges. She manages her businesses every day.

Gladis is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank and is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN to buy machines and pay for maintenance. Her dreams are to build a house and secure her child’s future.

loans.use: Purchase machines and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth J. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Bungol, Brgy. Balaring, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  fishing, dried fish vending, and pig fattening. Her husband Virgilio J. Jr, who is 55 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 27 to 33 years old.

Elizabeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elizabeth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase bamboo and nets for her fishing business, so that she can continue improve her family's living conditions. Elizabeth J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rodecinda

texts.es:
Rodecinda es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Rodecinda es casada y tiene 10 hijos y solo uno estudia, Rodecinda se dedica a la compra D. cochinilla, tara, actividad que realiza todos los días en el mercado Magdalena en donD. compra los productos, después D. acopiar los lleva a la ciudad D. Lima con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Rodecinda necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles para la compra D. cochinilla.
Los sueños D. Rodecinda son construir su casa D. material noble en el Distrito D. Huamanguilla.
texts.en:
Rodecinda is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. She is married and has ten children, but only one of them is still in school. Rodecinda buys cochineal and tara (natural sources of dye). She engages in her business every day at the Magdalena Market where she buys her products. Afterwards, she carries her products to the city of Lima with the help of her husband.

Rodecinda needs a loan of 3000 PEN to buy cochineal. Her dreams incluD. building a house of solid materials in the District of Huamanguilla.

loans.use: Purchase cochineal

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Isabel es casada, tiene 2 hijos, Isabel viaja todos los días a diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. ropa variada y D. las ferias compra cereales, animales menores, quesos que son comercializados en el mercado.
Isabel necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. faldas y casacas.
Los sueños D. Isabel son construir una casa para su ultima hija y su educación.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. She is married and has two children. Ysabel travels every day to the different regional fairs to sell different types of clothing. While at the fairs she buys grain, small animals, and cheeses to sell at the market.

Ysabel needs a loan of 3000 PEN to invest in the purchase of skirts and jackets. Her dreams are to build a house for her youngest daughter and proviD. her with an education.

loans.use: Purchase skirts & jackets

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr: Madame Diatou Gringue  est une yoffoise  qui est mariée et mère  de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 12 et 24 ans. Elle est vendeuse de poissons depuis plus de 20 ans.  Elle a hérité cette activité de sa mère qui depuis qu’elle avait 15 ans avait commencé à l’initier. Actuellement son activité consiste à s’approvisionner  en poissons  au marché au marché central de Pikine. Le matin  elle place ses produits auprès de ses  clients et le soir elle passe pour encaisser son argent. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis février 2007.Elle a déjà  remboursé 5 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu  pour renforcer son fond de roulement qui est destiné à l’achat de poissons. Actuellement on traverse une période ou le poisson se fait rare et ou  les prix montent. Ce financement pourra l’aider à accroitre ses revenus et a améliorer  la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Diatou Gringue  comes from Yoff and is married and the mother of seven children who range in age from 12 to 24. She has been selling fish for more than 20 years. She inherited this business from her mother who began it at the age of 15. Presently she stocks up on fish at the central market in Pikine. Each morning she places her fish with retailers, and in the evening she comes to collect the money. She has been a member of the Yoff branch since February 2007. She has already reimbursed five preceding loans. 

She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to bolster her working capital used to buy fish. At the present time, there is not much fish available and the price is climbing. This loan will help her increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita M. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Overflow, Brgy. Hilamonan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, food vending and pig fattening businesses. Her husband, Manuel M., who is 55 years old, works as a sand and gravel contractor to earn his living. They have nine children who are 16 to 37 years old: six of them already have their own families and the remaining three work to help support the family. Benita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Benita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 22,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital in her businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and sustainability of her business. Benita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin G. is a 54 year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: general store and meat vending. She lives in Prk. Overflow, Brgy. Hilamonan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and meat vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 25,000.

Jasmin is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jasmin aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es:
Gertrudes es casada y tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Gertrudes viaja a la comunidad de Alpachaca de donde compra quesos y luego lo vende en el mercado de Ayacucho. Además Gertrudes tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su pueblo de Satica, también vende verduras, frutas y quesos. Gertrudes tiene ganado y también elabora quesos.
Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy y solicita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Gertrudes son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is married and has five children who are in school. She travels to the community of Alpachaca where she buys cheeses to sell later at the market in Ayacucho. In addition, Gertrudes has a grocery store in the town of Satica where she sell vegetables, fruits and cheeses. She has cows and makes her own cheeses.

Gertrudes is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank and requests a loan of 1600 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Her dreams are to build a house in the city of Ayacucho and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Berta viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y también vende en la puerta de un colegio en Tambillos donde además vende golosinas. Berta también tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende frutas.
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy y necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de granadilla, manzanas y chirimoya.
Los sueños de Berta son que sus hijos salgan adelante y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Berta is in a common law marriage and has four children who are in school. She travels to the regional fairs to sell fruit. In addition, Berta sells at the door of a school in Tambillos where she also offers candy. She also manages a stand at the April 12th Market where she sells fruits.

Berta is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank and needs a loan of 1200 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of passion fruits, apples, and cherimoyas (also known as “custard apples”). Her dreams include seeing her children get ahead and adding a second floor to her house.

loans.use: Purchase passion fruits, apples, and cherimoyas

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR PAN D. AZUCAR ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sebastiana;   ella tiene 61 años D. edad, es viuda;  La socia se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. adobes, ella tiene un terreno en el cual contrata peones para elaborar los adobes y luego venderlos, ella trabaja al por mayor. La socia también tiene en su casa un pequeño hospedaje familiar, ella alquila cuartos a turistas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la compra D. materiales como son arcilla y paja al por mayor para la elaboración D. adobes.               

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Señor Pan D. Azúcar" communal bank, which is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Sebastiana.  She is a 61 year-old widow.  She makes and sells adobe bricks.  She has a piece of land where she hires workers to make the adobe bricks, and then to sell them.  She works in wholesale.  She also has a small family hostel where she rents rooms to tourists.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale materials, like clay and straw, for making adobe bricks.

Ms. Sebastiana is grateful for and values the loan being offered to her.  She also promises to comply with her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy wholesale materials, like clay and straw, for making adobe bricks

loans.name: Roxana Maria

texts.es: La solicitante Roxana maría R. M. se dedica a la venta de ropa hace un año aproximadamente, vive con su madre ya que es soltera no tiene carga familiar le ayuda  a su madre en los gastos familiares . Solicita el crédito para  comprar mercaderia de media estación , desea tener un puesto de ropa en un centro comercial de Ica, se propone otorgarle el crédito ya que presenta experiencia acrediticia en otras entidades bancarias en la cual está pagando puntualmente y también tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: The borrower Roxana María R. M. has had a business selling clothing for approximately one year. She lives with her mother since she is single and has no family burdens of her own and helps her mother with the family expenses. She is seeking the loan in order to purchase mid-season merchandise. She would like to have a clothing stand at a shopping center in Ica. She is recommended as a loan recipient because she has credit experience already with other banking entities with which she is making payments punctually and also has good personal and work references.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fund operation of business.

loans.name: Marvin Andres

texts.es: Marvin tiene 32 años, el tiene 2 hijas menores de edad, el se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, pues ha demostrado ser una joven responsable que con mucho empeño ha salido adelante pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos.
