Sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de generar ingresos para su hogar, por lo que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable con su familia. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y cosméticos. el es un joven emprendedor, sueña con mejorar su ganancias y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Marvin, 32, has two minor daughters. He has a business selling general merchandise which he has had for more than three years. He has shown himself to be a responsible young man who with much effort is making something of himself, as this is not the first time he obtains financing. He made his start out the necessity of generating income for his household as he has always shown himself to be responsible towards his family. The loan he is seeking is for the purchase of T-shirts, pants, skirts and cosmetics. He is an enterprising young man who dreams of improving his earnings and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Gloria es conviviente, tiene 2 hijo que estudian, Gloria tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde tiene una plastiqueria, en donde vende bolsas, papeles y productos descartables. Además Gloria vende ropa en las ferias de la región.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de descartables.
Los sueños de Gloria son tener una tienda grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. She has a live-in partner and two children who are in school. Gloria has a post in the Playa Grau marketplace where she has a plastics shop where she sells bags, paper and disposable products. In addition Gloria sells clothing at the region's fairs. 

Gloria requires a loan of 2,000 soles in order to buy disposable items. Her dreams are to have a large store and that her children would be professionals.

loans.use: To purchase disposable items

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 9 años que estudia, Berta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy y solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de frutas.
Los sueños de Berta son comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Berta has a live-in partner and one 9-year-old son who is in school. Berta has a post in the 12 de abril marketplace where she sells a variety of fruits. She tends to her business every day from 6 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. 

Berta is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank and is seeking a loan of 1,000 soles for the purchase of fruit. Her dreams are to buy a car so that her partner may work and to have her children educated.

loans.use: To purchase fruits

loans.name: Melinda

texts.es: Melinda, de 33 años, convive con Edberto, de 43 años; ambos tienen 7 hijos, a los que tiene que alimentar y educar, juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia.Como mujer luchadora y emprendedora, se dedica a diversas actividades durante el día, ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar los ricos panes que vende diariamente a su comunidad. Muy ágil ella inmediatamente prepara el desayuno de sus hijos para mandarlos a la escuela; hace ya 5 años que se dedica a ello, sus panes son ricos y muy solicitados. Pero la actividad que le trae más ganancias, es la venta de Leña. Melinda compra un lote de 100 árboles los cuales corta con ayuda de peones; posteriormente los vende al por mayor a los comerciantes que visitan su casa los fines de semana; le gusta mucho la venta de leña, “No se requiere mucho trabajo y tiene mayor rentabilidad”, afirma.  Más adelante quiere poner un pequeño taller, donde pueda hacer escaños, escritorios, muebles y demás productos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP y como siempre está segura que su banco comunal le apoyara para seguir creciendo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un lote de 200 árboles con ello podrá abastecer la demanda que genera la compra de leña en su zona.
texts.en: Melinda, 33, lives with Edberto, 43; the two of them have seven children whom they must feed and school. They live together in their own home located in the locality of La Unión Leticia. As a determined and enterprising woman she carries on a range of activities during the day. She gets up very early to prepare the delicious pastries she sells daily to her community. With alacrity she immediately prepares breakfast for her children to send them off to school. She has had her business for five years. Her pastries are delicious and highly popular. But the activity which brings her the most earnings is the sale of Firewood. Melinda buys a lot of 100 trees which she cuts up with the help of laborers after which she sells them wholesale to the merchants who come to her home on weekends. She enjoys the sale of firewood very much. "It doesn't take much work and is more profitable" she states. In the future she would like to set up a small workshop where she could make benches, desks, furniture and other products. This is her ninth loan with MFP and as always she is sure her community bank will support her continued growth. With this loan she plans to invest in the purchase of a lot of 200 trees with which she will be able to supply the demand for firewood in her area.

loans.use: To purchase 200 trees

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel A. is a 40 year old married man who supports his family by operating 3 business ventures:  general store, duck raising, and tricycle transport. He lives in Mantabed, Brgy. Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental.

He has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved his family's living conditions with the help of his loans from NWTF and through his own efforts. By working hard in his general store, duck raising and tricycle transport businesses, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Joel is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that he can buy groceries, soft drinks, and rice to sell in his general store. This will be his 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of PHP 19,500, which he paid off well within its term was just another step in his journey toward economic freedom. Joel aspires to elevate his family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta B. is a widow who lives in Prk. 5, Brgy. Batinguel, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general store.  

Loreta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Loreta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock to sell in her general store, so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Loreta B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florentina;   ella tiene 59 años de edad, es conviviente; y tiene 4 hijos,  La socia se dedica a elaborara manualidades ella hace tejidos y  todo tipo de manualidades, ella trabaja en su casa haciendo carteras, sombreros, chompas, servilletas, manteles,  y más; La socia también tiene un pequeño terreno agrícola ella siembra maíz y lo vende ella ahora necesita comprar semillas, abono y prepara el terreno para la siguiente temporada de siembra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la compra de semillas, abono y prepara terreno para sembrar maíz.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Señor Pan de Azucar." The communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member, Florentina, is 59 years of age and has a live-in partner and four children. Her business is making crafts. She does knitting and makes all kinds of crafts. She works at home making wallets, hats, sweaters, napkins, tableclothes and more. She also has a small agricultural plot where she grows corn for sale. Currently she needs to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to prepare the land for the next growing season.  The member seeks the loan in order to invest in seeds and fertilizer and to prepare her plot for planting corn. 

The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan granted by this means and in like fashion commits to making her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer and the preparation of land for growing corn

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Luz es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Luz tiene un puesto en el mercado central en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama. Además Luz por las tardes vende salchipapas en la puerta de su casa.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Luz son tener un restaurante y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Tarpuy communal bank.  She lives with her husband and two children and has a stall in the central marketplace, where she and her mother sell food.  In the evenings she also sells "salchipapas" (sausage and fried potatoes) from the front of her home.

Luz needs a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) to buy rice and sugar.  She hopes to one day have her own restaurant and buy a car to transport her products.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Sandra R. es propietaria del negocio “Peluquería y Variedades Helyraf” tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años, por los que desea convertir su negocio en una sala de estéticas con oportunidades para que en un futuro sena prósperos con su empresa.
Sandra estudió en una institución el oficio de Belleza, allí aprendió todas las técnicas para lograr que sus clientes tengan una imagen impecable, formal e informal de acuerdo a su estilo de personalidad.   En la medida en que se ha dado a conocer con sus clientes, ha logrado incrementarlos y también identificar sus preferencias que dieron lugar a que implementara su negocio de vender productos de belleza y asesorar a su clientela para que los compre. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará productos de manicure y pedicure y también de belleza que combinará con una nueva oferta de mercancías como prendas de vestir para ofrecerla proximamente, mediante un catalogo de una importante empresa; con este financiamiento logrará diversificar un poco la oferta y aprovechar para construír a finales del año, justamente en epocas de gran movilidad comercial, la clientela que le ayude a incrementar sus ingresos y empezar a cumplir su sueño. Su mayor desafío es enfrentar la vida y la educación de sus hijos sola, pero con su gran esfuerzo y constancia en sus responsabilidades, logrará aportarle en la construcción de un futuro promisorio y ese es justamente su gran reto.
texts.en:
Sandra R. is the owner of "Helyraf Hair Salon and Variety Shop." She has two children, aged three and five years, who have inspired her to want convert her business into a beauty parlor with more opportunities so that in the future they may be prosperous with her business. 

Sandra went to school to be a Beautician where she learned all the techniques to help her clients achieve an impeccable image, formal and informal according to their personal style. As she has made herself known with her customers she has succeeding in adding to their numbers as well as identifying their preferences which led to the implementation of her business of supplying beauty products and advising her clientele on their purchase. 

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy manicure, pedicure and other beauty products which she will combine with the offer of new merchandise for sale such as fashionable clothing which she hopes to advertise in the near future through a catalog with a major business. With this loan she will be able to diversify her line a little and take advantage of the end-of-the-year period, at a time precisely of great commercial activity, in order to build the customer base which will help her grow her income and begin to realize her dream. Her greatest challenge is to face life and the raising of her children alone, but with great effort and commitment to her responsibilities, she will provide for them with the creation of a promising future and it is precisely that which is her greatest hurdle.

loans.use: She will purchase manicure, pedicure and other beauty products as well as some fashionable clothing to offer for sale by catalog

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Flora;   ella tiene 42 años de edad, es divorciada con 02 hijos;  La socia se dedica a trabajar en el salón de belleza, ella es cosmetóloga de profesión, y ella desea implementar un poco más su negocio,  La socia comprará algunos artículos como secadora, ruleros, papel especial para los rulos y líquidos para ondular entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  artículos de belleza.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the community bank  “Senor Pan de Azucar. ” It is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

She is Sra. Flora. She is 42 years old and is divorced, with two children. She works in a beauty salon. She is a cosmetologist by profession, and she wants to set up her business a little better. She will buy some items such as a dryer, rollers, special paper for rollers, and liquids that she uses for curling hair, among other items. She is applying for the loan to buy these beautician's supplies.

She appreciates and values the loans granted through this method, and at the same time she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: Buy beautician's supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is a married woman who lives in Totong, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: general store, livestock, and farming. Her husband Fortunato A., who is 58 years old, raises livestock and farms to earn his living. They have 1 child who is already married at 25.

Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell in her General Store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Lolita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sorayda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sorayda;   ella tiene 43 años de edad, es casada; y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la venta de maíz, ella compra al por mayor maíz y lo vende al por menor en el mercado central, ella  trabaja comprando a los proveedores mayoristas maíz y lleva a vender al mercado en la sección granos secos, ella vende todo tipo de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz en variedad y vender.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sorayda is a member of the “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR” (Lord Bread of Sugar) communal bank, located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 42 years old and the single mother of two children.

[Sorayda] is 43 years old, is married, and has two children.  She buys corn in bulk from major suppliers and resells it in the dried grain section of the central market.  She sells all types of corn.

She is asking for this loan in order a variety of types of corn.  She is grateful and values the loan facilitated in this manner and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Corn for resale

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda C. is a married woman who lives in Purok Quincihan, Brgy. 2, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Vegetable Vending and General Store businesses. Her husband, Mansueto C., who is 57 years old, works as a Crew Coordinator to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children who are 25 and  27 years old.

Gilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gilda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock for for her business, so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family. Gilda C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene G. is a 54 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Purok Palasan, Brgy. Pilar, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Rosene is now borrowing PHP 12,000, so that she can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosene aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Walter;   el tiene 37 años de edad, es casado; y tiene 2 hijos,  El socio se dedica a la venta de zapatos en el distrito de Calca; él  trabaja en el mercado modelo en Calca y tiene su stand en la cual exhibe sus zapatos para la venta. El socio requiere el préstamo para poder implementar su negocio y mejorar su mercadería, el debe comprar un poco de mercadería y organizar su negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería e implementar su negocio.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR” (Lord Bread of Sugar) communal bank, located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

He is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children.  He sells shoes from a stand, where he shows his shoes for sale, in the main market in the Calca district.

He is asking for this loan in so that he can invest into his business and improve his merchandise.  He needs to buy a bit of merchandise and organize his business.

He is grateful and values the loan facilitated in this manner and promises to make his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth;   ella tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a la venta de comida, ella elabora en casa las diferentes comidas que deberá llevar al mercado para la venta, ella también cría animales menores (cuyes y aves de corral); La socia cocina rocoto relleno, tallarines, arroz con pollo, menestras entre otros y luego de cocinar lleva ollas grandes al mercado envolviendo la olla con mantas limpias y abrigando de este modo a la olla para mantener el calor de las comidas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sillas y de insumos para su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR” (Lord Bread of Sugar) communal bank, located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 42 years old and the single mother of two children.

[Elizabeth] raises small animals and sells food.  She cooks different dishes in her home and takes them to the market to sell.  She also raises small animals (Guinea pigs, and corral birds).  She makes stuffed peppers, noodles, chicken with rice, soups, among other things.  Once she’s done cooking, she takes large pots to the market, wrapping them in clean linen in order to keep the food hot.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy chairs and supplies for her business.  She is grateful and values the loan facilitated in this manner and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Chairs and supplies

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth N. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 3, Brgy. Balayagmanok, Valencia, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   Jewelry Making , Cosmetics and Selling Dry Goods. Her husband Santiago N. who is 30 years old works as a pedicab driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 2 to  9 years old. 

Janeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Janeth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4800,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy more materials for her jewelry-making business and stock for her dry goods business so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and to purchase a vehicle. Janeth N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: materials for jewelry-making business and dry goods inventory

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio José se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida. Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y es un excelente clientes, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita crédito. El inicio este negocio por no tenía una trabajo estable, que proporcionara ingresos para mantener a su familia, siempre le ha gustado este tipo de negocio y así fue que él decide hacerse cargo de este medio de vida. Actualmente llegan muchos clientes a comprar a comprar los diferentes platillos que ofrece como gallo pinto, maduro, queso frito, tortas de carne, tajadas entre otros. La inversión de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, aceite, verduras entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en:
Silvio José works in the preparation and sale of food. He has a great desire to advance himself and he is an excellent loan customer, since this is not the first time he has applied for a loan. He began this business because he didn't have a stable job that would provide income to maintain his family. He had always liked this type of business, and so it was that he decided to take on this way of life. Now many customers come to buy the different dishes that he offers, such as gallo pinto (a rice and bean dish), ripe plantains, fried cheese, meat pies, and sliced fried plantains, among other items.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients such as basic grains, oil, and vegetables, among other necessary items.

loans.use: Buy ingredients such as grains, oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre, está casada con Caparachin, de 40 años; ambos viven con sus 3 hijos, Bryan de 15, Gimena de 7 y Florentino de 1 año y 6 meses de nacido; como una gran familia ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de la Unión. A doce kilómetros de la ciudad de (Tarma – Perú), se ubica los terrenos de cultivo de Blanca, ahí desde hace 10 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, habas y maíz, que después los vende en el mercado central de Tarma. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dirige a su terreno de cultivo donde cuida y aplica abono a sus plantaciones, aquí espera ansiosa la llegada del atardecer, ya que de regreso a casa, abrirá su pequeña peluquería; donde no solo corta cabellos,  también vende una variedad de artículos para el hogar así como objetos para regalos que los pobladores compran cuando celebran una fiesta. En su negocio es muy rentable, puesto que Blanca recibe buenos ingresos; por eso ella está pensando más adelante construir su casa propia y poder tener un espacio más grande para atender a sus clientes, que todas las noches esperan ansiosos la llegada de Blanca. Este es cuarto crédito con MFP y  está feliz de poder participar y apoyar junto a su banco comunal a otras personas que como ella quieren salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de regalos, con ello tendrá mayor variedad para sus clientes, de la misma manera suministrará su peluquería con nuevos equipos.
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 39 years old, is a very happy woman. She is married to Caparachin, who is 40, and they live with their three children, Bryan, who is 15, Gimena, 7, and Florentino, who is 18 months old. As a large family, they live in a rented house located in the district of Unión. Blanca's farmlands are located twelve kilometers from the city of Tarma (Peru). For 10 years she has planted potatoes, beans, and corn, which she then sells in the central market of Tarma. Very early every morning she goes to her fields, where she cares for and applies fertilizer to her plantings. Here she waits anxiously for the arrival of evening, since when she returns to her house, she opens her little hairdresser's shop, where she not only cuts hair but also sells a variety of articles for the home, which people buy for gifts when they are celebrating a holiday. Blanca's business is very profitable, since she has a good income. For this reason, she is thinking of building her own house in the future and having a larger space to attend to her customers, who anxiously wait for her arrival every night. 

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is happy to be able to participate and support, along with her community bank, other people who want to advance themselves like she does. With the loan that she is applying for, she will invest in the purchase of gifts so that she will have a greater variety for her customers. She will also furnish her hairdresser's shop with new equipment.

loans.use: Buy gifts and articles for the home for resale; furnish her hairdresser's shop.

loans.name: William Piter

texts.es:
William Piter M. es un joven de 33 años muy alegre, que tiene un tenderete donde vende camisetas pantalonetas, sabanas jeans, toallas y chancletas. Conciente de su responsabilidad con su familia, especialmente de su hijo de tres años, diariamente se levanta a trabajar con mucha dedicación. Aunque su actividad comenzó como un hobby, hoy es el ingreso más importante que tiene y es su empleo preferido, porque con él  ha logrado su crecimiento personal, el fortalecimiento de su autonomía y una forma de ganarse la vida.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él planea comprar ropa para el fin de año, calzado y sabanas y toallas, pues es una época de mucho repunte en las ventas y le ayudará a   aumentar su capital de trabajo y reinvertir en su negocio. William es un gran promotor de esta organización porque considera al crédito como una oportunidad de trabaja con un dinero que no contaba, y esto es lo que ha logrado con la Fundación,  con la que quiere seguir trabajando para lograr su sueño de ver crecer su negocio, como le está ocurriendo, porque  nota que cada día tiene mayor posicionamiento en su punto de ventas.
Su plan ahora es extenderse en otras poblaciones pero va a hacerlo gradualmente, para asumir el  riesgo pero de manera controlada, porque sabe que hay temporadas mejores que otras y debe estudiar con mucho cuidado, cual es el óptimo momento para iniciar su próxima aventura de tener puntos de ventas en otros municipios.
texts.en:
William Piter M. is a young, cheerful, 33-year-old young man who has a stand where he sells t-shirts, pants, sheets, jeans, towels and flip-flops.  Conscious of his responsibility toward his family, especially his three year old son, he rises daily to work with much dedication.  Although this economic activity started off as a hobby, today it’s his most important source of income and his favorite occupation because through it he has attained personal growth, strengthened his autonomy and way of earning his livelihood.

This is his second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He plans to use it to buy clothes for the end of year, footwear, sheets and towels because this is a season when sales peak and it will help him increase stock and reinvest in his business.  

William is a great promoter of this organization because he considers credit to be an opportunity to work with funds he would otherwise not have access to and this he has accomplished with the Foundation that he wants to continue to work with in order to see his dream of having his business grow come to pass as it is currently doing because he notices that every day he is better positioned in his sales points.

His plan is to expand into other towns but he will do so gradually so that he can assume the risk in a controlled way because he knows that some seasons are better than others and he has to study the situation carefully to see when the optimal moment to start his new adventure and start sales points in other towns.

loans.use: To buy clothing for end of year, footwear, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Khadim Rassoul

texts.fr: Monsieur khadim Rassoul Cisse est un jeune célibataire de 24 ans habitant dans  la localité de Yoff. Il  s’active dans la fabrication  de briques depuis longtemps. Parallèlement il fait des prestations  de services. Il  possède  une photocopieuse et  gère  un local  dans le quartier  ou il habite.  Il’ a  été surtout motivé par l’aspect rentable de cette activité.  Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff  depuis  novembre 2006. Il a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qu’il a bien remboursé .Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 destiné à l’achat d’une deuxième  photocopieuse.  Le prêt lui permettra de renforcer son matériel de travail  mais aussi d’augmenter sa productivité. Ce financement  pourra ainsi l’aider a satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa cliente et a travers l’augmentation de ses bénéfices a  mieux assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mr. Khadim Rassoul Cisse, 24 and single, lives in Yoff. He has been working making bricks for a long time. At the same time, he offers a service. He owns a photocopier and manages a little business in the neighborhood where he lives. He got into this business because of its profitability. He has been a member of the Yoff branch since November 2006. He has already been accorded two loans which he reimbursed correctly. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 300,000 francs to be used to purchase a second photocopy machine. The loan will allow him to have better equipment and will increase his productivity. This loan will also help him to satisfy the ever-growing demand for his services among his clients and allow him to earn more, so that he can cover daily expenses more easily.

loans.use: to invest in buying a photocopier

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina, de 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, convive con Roberto de 40 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos; Frank de 11, Jean de 8 y Derlis de 3 años; ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia. Todas las mañanas a primeras horas del día trabaja en un programa de apoyo, promovido por el gobierno peruano, “Construyendo Perú”; ahí se dedica a limpiar las calles de su localidad ya que el relieve en el distrito es accidentado, las quebradas, laderas o pendientes, pampas, planicies, cerros y pequeñas montañas, impide el transito de sus habitantes. Aquí Faustina trabaja arduamente para poder ayudar a los pobladores de su localidad; ya en las tardes y muy animada, se dirige a su terreno de cultivo donde hace ya 20 años se dedica a la siembra de zanahoria, papa, maíz y lechuga; los que posteriormente vende en el mercado central de su ciudad (Tarma - Perú). Lo que más le gusta a ella es trabajar junto a su familia en su terreno de cultivo, es por ello que está juntando dinero para poder comprarse su propia casa. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y está feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde encuentra alegría y progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para el maíz que está cultivando, como también semillas para el cultivo de zanahoria que posteriormente sembrará.
texts.en: Faustina is 38 years old. She is a very happy and hardworking person. She lives together with Roberto, 40 years old, and they have three children together: Frank, 11 years old, Jean, 8 years old, and Derlis, 3 years old. They live in a rented house in the city of La Union Leticia. Every morning for the first few hours of the morning she participates in a support program promoted by the Peruvian government called "Building Peru". Through this program she cleans the streets of the neighborhood. The topography is varied, including rivers, sloping terrains, plains, hills and small mountains that impede transport to the region's inhabitants. Faustina works arduously to help the population of her district.  With great energy, in the afternoon she goes out to her plantations where for the last 20 years she has cultivated carrots, potatoes, corn, and lettuce. She later sells the harvest in the central market of her city (Tarma, Peru). What she most likes is to work together with her family out in the fields. For this reason she is saving her money to be able to be able to purchase her own home. This is her third loan with MFP and she is happy to be  part of her community bank, location where she finds happiness and progress. With the loan she requests she will invest in the purchase of fertilizers for the corn she is cultivating. She will also purchase seeds to sow carrots.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her corn plantations and carrots seeds.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye  N.  est  un homme marié avec 3 enfants vivant à Yoff  .Il est pécheur de métier .Il l’a choisi  parce qu’il est  issu d’une famille de pécheur. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans cette activité  c’est  la rentabilité  de ce dernier.   Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2010.C’est sa première demande de prêt au niveau de la caisse. Il sollicite un prêt de 300 000 destiné à la réparation  de sa pirogue qui est en panne. Son rêve c’est d’acquérir une maison dans  l’avenir avec les revenus tirés de son activité.
texts.en: Mr. Abdoulaye  N.  is a married man with three children who lives in Yoff. He is a fisherman. He chose this work because he comes from a family of fishermen. The greatest attraction for him is that fishing is remunerative. He has been a member of the Yoff branch since June 2010. This is his first loan with the Yoff branch. He is requesting the amount of 300,000 francs to use to repair his fishing boat which is not in working order. His dream is to someday acquire a house using the income from his business.

loans.use: repairing his fishing boat

loans.name: Los Solidarios De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS SOLIDARIOS DE SAN ISIDRO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Chicón, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es él Sr.Eliseo él tiene 51años de edad, él tiene 3 hijos y es casado; el socio se dedica a la agrisultura , él tiene terrenos para cultivar maíz y papa. El socio es agricultor desde hace 10 años, el socio es natural de Quillabamba ubicado a 8 horas de Cusco, el radica en el poblado de Chicón desde hace 11 años y es feñiz allá, el socio solicita el préstamo para esta temporada que iniciarán las siembras de los diferentes productos agrícolas. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos, preparar la tierra.

Los otros socios son  agricultores otras se dedican a la crianza de animales, otras socias venden comida, otros son albañiles y artesanos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Here is a member of the community bank "Los Solidariso de San Isidro". The community bank is located in the district of Chicon in the province and region of Cusco.One of the members is Eliseo, he is 51 years old, he has 3 children and he is married. He is an agriculturist and he has his fields where to cultivate corn and potatoes. He has been an agriculturist for the past 10 years. He is originally from Quillabamba, a city located 8 hours from Cusco but he has lived in the city of Chicon for the past 11 years and he is happy there. He requests a loan for this season when the fields are seeded of various produce. He requests a lon to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and to ready the fields. The other members are agriculturists and livestock farmers, some sell foods, others are construction workers, and artisans. She is very grateful and she values the loan granted to her through this organization and she is committed with the payment obligations of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr: Monsieur  Djibril  D. est un pêcheur  qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il  a 40 ans, il est  marié et  père de 4 enfants. Il évolue  dans le secteur de la pêche depuis plus de 25 ans et parallèlement  il élève des moutons qu’il revend pendant les périodes de fêtes. Il  l’a choisit l’activité  de pêche  parce que depuis tout jeune il accompagnait son père  pécher. En plus c’est une activité qui rapporte beaucoup. Il est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis  mars 2004. Il a déjà bénéficié de 5  prêts  qu’il a  payés correctement. Cette fois ci il sollicite un prêt de 500  000  prévu pour  l’achat de moutons  destinés a la vente  pendant la période de  tabaski  . Avec les revenus tirés  de son opération il envisage  de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et améliorer sa situation sociale
texts.en: Mr.  Djibril  D. is a fisherman who lives in Yoff. He is 40, married, and the father of four children. He has been working in fishing for more than 25 years and at the same time, he raises sheep that he sells during the holy/feast days. He chose the business of fishing because when he was a boy, he accompanied his father who was a fisherman. Moreover, it is a business where you earn a lot. He has been a member of the Yoff branch since March 2004. He has already been accorded five loans which he repaid correctly. This time he is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 francs to buy sheep destined to  be resold during Tabaski (a Muslim feast day). With the income from this deal, he intends to pay school fees for his children and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in sheep to fatten for resale

loans.name: Alejandra Marcela

texts.es:
Alejandra Fernández es una joven de 22 años de edad que vive en el municipio de San Jacinto en el Departamento de Bolívar, su naturaleza artesanal combinada con su juventud y el dinamismo de esta edad,  la ha impulsado a crear un negocio de productos artesanales como bolsos, accesorios, gorros, correas, que ni su profesión de fisioterapeuta ha logrado desviar y al cual Alejandra  le da un toque muy moderno y novedoso. 
Este es su segundo Financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva, planea comprar materiales y mercancías variadas, así como también adecuar su local, pues desde su primer crédito ha visto como han aumentado sus clientes y permanentemente esta necesitando un capital de trabajo adicional para responderles y mas aun cuando se acerca el fin de año, pues los turistas que por su negocio pasan en esta época, son muchos y quiere llamar su atención mediante un negocio bien surtido y elegante. Alejandra conciente de su conocimiento como fisioterapeuta, también practica su profesión ofreciendo servicios a domicilio de masajes terapéuticos  entre otros y es allí donde aprovecha también para potencializar su clientela de  las artesanías, por eso ahora tiene mas clientes y un mercado mejor segmentado. Su sueño es lograr tener con su madre, que fue la persona de la cual aprendió todo lo que ella sabe y adicionarle un espacio para el ejercicio de su profesión como fisioterapeuta.
texts.en: Alejandra Fernandez is a young woman, 22 years old, and she lives in the municipality of San Jacinto in the Bolivar region. Her natural talents combined with her youth and energy have propelled her to create a business through which she sells craft items such as hand bags, accessories, hats, and straps. Not even her profession as a physiotherapist has managed to steer her away from Alejandra's business, always giving her items a very modern and trendy touch. This is her second loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo foundation (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she plans on purchasing various materials and merchandise but she will also remodel her store. She saw that with her first loan how her client base improved and how she needs a permanent source of capital funds to meet their demands, especially at year's end. There are a great number of tourists arrive in this time of year and she wishes to attract them to her well-stocked and elegant business. Alejandra is a physiotherapist and she also practices her profession offering services in the home such as massage therapy. She also takes the opportunity to sell to merchandise to her patients. Her client base has grown and it has become targeted. Her dream is to live with her Mom, the person that taught her every she knows, and to have an additional space where she can practice her profession as a physiotherapist.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make her crafts and to remodel her store.

loans.name: Mayli Cecilia

texts.es:
Mayli cecilia T.
Ella se dedica junto al lado de su esposo a la confección de  camisas en diferentes tallas y colores.  Iniciaron su propio negocio desde hace dos años y a Dios gracias tiene demanda de su producto, con lo que ella ve que sus  ventas son buenas.  Para poder atender la demanda de los clientes necesita más capital por lo que hacen una solicitud de crédito.  Tiene un hijo varón de un año y desea ser una gran empresaria como mujer de negocio, cuenta que no descansara hasta lograr sus sueños que es tener una venta de ropa en el mercado de San Pedro Sacatepéquez, tener un local, con toda clase de camisas en color y diseño y llegar a ser unos grandes distribuidores de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Mayli Cecilia T.

She and her husband make shirts of various sizes and colors. They started out their own business two years ago and thanks be to God that she has had demand for the product and has seen a good level of sales. In order to meet client demand she needs more working capital, reason why she requests a loan. She has a 1-year old baby boy and she wishes to be a great businesswoman. She will not rest until she attains her dream of selling clothing in the market of San Pedro Sacatepequez. She wishes to have a stand with all kinds of shirts of various colors and designs and to become one of the great distributors of her village.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Mame Awa

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Mame Awa  P. est une femme divorcée de 42 ans sans enfants habitant  dans la localité de Yoff. Elle s’est lancée dans le commerce  par nécessité  car elle doit assurer ses besoins vitaux. Et aussi soutenir sa maman.  Elle s’active dans le commerce de marchandises de toutes sortes (chaussures, tissus). Elle est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis février 2009 .c’est sa première demande  de crédit .Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000  prévu pour   l’achat  de tissus t de chaussures destinés  a la vente.. Le  prêt lui permettra de mieux valoriser ses gains pour faire face a ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de sa mère.
texts.en: Miss Mame Awa  P. is a divorced woman of 42 who has no children. She lives in Yoff. She got into business by necessity since she has to fend for herself and also, support her mother. She sells all sorts of goods (shoes, cloth). She has been a member of the Yoff branch since February 2009. This is her first request for a loan. She is asking for the amount of 100,000 francs to buy cloth and shoes destined for resale. The loan will allow her to make more profit so that she can support herself and her mother.

loans.use: to add to her working capital

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina is a widow with grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Berdyansk. Yekaterina sells clothing and footwear merchandise in one of the local markets of her home town. Her kiosk is located in one of the busiest city markets where multiple vendors offer almost every imaginable product to passing customers. A beautiful array of assorted clothes and shoes attracts many clients to Yekaterina’s kiosk. She has been in the trade for twelve years. Currently, she has about 25,000 UAH of working capital.

Yekaterina is a hard-worker and a talented business manager. She is very devoted to the success of her business. Yekaterina will have no problem keeping a perfect credit record in the future. This time she is requesting the amount of 8,000 UAH to improve her business by stocking more clothing and footwear items which will allow her to expand her business and clientele. This loan will not only have a positive impact on her business’ profitability, but it will go further and improve the social and economic status of Yekaterina and her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is a businessman from Berdyansk. He sells outerwear and sportswear in one of the local marketplaces in his home town. Gennadyi launched his enterprise ten years ago. Presently, his working capital is 50,000 UAH. His monthly income amounts to 10,000 UAH.

Gennadyi is seeking a loan of 11,000 UAH to increase his assortment of merchandise and his turnover capital as a result. Gennadyi believes that a wide assortment of clothing items will help him meet his customers’ needs and provide superior service. Satisfied customers will be more likely to return to buy from his kiosk and will also speak positively about his business to others, leading to further growth in his sales.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou  D. est une femme marié de 29 ans .Elle habite à Yoff  et est mère de 2 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de poisson depuis 3 ans .Elle souhaite  démarrer une nouvelle activité parallèle  (aviculture). Son souci est d’améliorer ses revenus financiers.  .Ce qui l’a motivé a faire ce choix c’est  aussi la passion qu’elle porte a l’aviculture.. Madame D.  est membre de la caisse de Yoff  depuis juin 2006. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit. Elle sollicite un prêt de  150 000 destiné à l’achat de poussins. Le prêt  lui permettra de diversifier son activité et d’accroitre ses revenus afin de pouvoir faire face aux frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Seynabou  D. is a married woman of 29. She lives in Yoff and is the mother of two children. She has been selling fish for three years. She wants to start up a parallel business, raising poultry. Her concern is to earn more money, but she is also motivated by the fact that she is very interested in raising poultry. 

Madame D.  has been a member of the Yoff branch since June 2006. She has already received one loan. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to use for buying chicks. The loan will allow her to diversify her sources of income and earn more so that she can pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase of chicks to raise

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia C. B., tiene la edad de 42 años, está soltera, y  tiene un hijo de  3 años de edad, que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Nidia también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en: Nidia Calderon Bolivar is 42 years old, she is single, and she has a 3-year old son; he is her greatest priority. The loan that she requests will be invested in her plantations, especially to cultivate coffee. The idea is to purchase fertilizers. She wants to give the coffee plantation the proper care to achieve the greatest quality product and to obtain the best profit possible after the harvest. This is the fist time she accesses a loan through Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy with the support she has received. Nidia has worked as an agriculturist for many years. She hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life in the future and to achieve a greater financial stability. She wishes to keep growing as a person and as a producer.

loans.use: To maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Lourdes Del Pilar

texts.es:
Lourdes O. tiene 54 años y vive en un barrio muy alegre llamado Simón Bolívar que según ella aglutina a la gente más carnavalera D. Barranquilla, es allí donD. se combinan las actividades educativas, productivas, con la lúdica carnavalera y justamente en este medio   ambiente residencial y D. mucho negocio, ejerce su actividad la señora Lourdes O. una mujer D. 54 años casada y con 3 hijos en las edades D. 25 a 33 años. La microempresa D. Lourdes es  una miscelánea, que como su nombre lo indica,   venD. D. todo un poco: papelería, útiles escolares, accesorios para adornar la belleza D. la mujer, detalles para el hogar etc. Como gran emprendedora la meta D. Lourdes es remodelar su casa y ampliar el espacio donD. tiene su negocio para comodidad D. los clientes y D. ella misma también. 
Este es el primer financiamiento que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a su credikiva, porque necesita prepararse para la temporada D. fin D. año y su capital no es muy granD. para hacerlo y reinvertir constantemente. Con este crédito comprará tarjetearía desechables, adornos y detalles significativos impulsando el sentir naviD.ño D. los hogares  que se preparan para disfrutar  estas fiestas en unidad y estimulando con detalles la alegría D. estas fiestas en cada uno D. sus miembros
texts.en: Lourdes O. is 54 years old and she lives in a very happy district called Simon Bolivar. According to her, in all of Barranquilla, here is where the population that most likes to celebrate and it is here where they combine educational and sporting events with celebrations. In this region is where Lourdes O. runs her business. She is a 54-year old woman and she has 3 children between the ages of 25 and 33 years old. Lourdes, the small businesswoman, has a general store, that, as the name implies, she sales a little bit of everything: office supplies, school supplies, ladies' accessories, household products etc. As a great entrepreneur her goal is to remodel her home and to expand the space where she has her business, to improve service to her clients and to supply herself with greater comfort. This is the first loan she requests from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation (Kiva Field Partner). She needs it to prepare for the holiday season. Her capital is not very substantial to reach this goal and to reinvest. With this loan she will purchase greeting cards, decorations and various traditional items that help bring the Christmas feeling to homes that prepare to enjoy the holidays in unity. These decorations will bring the happiness fo the season to every one of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase holiday decorations and supplies.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio Antonio tiene 27 años, tiene 1 hijos a su cargo. El dio inicio a su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general porque es un padre responsable. Trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche de lunes a sábados y esta persistencia logra resultados, por eso recupera su inversión, pero no responde rápidamente a sus clientes porque no tiene un capital adicional, pues sale  a vender en los mercados que es donde tiene mayor cantidad de clientes nuevos cada día, con este crédito quiere realizar la compra de bolsos, calzados, cosméticos, ropa en general y otros encargos. Su sueño es aumentar los ingresos del negocio, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mauricio Atonio is 27 years old and he has a son in his care. He started out his business selling general store items because he is a responsible father. He works from 8 in the morning until 9 at night from Mondays to Saturdays, and this hard work has yielded good results. He is able to recover his investment but he is not able to quickly respond to client demands. He doesn't have additional capital funds. He goes out to the markets to sell where he is able to capture new clients every day. With this loan he will purchase purses, shoes, cosmetics, general clothing items and other special orders. His dream is to improve the profits from his business, to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose A. V. es un ganadero  de la zona de Cartagena en Guanacaste, una  conocida como la Cuna del Folklore y la cultura  típica costarricense.
El tiene más de 10 años  de estar en el negocio de la ganadería, siempre le ha ido muy bien pero  asegura que desea  pasar a otro nivel, comprando un semental y dos toretes para engorde. 
Es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de ¢600,000 (Seiscientos  mil colones). Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar sus crías, y por supuesto se venderán a mejor precio con lo que podrá mejorar la vida de sus tres mujeres, su esposa y sus dos hijas.
El   es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena  una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Jose A. Valerin is a cattle farmer in the region of Cartagena in Guanacaste, a region known for its folklore and its traditional Costa-Rican culture. He has more than 10 years in the farming business and it has always been successful but he wants to attain a new level by purchasing a stallion and two calves. To this end he requires a loan in the amount of 600,000 (six hundred thousand colones). This investment will improve his farm and he will be able to sell them at a better price. With his profits he will improve the life of the three women in his life, his wife and their two daughters. He is a member of the Cartagena community bank and it is one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase a stallion and two calves.

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Dania F. R. ya está cansada de andar de pueblo en pueblo buscando trabajo, es por eso que ha decido montar su propio negocio, una Pollería.
Ella cría gallinas para engorde, y ahora en lugar de buscar trabajo, va por todas las comunidades vendiendo huevos y pollo.  Esto  es  en  Cartagena de Guanacaste, región  conocida como la cuna del folklore costarricense y también por su cercanía a las mejores playas del país. 
Ahora ella necesita ¢600,000 (Seiscientos  mil colones). Para comprar mas pollos y mejorar las condiciones de su local. Lo cual le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su Familia.

Ella es una nueva socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena  una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Dania F. R. was tired of traveling from village to village in search for work. So she decided to start her own business raising chickens. She raises chickens for sale and now instead of going to look for work she goes to all the various communities to sell eggs and meat. Cartagena de Guanacaste is a region known for its Costa-Rican folklore and for the best beaches in the country. She requests a loan in the amount of 600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) to purchase more chicks and to remodel her store. This will translate into an improvement in quality of life for her family. She is a new member of the Cartagena community bank, one of the 100 member organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and to remodel her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his pineapple plantations.

loans.name: Lucrecia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lucrecia De Los Ángeles tiene 48 años, vive junto a 2 hijos mayores de edad y su esposo. Ella es una señora muy trabajadora quien siempre está dispuesta a dar lo mejor de sí para brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Ella trabaja en la compra y venta de ropa usada para mujeres, hombres y niños, este es el primer crédito que realiza, por lo que se siente muy contenta con esta oportunidad, pues ella tiene 3 años de tener este negocio y lo ha hecho muy bien. Lucrecia posee muchos clientes quienes incluso le hacen pedido de ropa, es por esto que desea contar con el dinero necesario para comprar ropa en general necesaria para invertir en el negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas, lo cual es su mayor prioridad.
texts.en: Lucrecia De Los Ángeles is 48 years old. She lives with her two grown children and her husband. She is a very hardworking woman who is always willing to give the best of herself to offer her family the best. She works buying and selling used clothing for women, men and children. This is the first loan that she has taken out. She feels very happy to have this opportunity since she has been in this business for 3 years and she has done it very well. Lucrecia has a lot of customers who have even ordered clothes from her. That is why she wants to have the money to buy general clothing to invest in the business and in this way improve her sales, which is her main priority.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Unidas Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El Comité  Unidas para el progreso es D. la zona D. Santiago Misiones, se dedican a la venta D. pollos caseros, vendedora D. frutas y verduras a y empleadas domésticas.
 Son todas vecinas del barrio Ca'acupe.    
Las señoras se encuentran animadas al participar del comité D. mujeres emprendedoras ya que las mismas gracias al crédito solidario han podido aumentar su producción y abarcar a mas clientes D. las zona aledañas al ser reconocidas en su comunidad.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Alberta quien se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras. 
Ella se dedica a esta actividad  desD. comenzó con el comité.
Comenta que le gusta mucha contar con el ingreso D. esta actividad ya que ayuda para algunos gastos D. la familia especialmente para las comidas diarias D. sus familias.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The Unidas Para el Progreso committee is from the Santiago Misiones area. They sell home raised chickens, fruits and vegetables and domestic cleaning services. They are all residents of the Ca'acupe neighborhood. 
    
The women are excited to participate in the enterprising women's committee. Thanks to the supportive loans they have been able to increase their production and gain more customers in the surrounding areas, now that they are known in their community.  

One of the members is Alberta, who sells fruit and vegetables.  She has been doing this activity since the committee started. She remarks that she really likes to have the income from this activity since it helps with the family expenses, especially for the family's daily meals. 

She is asking for the loan to purchase fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegtables (apples, bananas, pears, oranges, onions, tomatoes, peppers, and squash)

loans.name: El Naranjo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “El Naranjo” se integra de 10 clientas. En él se encuentra la señora María de Jesús Guzmán R., la cual cuenta con 46 años de edad, y tiene 26 años en su negocio de colchas, pero el crédito lo quiere para comprar puerquitos e iniciar así el negocio que siempre había deseado, nos comenta que hace tiempo organizó una tanda con la cual construyó unas jaulas para poder criar a sus puercos, al conocer a la institución prefirió organizar a un grupo de señoras que como ella tenían la misma intención pero les hacía falta que alguien confiara en ellas. 

El nombre del grupo fue inspirado en un árbol frutal que caracteriza a la casa de la señora María De Jesús, la señora tiene 4 hijos, el menor de ellos es quien le ayuda a la crianza de puercos, su intención es que algún día con los créditos que la institución le otorga pueda apoyar a su hijo para que regrese a estudiar la preparatoria. Ella sueña en un futuro tener una granja y con ello tener una mejor calidad de vida, a pesar de sólo haber estudiado la primaria ella no quiere que la historia se repita con sus hijos y nietos, por eso desea apoyarlos para que tengan acceso a una educación superior, ya que ella de niña deseaba estudiar veterinaria, de ahí la inquietud por cuidar animales.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Naranjo” (The Orange Tree) and it has ten members.  María de Jesús Guzmán R., 46, is one of them and she has sold bedspreads for 26 years.  She wants the loan, however, to buy piglets to start a new business that she’s always wanted.  She comments that some time ago she organized a “tanda” (rotating credit associations formed upon a core of participants who agree to make regular contributions to a fund which is given in whole or in part to each contributor in rotation) with which she was able to build pens for her pigs but when she found out about the organization she preferred to form a group of women with the same goals as herself but who hadn’t been able to find someone who would trust them.

The name of the group is inspired by a prominent fruit tree in María De Jesús’ house.  She has four children.  Her youngest child helps her raise the pigs.  Her intention is that with loans from the institution she will be able to send her son in the future to finish high school.

She dreams with having a farm in the future that will lead to a better quality of life despite completing only elementary school.  She hopes history will not repeat with her children and grandchildren and this is why she wants to help them have access to higher education since she wanted to be a veterinarian ever since she was a little girl; thus her desire to care for animals.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Rositas Del Ocho Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Rosita del Ocho porque en donD. habitan lo nombran como barrio ocho y lo D. rositas porque dicen es la planta que más le gusta a las mujeres, en este caso a cada una del grupo. Está ubicado Ixtlahuaca D. Rayón México, es un lugar donD. las personas buscan alcanzar sus objetivos aprovechando las oportunidades que les ofrecen.  El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.

 Una D. las integrantes del grupo se llama Epifanía S. Domínguez. Tiene 48 años solo estudió la primaria, comenta que desafortunadamente no pudo seguir estudiando por la baja economía que tenían sus padres en ese tiempo y tenían que ver por toda la familia causa que no le permitió seguir sus estudios, se dedica a la cría y engorda D. puercos, es casada y tiene 1 hijo D. 20 años que sigue estudiando, día a día busca la manera D. ayudar a su esposo y así cubrir  cada una D. sus necesidades. Epifanía comercializa su ganado en Ixtlahuaca, inició desD. hace 7 años el negocio buscando que fuera una fuente D. ingreso que ayudara a su economía familiar, le ha gustado criar a sus animales y más a un le da un gran gusto porque sabe que con ello ayudará a que los estudios D. su hijo se realicen. 

Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta porque tiene la oportunidad D. comprar alimento para seguir engordando sus puercos y así poder venderlos en una cantidad más alta. También espera que con el préstamo empiece a crecer su negocio y se construya a futuro un corral más granD..
texts.en:
This group is called Rositas del Ocho because they come from from the neighborhood "Ocho" and roses are the ladies' favorite plant. They're located in Ixtlahuaca D. Rayón Mexico. It's a place where people go to reach their objectives by making use of the opportunities offered to them. This group consists of 11 members. 

One of the members is Epifanía S. Domínguez. She's 48-years-old and she only studied through elementary school. She says that she was unfortunately not able to continue studying because of the bad economy that her parents experienced at the time and they had to count on the whole family. She raises hogs. She's married and has a 20-year-old son who continues to study. Each day she looks for a way to help her husband and cover her basic expenses. Epifanía sells her livestock in Ixtlahuaca. She began this business 7 years ago hoping that it would be an additional source of income that would help her family's finances. She's liked raising her animals because she knows that the income helps her son stay in school. 

At this moment she feels very happy because she has the opportunity to buy supplies to continue fattening her hogs and sell them for a higher price. She also hopes that with the loan she will begin to grow her business and eventually build a bigger corral.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING PRIMARY MATERIALS FOR THE CREATION OF HER ARTISAN WORKS

loans.name: Iris Yanet

texts.es:
Iris es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que produce frutas como el limón, mango y maracuyá. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en un ambiente de su domicilio. Ella suele ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, tratando de que sean de buena calidad y ofreciéndolos con un trato amable. Gracias a su esfuerzo diario su negocio cuenta con buena acogida por parte de sus clientes.

Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar. Iris anhela valerse de esta actividad para seguir progresando junto a su familia. Siguiendo este objetivo ha creído conveniente ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que su establecimiento se encuentre mas surtido y pueda ampliar sus ventas para percibir un mayor número de ganancias, por ello está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Iris es una mujer entregada a su familia y que es bastante estimada por sus vecinos. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de realizar sus pagos.
texts.en:
Iris is a 32 year old mother who lives with her family in the Olmos district.  It is an agricultural area, which produces fruits like lemons, mangos, and passion fruit.  The area is in the Lambayeque province, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic needs products and groceries in a store that is set up in a space in her home.  She sells diverse products for daily consumption to her customers.  She tries to have good quality products and to treat her customers nicely.  Thanks to her daily effort, her business is well received by her customers.

She uses the income that she gets from this activity to help her husband support the family.  Iris is eager to make use of this activity to continue progressing together with her family.  

Looking towards this objective, she believes it is advisable to expand her business by purchasing more products.  This is so that her store will be better stocked, and so that her sales will increase and give her more income.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 soles.

Iris is a woman who is devoted to her family, and her neighbors think highly of her.  She has had loans from Edpyme Alternativa before, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility about making her payments.

loans.use: To buy basic needs products and groceries to expand the store that is set up in her home

loans.name: Rosalba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosalba C. tiene 41 años de edad y vive en el barrio Olaya de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias,  amenizada por los ritmos musicales afro caribe y cuna de esta cultura. Allí tiene su hogar conformado por ella y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 9 a 20 años y también un  negocio que inició en compañía de su hermano: la venta de    electrodomésticos y muebles plásticos, que iniciaron con poco capital y distribuyendo estos artículos  de pueblo en pueblo, al principio vendían  queso lácteos y luego ampliaron su campo de accione en Maicao, donde llevaban lácteos y traían   mercancía variada aun buen precio para sus clientes; muy pronto su disciplina y sus ganas de salir adelante dio sus primeros resultado: hizo crecer su negocio con mas clientes pero estaban afectados porque su capital no alcanzaba a cubrir los pedidos por los créditos de sus clientes. Fue así como se acercaron a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a su primer credikiva, con el que va a comprar mercancías como electrodomésticos menores, ropa calzado y artículos para el hogar.

 
Su sueño es  desarrollar su microempresa de manera independiente  y fortalecer su venta en otros departamentos, para generar mas ingresos y  sacar adelante a sus hijos. Aunque su mayor desafío son las lluvias, que muchas veces inundan las poblaciones que ella visita y le dificultan  el cobro de su cartera  de manera ordenada,  afortunadamente cuenta con buenos clientes y ellos le guardan lo que debe recoger, porque aprecian  su trabajo y su buena fe..
texts.en:
Rosalía C., age 41, lives in the Olaya neighborhood of the city of Cartagena de Indias.  The city is enlivened by the rhythm of African-Caribbean music, and it is the cradle of its culture.  This is where she has her home and lives with her family, which is comprised of four children from the ages of 9 to 20 and herself.

She also has a business, which she started with her brother.  They sell domestic appliances and plastic furniture.  They started with a little capital, and they distributed these items from town to town.  At first they sold cheese.  Then they expanded their field of operations in Maicao, where they took their dairy products and various merchandise to sell at a good price for their customers.

Very soon her discipline and desire to get ahead produced the first result.  They made her business grow with more customers.  However, it affected her in that she did not have enough capital to cover her customers’ orders on credit.

That is why she approached the Fundación Santo Domingo to apply for her first Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like small domestic appliances, clothes, footwear, and items for the home.

Her dream is to develop her small business in an independent way and to strengthen her sales in other departments.  She wants to do this in order to generate more income and to get her children ahead.

Her greatest challenges are the rains that frequently inundate the towns that she visits and make it difficult to collect payments  in an organized way.  However, she fortunately has good customers, and they put aside what she needs to collect because they appreciate her work and her good faith in them.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like small domestic appliances, clothes, footwear, and items for the home

loans.name: Yelixa Carolina

texts.es: Yelixa es  una joven madre de un niño de 3 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de comida y pulpería, ella inicio desde hace 3 años porque no tenía ingresos. Por lo que la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, es aquí donde llegan una gran variedad de clientes a disfrutar sus platillos como gallo pinto, queso frito, maduro, tortas de carne y pollo. Ella es una excelente cliente pues es muy responsable y se encuentra feliz con esta oportunidad. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas.
texts.en:
